number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								The Sims meets Minecraft in a survival setting. Gather resources, build your colony and take care of the emotional needs of your people. They will go about their daily business by themselves and have a strong personality, only following your general guidelines rather than being controlled directly by you. They might very well just lie down stargazing when you desperately need that wall built, or refuse to kill an attacking animal due to their pasifist background. You get fond of them over time, and when they die it is like watching your favorite Game of Thrones characters murdered. Managing their mood and keeping them motivated is actually the most challenging part of the game, and you will experience someone going on a psychotic rage killing everyone in your base because they did not care for your decoration or eating without a table, then that broken romance pushed them over the edge. So keep an eye out on those mood parameters, those are your real enemy.There is a lot to take into account in this game, and dangers and disasters lurks around every corner. Heat waves, fires, raids, dangerous animals, food poisoning, disease... And of cuorse you need to keep those mood stats high too, as there is a long list of things that will bring them down. Your settlers are picky and weak minded, the battle never ends. It is still a game that is under development, so I will not give too much criticism of the problems I found. I hope they will be fixed though. The most annoying issue is generally unfair deaths. The game is determined to kill your people and keeping them alive is a constant fight. That is a fun and satisfyiong battle for the most part. But sometimes, they just die of the most stupid reasons, which is super annoying. For example, a pasifist who refuse to protect himself may run away from a slow moving rat that is attacking. Then stop and wait for the rat to bite, then run again and repeat until dead. Obviously the right way for the AI to react would be to run inside and let your traps deal with your problem, or just run and not stop until the animal gave up. Since you do not control your people directly, you cannot override stupid behavior easily. You would have to trick the person into building something inside with a high priority for example, to get him away from the danger outside. But this wont always work well. Fighting a dumb AI should not be what the game is about, there are enogh other dangers to deal with.Another example is a pet I completely forgot about suddenly started to chase people around and kill them one by one. It was allowed to go inside through doors that are usually keeping enemies outside, so there was nowhere to hide. In a matter of seconds my whole colony was murdered. And I was not allowed to kill it. Probably a glitch.Having people or pets go on a psychotic rage and murder everyone gets old, and too often the ones you try to keep alive is the worst enemy. Most of the time when I lost my colony, it is due to them going insane over trivial things and killing everyone. It would be more fun if they were not a bunch of weak minded sissies who turn on you at the first opportunity, there are already a lot of other things to consider in this sim, and personally I enjoyed the other aspects more than micromanaging peoples mood to avoid them going on a killing spree.But generally, this is a interesting game that has a lot of details which will drag you in, and when you succeed it is very satisfying.

content:

Early Access Review
								Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!This is a Strategy Simulation survival sandbox game.Interface/Menu/SettingsThere is an ingame Tutorial!There is a Sound volume slidebar available.There is a Music volume slidebar available.There are some resolution sizes available.You can play this game on fullscreen or windowed mode.You are able to change and customize the controls on your keyboard.There is MANY LANGUAGES available! There is one for each country!There are some different scenarios available.There is a different Storyteller with each of their own effect INCLUDING a difficulty settings.You are able to download Mods.About the game.You play with some colonists and you have to build buildings, supplies, generators, turrets and many other things. To make it short, you have to rebuild everything. You are able to research and learn better things, Like television or other things. Your colonists has random attributes and skills and you are able to order them around to build and work. They could be connected to someone else or a pet. If something bad happends to the person and it may die, then the colonist will get a penalty debuff. There are alot of ways to make the mood high and low. But whenever they are too low, they will go nuts and might end up killing your colonists or destroying things. You could get attacked by mad animals or raiders. The higher the wealth of your base, the stronger the raid will be. You have to gather food, getting resources defend and do whatever you can do to survive.You can put a Seed or choose a randomized Seed.You can change the size of the world.You can choose your starting location.You are able to name your own character.You are only able to randomize a character and you can't choose their perks.Very Addictive.Game has Random things. Events/world/seed/etcAble to pause at anytime you want and speed the game up by 3 times.Has Permadeath option.There are traders and you can take people prisoners.Winter/Summer Season and Day/Night Cyclus.Save and load game is available.Other things.I am not a huge fan of early access, In fact i do not buy a game really from the EA. But I have checked some videos and this game got my attention. They update and they are still active. This game has a huge potential and super entertaining and it is worth any penny. -------------------I Give this game a 9/10

content:
Posted: August 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								If you like this type of RTS/Survival type game (Dwarf Fortress, Banished, etc) GET THIS ONE. You will not be disappointed.Basically it's Dwarf Fortress with a far more intuitive interface, making it much easier to pick up and get into. Yes, the graphics are very simple but the gameplay is rich and I don't find the simple graphics to be a distraction.Unlike DF, this game does not have layers of levels. There's just the one. But don't fret over that -- you'll find there's plenty of space. You don't get nearly as many citizens (getting 1 new recruit in this game is a big deal) but your management of those people is far more intense and individual. The game also features different AI modes which give you a measure of control over the challenge, with the default being that it will challenge you without simply throwing totally random "and now you're dead" events at you (mostly...) So overall it's a lot more approachable than DF and I would argue it's actually superior overall -- very similar depth to the game, albeit not necessarily with the same focus, and better control and oversight.My one pro-tip: your #1 concern in this game is not food or combat, although those are very important and you will do a lot of that. The #1 concern is keeping your people happy and therefore sane. Pay attention to what makes people happy and unhappy. Enemies MIGHT kill you and starvation MIGHT wipe you out and a lack of body armor MIGHT be bad but colonist unhappiness will be what ends your colony most of the time. Manage that and you just...might....live. Longer.

								One of the most accessible community management sims out there. Beginners to the genre can easily pick up this game and get into it without hours of watching youtube tutorials. The UI is mostly user-friendly and it shouldn't take long to really figure out what you're doing. Compared to other games of this type I find it hard to not recommend RimWorld over all the rest, and RimWorld is only in alpha! Despite the game being in "alpha," it feels complete. I haven't encountered many (if any) bugs and there's loads of content to enjoy at this stage in its development. The story that you create for your colony can go in many different directions. You could have one colony thrive while another one is ravaged by a pack of man-eating rabbits. Tons of replayability and enjoyment!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 29, 2016
Early Access Review
								Four guests visited my colony. One of them went berserk and attacked its nearby faction mates.His friends incapacitated him, then one of them took him and left the colony through the open main gate. The other two guests in that moment mined their way through my walls to leave after him, ignoring the opened entrance.After they left, i got a message that the faction blames me for their berserk friends injuries, loosing some goodwill with their faction.10/10 Now for the serious part ---> EARLY ACCESS REVIEW - described content may change in the future <---Welcome to the deepest sci-fi colony-builder game, i ever played. Rimworld offers hours of gameplay over just a single colony. You control your colonists in form of job priorities - you pick your best constructors to focus on constructing houses, cooks to prepare meal for others, artists to produce sculptures to make envinorment prettier for colonists. You will have to help your colonists survive through tough challenges game has prepared for you, including occasional enemy faction attacks trying to capture your colonists, surviving the sudden heat waves or dealing with some weird space ships crashing next to you... Colonists form stories Colonists always come with stories, that are interesting to watch as time passes. Everyone (even enemy attackers) have their "backstory" which informs you what the person used to be before landing on rimworld - these backstories may sometimes affect their skills levels and traits.All characters have traits that change their behaviour. You can have "lazy" colonists, that work slower than others, "slowpokes" moves slower than the others, you can have "pessimist" whose mood is always a bit worse... During the game, your colonist form a friendships and enemies among themselves, colonists may decide to get married to the ones they like or to insult the ones they dont like, which may lead to some injuries as well... (I had one colonist "insult" another one, which led him to cut his middle finger off - yes its THAT detailed!) Easier said than done Game starts in the empty land with some mountains and trees around. Your first colonists arrive and youre ready to start building. Game offers frequent "hints" during first few days telling you what to do, but there is no actual tutorial - which makes the game hard to learn. Prepare to have your colonies wasted during first few playthroughs, as surviving in wild is harder than it looks - unless you look up some guides, be ready to learn from your mistakes (and to restart few times). Official goal of the game is to survive long enough to research and build a ship and leave the planet. This will hovewer take few ingame years and even if you manage to build the ship you may not want to leave the colony and you may just want to keep expanding. Community adds a lot of variety Did you finally had a succesful run and done everything you wanted to? No problem - game offers three different "storytellers", which differs in the way random events appear. There are also 5 difficulty levels to beat.And if you feel like you want to see something new, check out steam workshop - community is currently very active with mods, that adds a lot of new unofficial content. You may decide to try out Hospitality mod, which adds interactions with guests or Zombie Apocalypse mod, which will unleash zombies against you.+ Long playthrough+ Insanely detailed information about everything (e.g. you know EXACTLY where colonists was hit..)+ Active community in workshop- No Decent Tutorial - Learn from your mistakes- Official end-game goal is not interestingGame may seem a bit overpriced on the first look, but the hours i spent and going to spend in this game (and i have much more hours off-steam) makes it worth for me even more!9/10

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								The trailers and screenshots of this game do not fully do it justice. What follows after the review is my experience with my first full game.The game is played very similarly to games like "prison architect" where the majority of your time is spent building infrastructure and economy with only minimal control over your autonomous denizens, only it adds multiple layers on top of the formula. The game is part base builder, part "sim city", part "the sims", and part "factorio" to compare to other games. Failing at any aspect of this game (villager happiness, resource management/logistics/crafting, combat, infrastructure) will end in the death of your settlement. Life holds on by such a thin thread that you might even say it's part roguelite. Add on top the concept of a "digital AI storyteller". Instead of the game throwing random disasters at your efforts, you choose a type of story teller that will progress your story with various events. These events are everything from visits from other villages, space ship parts falling from the sky, wanderers who join your village, to complete disasters. My experience:My three villagers landed on the planet, and were able to quickly build a small functioning village. Despite a few easily put down raids life was good. There was potatos, rice, fresh turkies, and hobbs was a gourmet chef. One day Eryl noticed a steel wall and felt it was dangerous, thanks for the heads up Eryl! As the fledgling colony grew so did its power requirements, and the villagers ran out of steel building a powerline to the freshly constructed walk in freezer. Well, there wasn't much steel on the map, but that ominous steel wall had plenty. The villages were dressed like cowboys, high on smokeleaf joints, and had an assortment of guns and maces, what's the worst that could happen? Senthia went down to the steel wall to deconstruct a chunk VWORP VWORP, immediately exposed and enabled were three ancient war robots. First they killed Senthia, then they started making their way to the village. The bullets fired on them did no good and were no match.  As the villagers fall one by one, a pirate raid happens at the same time. The pirates rush in with torches to set the village ablaze until they see the ancient robots. The ancient robots kill one of the pirates and the rest of the pirates flee. The village is in flames, the villagers scattered on the ground. The game ends with robots destroying every chunk of the settlement chunk by chunk.This game is amazing. 10/10. Would suffer sci-fi apacolypse again.

content:

content:
Posted: October 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								This tale begins with a small colony of three as they start building their base. Within the first 20 days of their perilous journey they recieve a notification that a lone woman is nearby running away from some pirates and is looking for protection. Not only that, but she is the mother of Alice (one of the three colonists!). The colonists gladly accept her plea and valiantly give her solace in the base while they manage to fend off the pirates with their shoddy weapons.Alice is sent to tend to her mothers wounds hoping her mother will join the colony. As her mother wakes up she is startled and begins to run away. Alice begins chasing after her mother desperatley trying to convince her to stop but with no avail. In a last desperate effort to stop her mother from running away Alice attempts to arrest her mother and bring her back to the base. This breaks out into a fight and now Alice is fighting her mother with her bare hands. They exchange punches but Alice gets the better of her mother and gives her one last punch which ends up destroying Alice's middle finger. Her mother lies there...dead.Alice now finds it difficult to do any tasks which require her to use her hands... every time she does... she is reminded of the horrific tale which destroyed her finger.10/10 - would send Alice to arrest mother again.

content:
Posted: August 29, 2016
Early Access Review
								What a gem amongst the Early Access. Been playing long before its stream arrival... And NO this is not a Prison Architect clone (that however is also a good game check it out). Think more Dwarf Fortress.Build a colony after crash landing on a planet, with very limited provisions, AND SURVIVE. Theres so many aspects to this game - base building, tower defence, resource management, exploration... I'm really underselling it here, theres really not enough room to go into all the little intracacies and nuances that make this such a fabulous game. Some of the things your colonists will get up to will either make you cry or wet yourself laughing... like when Bob couldn't get any more luciferium so took it out on the other colonists by murdering them in their sleep and then going on a rampage against nature.... in the nude.. before getting mauled by a bear.*QUICK EDIT*I also forgot to mention the brilliant soundtrack - ear candy.

content:
Posted: November 6, 2016
Early Access Review
								I start a nice little colony and work my way up to 5 settlers.  For the first few months, everything runs like clockwork: a freezer full of food, a nicely decorated home base, a plethora of resources, and good morale all around.  Everything was beautiful, and nothing hurt.After a few seasons, I start getting bored with the beginner setting.  So, stupid me, I decide to up the difficulty by one level.The next day, four pirates invade, two of which are armed with explosive ordinance.  They kill 2/5 of my colonists and burn 2/3 of my settlement down, along with 90% of my food.  My yorkie also bites the dust after bravely attacking an invader wearing body armor and wielding molotov cocktails.  I send one of the survivors to dig graves and take my attention off the dog's corpse for 20 seconds, and when I come back to order his burial, my resident psychopath has already butchered the yorkie's remains and cooked him into a simple meal for future consumption.  Waste not, want not.  Luckily, the next morning, a wanderer shows up out of nowhere and offers her services.  Unfortunately, she is a pyromaniac, but we'll get to that later.Another two days go by until the next pirate attack.  They've gotten smarter, deciding to bypass the locked doors by blowing up my walls.  No one dies, but I have several nice holes that I decide to take care of later.  Big mistake.Three days later, all hell breaks loose.  I send my hunter out to bag some deer.  That night, they [the deer, I♥♥♥♥♥♥you not] decide to get revenge, and they launch a coordinated assault of my compound, coming in through the holes in my walls that the pirates from the previous day left.  My colonists are scattered, and the deer kill one settler and cripple the three remaining.  They politely show themselves out while my colonists writhe in agony on the ground.After starvation and exhaustion start to set in, the pyromaniac's mother coincidentally crash-lands in the area.  This gives my pyro (also a doctor, go figure) the motivation to heal up, enslave her mother (I was short on colonists, sue me), and start to treat the other injured (who cannot walk).  Unfortunately, she's been in agony for so long, she suffers a mental break in the middle of surgery and begins torching everything.  She collapses almost immediately afterwards, and the rest of my colony goes up in flames, because I'm stupid enough to build everything out of wood.  In summary: everyone I ever loved burned to death.10/10 Would play Space-Pirate/Deer-Invasion/Pyromaniac-Mother-Enslavement-Genocide Simulator 2016 again.

content:
Posted: August 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								vs Minecraft: I just enjoy managing and building a base in the third person way more. There are incredibly more complicated and detailed gameplay you can accomplish with this camera shift and I love the increased depth.vs Factorio: The conveyor belt sim is mechanically deeper with a narrower focus, but Rimworld brings better theme, story progression, and broader gameplay experiences.vs Stardew Valley: Stardew is cute and loveable. RimWorld is nerdy and brutal (in a good way). Both are excellent games in two different subgenres.vs The Sims: I actually really enjoy the Maxis game. Rimworld is a more combat focused and survival themed simulation, built by nerds, so everyone gets cool guns. But I still care about social relations, food, and the decor of my building.on Difficulty complaints: There are gameplay mechanisms that address all the review complains I've seen. However, there is no tutorial nor easy way to discover them. For example, intelligent resource hauling can be managed with clever programming of the work priorities, but no one will ever tell you this.

Early Access Review
								I only learned about this game a few days before Steam release. I watched a few youtube videos of others playing to learn the controls and basic fundamentals. I absolutely adored the concept and idea behind this game, and I have to say I am not disappointed.I love all the weird, sad, funny, violent, silly things that can happen to your colonists. I like how it is down to a more personel  level of play, being able to get to know each and every member of your little community. I've played many other games like this before, but really none of them I can say equal it in enjoyment.You'll get to love and hate your little pixel guys and girls. I purchased the game and in one day I had a 14 hour marathon. If that doesn't say how much I like it, nothing else can.100 hours played mark update: Yep, still love this game. And with mods, particularly things like Aparello, it gets kicked up to a new level of awesome. I am officially declaring this the best game on Steam.

content:
Posted: July 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								Year 12.  While hunting a wild boar, Sabine is gored in the torso.  This becomes infected.  After weeks of struggle and being a burden to the team, she dies.  Later, a starving crewmember gnaws on her frozen body, then goes on a berzerk rampage in which he kills the third crewmember in her sleep.His toes are infected and he has frostbite.  In the midst of his starving madness he's attacked by three bandits.  In desperation he blows a hole in the wall of an ancient building and giant insects come pouring out, killing the bandits.He later succumbs to his infection, and dies face down in the snow.  The base, now abandoned starts to deteriorate.  Raiders and vandals come, fires break out.  There is little left but a shell, metal debris and bones.  The walls and floors are spattered with blood.  Some time later, a lone spacer running from pirates finds the place and takes refuse.  Laying on the floor she finds the grenade satchel left by the murdered engineer.  She runs to the door and waits - and when the pirates arrive she throws the grenade at the door - blowing it open and killing two of them.  The third runs off in a panic.She strips the pirates looking for anything valuable, and heads to the back of the abandoned outpost.  Claiming one small storage room as her own, she sets up a desk, bed and candle - cleans the floors and repairs the door.  Fast forward 6 months.  She sports a peg leg from where her leg was shot off by friendly fire.   Her two main fighters are both snipers.  One of them got his ear shot off, the other one has a facial scar from a fight with a raging elephant, incredible as that might sound.  The doctor just finished cutting off the cook's toes to stop an infection from frostbite.   His wife has a shattered jaw, and can no longer speak.  Solar panels are up and working, and the radio is online.  Time to find out who else is out there, and what their angle is.10/10 - Would desperately hang on for my dear life again.

content:
Posted: January 6
Early Access Review
								So after playing this game for quite some time now I decided I should write a review for it aswell, so here we go:In Rimworld you are controlling a small group of persons on a hostile plannet and your goal is it to greate a working settlement. The game will increase the difficulty over time, so you better waste not to much time.The Style is very nice in my eyes, but If your looking for HD hyperrealistic Textures this may not be the game for you.The game is often compared to Dwarf Fortress and Prison Architekt and it certainly can hold its ground against these great games.The game offfers a variety of diffrent Difficultys, so everyone can have Funn and its not gonna get boring because of a lack of challange. The Developers are adding an amazingly big amount of new stuff with every Update, and so far I never encountered a single bug or crash. (no hammering ALT F4 after killing my own mans by accident does not count here)There is a quite active Modding Community, with several diffrent Mods you can pick (the Lovecraftian Horror stuff could be worth a look for example)The Music is great and did not manage to go on my nerves so far.Just be warned, this is a game with many things to keep track of and you will fail often before you can build a working settlement. But it never feels like the Game is cheating you. (In the worst case hammer down ALT F4 if something unexpected happens and you are a whinny coward like me)One thing I wanna mention is the Humor of the game, it ma not be obvious at first but this is quite a commedy heavy game but in a very morbid and dark way.My personal Higliths are things like my Doctor getting utterly drunk before an operation and aputating the wrong leg, or things like giving shelter to someone who was chased by some tribals including his own Grandma.If you wanna see some gameplay I got some (oudated) Videos where you can see me utterly failing at building a good settelment:

content:
Posted: March 16
Early Access Review
								There's no wrong way to Rimworld.  There is no one way to Rimworld.  There is no way NOT to Rimworld.I was initially put off by the comments about how impossible the game is to win - even if the ways you lose can be hilarious.  I like a challenging game, but life has enough fail in it already - I need something I can destroy.  I bought the game anyway, and so help me, I think this game was built FOR ME.  The settings, challenges, and modes seem almost infinite in combination.  I can start a map on sandbox, switch it into a crazy challenging mode for a bit, and then settle somewhere in the middle.  I can play permadeath.  I can be torn apart by mad squirrels.  I can train squirrels and release them on my enemies.  I can use God Mode and strike down all my enemies.  Don't be put off by someone telling you that Rimworld only plays one way.  There is no one way to Rimworld.Highly recommend.

Early Access Review
								Bought this and Arma 3 at the same time, expecting to put more time into Arma 3. But RimWorld is just so much more than I thought it would be. The customization options are great and with the mood swings and all the characteristics and personality traits of the colonists it's never the same. I was slightly annoyed you couldn't pick traits but actually having them totally random is much superior in terms of stories. It's hard to grow attached to perfect characters, but this makes you care for all their little quirks. Very enjoyable. I just had my first colonist die of a heart attack and it was awful.The game feels quite complete but I'm happy to see that the developers are still thinking about adding content. I paid full price for this and I can say it was totally worth it already.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								So it starts off and your little band of randomized colonists crashland on a space-wild-west-frontier Rimworld, with few supplies and lots of problems. And you as they player plan out how these plucky colonists are going to try to survive. Different colonists have different strengths, weaknesses, and skills. Exploit them, and have them each prioritize the work that they are best at to get everything done around the colony. Someone's gotta sow and reap crops. Someone's gotta hunt for meat and leather, and others have to cook, or tailor parkas for winter weather out of that leather. And when the enraged beasts come, or the pirate raiders & slavers come, somebody's gotta shoot them dead.    Build a sick colony and hope your colonists prosper. Hope they don't become addicted to drugs, or terribly depressed, or maimed and wounded and sick. Let them bond with their pets, let them marry each other and learn true joy and live in a beautiful place filled with art and billiards tables. And watch in horror as everything you built is crushed by the unforgiving Rimworld they live on. And then pick yourself back up, start a new colony, and do better next time. Don't let them starve. Prepare for winter. Have a plan that'll kill the raiders.    It's addictive as heck.

content:
Posted: July 16, 2016
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								The dev team described the game as "Dwarf Fortess meets Firefly" and after playing for several hours, I can agree.General Concept:Hands-off unit direction (You give them a task, and someone will get to it.. when they're ready!), as you try to achieve more goals, starting from basic survival, to escaping the planet by building a ship, and dealing with random events that can either help you survive, or make your life hell.Pros:- Random Gen World- Small to Large gameplay areas- Customizable challenge/gameplay settings- Easy Start/Hard to Master- A lot of control over the base building aspects of the game- Every character has it's own personality, wants, needs and desires that you need to account for.Cons:- No direct unit control (w/exception for combat)- Random Gen World doesn't always spawn with needed resources (you are limited by in-game trade rng)- Every character has it's own personality, wants, needs and desires, and will take care of them in the order they want, not the order that might make the most sense.- Maps are currently only a single 'layer'- Single PlayerGameplay Overview:Dwarf Fortress is a good example of how the game plays, and what you can generally expect.  If you're carfeul about how you assign tasks, you can 'force' the AI to do certain things first, but at the of the day, if the character wants to sit and watch the clouds more than cook their food.. they're going to go hungry while enjoying the view!Release 14 introduces new modes expending on the core game, often increasing the challenge to the game (one scenario has you start with 1 character, instead of the normal 3), but ultimately is just a variation on the core game.  14 also introduces intergrated Workshop support for custom scenarios you build, which allows for much easier sharing of the scanrio with others.Thoughts:Overall, a fun game to sit down and kill a bit of free time with, but with enough to do to occupy a larger block of time if you have it to spare.  While the maps have various playfield sizes you can choose from, it is still only a single layer map (at least form what I've been able to find - I might just be missing something in the UI/game), but never felt 'small' or confined.  The NPC events (even teh bad events) tend to be fun (or at least as much impact you allow them to be, and provide a very real sense of 'Aw crap, what happened this time'.One thing I'd like to eventually see in RimWorld would be a variation of the random NPC 'story' archive you get in Dwarf Fortress.  You don't really see the characters 'story' recorded in the development of your colony/camp, and given the nature of the game, I think that could draw you in to the lives of the characters a bit more while increasing your emotional investment in them.Recommend?If you enjoy 'god' games where you do more influencing than directly control gameplay - Yes!Gameplay Livestream Recording:

Early Access Review
								When I saw this game for the first time, I was like "How the f**k this game has 10/10 ratings on steam with over 4,5k votes". I decided then, to download an illegal, pirate version of the game (yes, I commited a crime!) to check it out, because I thought it's impossible for this game to be worth 30$. Boooy, I was so wrong! I've spent over 8 hours straight playing old pirate version of that game, I've started my colonies several time, and everytime my colonies died, instead of being angry at the game, I was even more motivated to start over again from the beggining to create another "unperfect" colony that will die sooner or later. On the next day, I went to work and I was thinking about this game much more often, than I think about sex (and I do think about sex a LOT!). I came back from work, and I immidiately bought this game from Ludeon site, registered it on steam and started another 8-hour game session, leaving my naked girlfriend alone in bed...Conclusion: This game has stolen my life, it's by far best game I've played in 2016, it has literally unlimited potential and It's definitely worth 30$. I recommended this game to few of my friends at work, they've played pirate versions as demos, and on the next day they've also bought this game. So, if you're not convinced by the old school graphics, download older version, and If you like it, show some appreciation for developers and buy this game, because it's get better with every update!.

content:
Posted: September 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								The trailers and screenshots of this game do not fully do it justice. What follows after the review is my experience with my first full game.The game is played very similarly to games like "prison architect" where the majority of your time is spent building infrastructure and economy with only minimal control over your autonomous denizens, only it adds multiple layers on top of the formula. The game is part base builder, part "sim city", part "the sims", and part "factorio" to compare to other games. Failing at any aspect of this game (villager happiness, resource management/logistics/crafting, combat, infrastructure) will end in the death of your settlement. Life holds on by such a thin thread that you might even say it's part roguelite. Add on top the concept of a "digital AI storyteller". Instead of the game throwing random disasters at your efforts, you choose a type of story teller that will progress your story with various events. These events are everything from visits from other villages, space ship parts falling from the sky, wanderers who join your village, to complete disasters. My experience:My three villagers landed on the planet, and were able to quickly build a small functioning village. Despite a few easily put down raids life was good. There was potatos, rice, fresh turkies, and hobbs was a gourmet chef. One day Eryl noticed a steel wall and felt it was dangerous, thanks for the heads up Eryl! As the fledgling colony grew so did its power requirements, and the villagers ran out of steel building a powerline to the freshly constructed walk in freezer. Well, there wasn't much steel on the map, but that ominous steel wall had plenty. The villages were dressed like cowboys, high on smokeleaf joints, and had an assortment of guns and maces, what's the worst that could happen? Senthia went down to the steel wall to deconstruct a chunk VWORP VWORP, immediately exposed and enabled were three ancient war robots. First they killed Senthia, then they started making their way to the village. The bullets fired on them did no good and were no match.  As the villagers fall one by one, a pirate raid happens at the same time. The pirates rush in with torches to set the village ablaze until they see the ancient robots. The ancient robots kill one of the pirates and the rest of the pirates flee. The village is in flames, the villagers scattered on the ground. The game ends with robots destroying every chunk of the settlement chunk by chunk.This game is amazing. 10/10. Would suffer sci-fi apacolypse again.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful11 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								Im here to tell the TRUE, tragic tale of Family Uno, the greatest, most f*cked up family to have lived.It all started with a woman named Ryan, a man named Lyso, and a girl named AmarylzThey were a happy family. Ryan and Lyso watched over their daughter Amarylz well, and kept the family alive and happy. Ryan was prone to starting fires however, and Amarylz had serious mental issues. But Lyso didnt care. Even being shot 2 times by an old gun when he was young, he still cared for his abnormal family.So as the family is adjusting to their new life, a naked test subject comes wondering into the home of the Family Uno, named Feeb.Feeb is a great scientist, though she liked being naked, but no one really cared, except for Ryan. She was a jealous old woman. Amarylz was gay, so she loved it.Despite the ever occuring rades and house renovations, time moved on as it did.However one day, an 82 year old raider attempted to sack Family Uno's home all by himself. Ryan took her rifle and instantly downed him with a shot in his right lung. This unfortunately spelled disaster for the old geezer, so the family took him prisoner, removed his right lung, and patched him back up. You can't let an old man die! So two days go by, and it's announced that today is the ol' geezers birthday! Hooray! Not for the geezer, cause on the same day, he lost his hearing! The family decided that integrating him into the colony would spell nothing but trouble, so they let him off, wobbling to his demise.The days go on, with everything being nice and calm...oh no! Ryan has gotten into a beserk and started fires all around the house! Fear not, Lyso was used to this, and would easily pat them away behind her as she had her fun. As the days trudged forward, things were looking up! They had plenty of food and a ton of meds. But selfish amarlyz didnt like the fact that she didnt even have to work at ALL, being given Joy time 15/7. She went made, and started attacking Feeb! Feeb took a tumble and fell onto the ground, as Ryan and Lyso, guns in hand, hid inside the storage closet! She bursted in, and they opened fire, blowing her right leg clean off! Quickly after maiming their own daughter, they rushed her and Feeb to the med bay to stitch them back to health. Many days after the incident, the family partook in a game of chess, when suddenly, a woman by the name of Ladane came running into the house, trying to escape to murderous bandits following her! At the same time, the village of Cool Time Fishing were in the yard visiting. Seeing the raiders, they sprang into action, and killed them in a matter of seconds. Afterwards, Ladane joined their group as thanks.Ever since that day...things started to take a turn for the worst...constant diseases, thunderstorms, raids! No one was safe! It was so stressful on the family, that Lyso and Ryan got a divorce! Poor Amarylz! Then...one horrid night...it begun. The end of a life. Lyso sick as a dog, died in his bed from a horrid torso infection. Nothing was the same anymore. Being the only man and leader of the group, the girls had little motivation to work. Their mood was always poor, and they would constantly fight and bicker. And on a night like many other, a thunderstorm cursed the family greatly...only this time...it was the end times...a lightning bult struck the freezer that Feebs was in, and she was instantly incapacitated, and on fire! Amarylz, as quick as could be, joined with Ladane to put out the fire, but it was spreading too fast! They too have succumbed to its horrible fate, as they fell on the ground, hopelessly burning to death! Ryan could only watch, for being a pyromaniac, the sight was just too beautiful to destroy. Ryan had nothing left. No ex husband. No daughter. No naked friend. No clothed friend. Not even a working freezer room. She snapped! She lit sections of her house ablaze! Running behind a sandbag, she watched as the flames engulfed her entire house. She had no reason to continue...as she was exploring what was left of the world, she found an ancient temple. It was all or nothing! She only had this left for her as a saving grace! She slowly deconstructed one of the walls, two find two Cryogenic sleep chambers. What could be in them?! She walked over to the one nearest her, and slowly opened it up......Where "Hobo Bob" and "Janitor Mary" toating machine guns mowed her down.10/10 best family simulator

content:
Posted: October 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								This tale begins with a small colony of three as they start building their base. Within the first 20 days of their perilous journey they recieve a notification that a lone woman is nearby running away from some pirates and is looking for protection. Not only that, but she is the mother of Alice (one of the three colonists!). The colonists gladly accept her plea and valiantly give her solace in the base while they manage to fend off the pirates with their shoddy weapons.Alice is sent to tend to her mothers wounds hoping her mother will join the colony. As her mother wakes up she is startled and begins to run away. Alice begins chasing after her mother desperatley trying to convince her to stop but with no avail. In a last desperate effort to stop her mother from running away Alice attempts to arrest her mother and bring her back to the base. This breaks out into a fight and now Alice is fighting her mother with her bare hands. They exchange punches but Alice gets the better of her mother and gives her one last punch which ends up destroying Alice's middle finger. Her mother lies there...dead.Alice now finds it difficult to do any tasks which require her to use her hands... every time she does... she is reminded of the horrific tale which destroyed her finger.10/10 - would send Alice to arrest mother again.

content:
Posted: January 8
Early Access Review
								I couldn't possibly know where to start when talking about this games tredmendous quality.  It is the best survival simulation I've seen and played.  If you liked Banished...this is better.  Basically, if you've ever played Oregon Trail on an Apple II and liked it,   buy this .  There are many degrees of difficulty incase you find yourself struggling to learn or if you grasp games like this well, then you can turn up the heat.  Every game (seed) is different.  Replay value is through the roof.  Spent 50 hours on the first week.  Not sure when the euphoric state of happiness from playing this game will wear off (1 season and 9 days...you will get the joke after you play it), but right now it's not going anywhere.  If I had to be critial, the tutorial is fairly short and leaves you not as informed as I think you should. Overall, this game is well worth the money and you could call this game more complete than some AAA titles already on shelves.

Early Access Review
								This game is life.  It's one of the best Early Access games I've ever played. The Early Access tag is only there to signify that the dev is still working on this game, but it's got all the planned features done and it getting new stuff added pretty regularly.  But the best part, is the mods/workshop.  There is everything for everyone and it adds a lot to the replayability.  Each game and set up with vanilla is different and could take thousands of hours to play all the permutations, but with the workshop/mods that number grows exponentially.  There's a Mars Colony total converstion, a H.P. Lovecraft mod, and everything else.The game price has never been discounted and will likely be raised when it exits Early Access.  I put it off for a while but am so happy I finally bought it.

content:
Posted: November 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								RimWorld is a fantastic game. There's a lot of obvious surface similarities with Prison Architect, but that's no bad thing and it's also absolutely its own game doing its own things. Every game is different thanks to the complex relationships between colonists that range from hilarious to utterly tragic, and the random events that occur on your colony world provide a constant challenge, so there's a lot of replayability here. It's also very well supported and it is being actively developed and improved upon. I can definitely recommend it highly to anyone.

content:
Posted: August 29, 2016
Early Access Review
								9/10 - Here's why..There’s something more to this game than just the old - shoot that/kill that...grow that/harvest that. This game is addictive because it actually connects to the player on a personal level. Here are three examples of why.....I got raided by a bunch of pirates. I killed two of them, but the third I shot in the leg. He went down in pain, wriggling on the ground. Do I save him and nurse him back to health? Or do I execute him on the spot? .A dog wondered into my base. One of my tribe mates became fond of the dog and tamed it. It became his pet. One day the dog wondered outside the base during a pirate raid. One of the pirates shot it. After the raid it slowly died. I was unable to save it because I didn’t have the right facilities. The tribe mate who was fond of the dog became depressed and stabbed another tribesman to death..A ship crash landed near my base. The pilot of the ship wass gravely wounded, bleeding to death on the ground. Do I save him or leave him to die because I don't have enough food to feed him?.These are three of an almost unlimited amount of scenarios that can occur, that strike the player on a personal level. I really recommend this game.

Early Access Review
								This game is incredible. I could tell you a hundred stories from my time with the game so far. Perhaps of the time that my tribe of spear-wielding warriors had no choice but to ambush members of a neighbouring township for their clothes, so they could survive the -40ºC winter. Or maybe of the time that an escape pod survivor, Ezra, single-handedly held off a pirate raid while his allies were laid in bed with malaria. He lost an arm for his trouble, but he eventually made it offworld with his friends.This game creates these stories in a fantastic way, as well as being immensely satisfying to play & learn. It's so exciting that it's still in Alpha, so potentially even more interesting things are on the way!Get it!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								The Sims meets Minecraft in a survival setting. Gather resources, build your colony and take care of the emotional needs of your people. They will go about their daily business by themselves and have a strong personality, only following your general guidelines rather than being controlled directly by you. They might very well just lie down stargazing when you desperately need that wall built, or refuse to kill an attacking animal due to their pasifist background. You get fond of them over time, and when they die it is like watching your favorite Game of Thrones characters murdered. Managing their mood and keeping them motivated is actually the most challenging part of the game, and you will experience someone going on a psychotic rage killing everyone in your base because they did not care for your decoration or eating without a table, then that broken romance pushed them over the edge. So keep an eye out on those mood parameters, those are your real enemy.There is a lot to take into account in this game, and dangers and disasters lurks around every corner. Heat waves, fires, raids, dangerous animals, food poisoning, disease... And of cuorse you need to keep those mood stats high too, as there is a long list of things that will bring them down. Your settlers are picky and weak minded, the battle never ends. It is still a game that is under development, so I will not give too much criticism of the problems I found. I hope they will be fixed though. The most annoying issue is generally unfair deaths. The game is determined to kill your people and keeping them alive is a constant fight. That is a fun and satisfyiong battle for the most part. But sometimes, they just die of the most stupid reasons, which is super annoying. For example, a pasifist who refuse to protect himself may run away from a slow moving rat that is attacking. Then stop and wait for the rat to bite, then run again and repeat until dead. Obviously the right way for the AI to react would be to run inside and let your traps deal with your problem, or just run and not stop until the animal gave up. Since you do not control your people directly, you cannot override stupid behavior easily. You would have to trick the person into building something inside with a high priority for example, to get him away from the danger outside. But this wont always work well. Fighting a dumb AI should not be what the game is about, there are enogh other dangers to deal with.Another example is a pet I completely forgot about suddenly started to chase people around and kill them one by one. It was allowed to go inside through doors that are usually keeping enemies outside, so there was nowhere to hide. In a matter of seconds my whole colony was murdered. And I was not allowed to kill it. Probably a glitch.Having people or pets go on a psychotic rage and murder everyone gets old, and too often the ones you try to keep alive is the worst enemy. Most of the time when I lost my colony, it is due to them going insane over trivial things and killing everyone. It would be more fun if they were not a bunch of weak minded sissies who turn on you at the first opportunity, there are already a lot of other things to consider in this sim, and personally I enjoyed the other aspects more than micromanaging peoples mood to avoid them going on a killing spree.But generally, this is a interesting game that has a lot of details which will drag you in, and when you succeed it is very satisfying.

content:
Posted: August 18, 2016
Early Access Review
								I was reluctant to buy this game, being an Early Access game with simple graphics and a hefty price, but i'm so glad i changed my mind.Trying to explain what the game is really hard, due to all mechanics it have, so i'll focus on what i would want to know:This game is what I've been wanting to play my whole life and didn't knew, this is the beautiful son of Dwarf Fortress and The sims, in a very awesome way.The mechanics are deep,but not drag the game down, the learning curve is sometimes brutal, but lovely, the colonist have a lot of "personality" and the most memorable stories are created by how faulty they are, as i said, think of dwarf fortress but focusing more in your dworfs as single beings. Also, while this is an Early access game,this development is more like a Don't Starve EA, the updates are very "feature complete", you won't get a bunch of features that don't work or need a lot of balancing, you get one or two per version, but they are solid, tested and pretty much bug free, with a  few hotfixes solving the problems, this make the game looks like a complete game that is always evolving.The updates come in a steady way, 2 or 3 months per big update.The modding community is healthy and very active, the developer is very present in both the official forums and in the Reddit subreddit, implementing some suggestions and ignoring the ones that didn't fit the game.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 18, 2016
Early Access Review
								Rimworld. Kept hearing about this game from my friends but wasn't sure it was for me. I'd played countless hours of Dwarf Fortress over the years and I couldn't see anything this game provided that DF didn't already have.Never have I been so wrong.There's a lot of goodness in the way the game plays out. The interactions between your colonists or "pawns" as they are often referred to is deep and interesting. Like many other games, you collect resources and build with them but the similarity ends there. There's also a rich faction model and a moderately well-designed combat system. You can expect your colony to be visited by traders, raiders, orbital trade vessels, and even survivors crash-landing in escape pods who need your help to survive their injuries.The modding community is going strong, even though the game is still in early access. There's medieval mods which turn it from a pure sci-fi game (though the sci-fi is admittedly weak on laser beams and high-tech staples) to a deranged Renaissance fair gone horribly wrong. There's even a mod which puts you square in the middle of a zombie apocalypse, as if dealing with raiders, toxic fallout, and the occasional volcanic winter wasn't enough. Sounds too hard? You control the threat level by picking a "storyteller", which is a great new thing I have not seen in any game before. The difficulty level also can be changed from where it launches exploding antelopes during a solar flare that destroyed your electronics down to where free food reigns down from space in cargo pods.The game has a lot of replayability already, new mods are being added every day, and the game is STILL in early access. I'm very keen on getting my money's worth out of video games, and with the wealth of choices available today there's no reason the discerning purchaser shouldn't be. However this is one of those gems you will play a lot, particularly if you're a fan of building and colony sims ... or a Dwarf Fortress fanatic like me.

content:
Posted: September 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								Rimworld is just an exceptional game. Take some characters from "The Sims", choose their new homeworld, and shoot them into survival space pods across the galaxy. Once they crash down it is now up to you to manage their daily lives. Some will be better assigned as a hunter/gatherer, and at times, a soldier. Others are your doctors, harvesters, crafters, cooks, farmers, and ranchers. How you go about assigning tasks to these people depends on the needs of the basecamp and the capacity of your community.Some days you may have a disgruntal citizen as he just got dumped by his fellow survivor, had to then sleep on the floor during a heatwave since there was a lack of proper beds and now has contracted an infection because the injury sustained while hunting a "Muffalo" never got treated in a sterile environment. Now he may die from the infection. Oh, and his dog died yesterday. Hero to zero in one day. Of course you don't want to lose this survivor as he is the only one skilled with ranged weapons for protection and the raiders are due for an attack soon. So you re-prioritize the day to have the survivor who dumped the guy provide treatment with the medical supplies you purchased from a roaming trade caravan the day before. Luckily when you setup your game you rolled a sweet doc and the infection gets resolved.    Each one of your survivors has a random skill set, relationships with others, past medical history, and postive and negative traits. All of this comes with random rolls when first setting up a game. You can custom any part of the game, from starting technologies, amount of people to start with, materials at your disposal. Everything is customizable and worlds are procedural. Replayability ++.  This game is for those who like managing resource gathering and base building, balancing social and personal needs, and simply combat.  The development is on going and very active so you may need to lose a save game from time to time but ultimately I've found no issue starting over and trying new strategies; Rimworld is that good of a game.  After all, its a whole new game each time. It's a buy.

content:
Posted: July 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								Ignore my hours in-game, I've had this since around Alpha 5 or 6. However with it now being on Steam, this game needs as many great reviews as possible given how much time, effort, and heart Tynan Sylvester has put into it. I'm not one to write reviews often. I think I have written a total of at most 3 out of my 150+ library, but this game above all others really deserves it. So few games have balanced so many game genres in such an addictive and entertaining way. I've purchased multiple copies of this for friends simply because I can't recommend it enough to anyone who enjoys sandbox, survival, strategy, drama, almost any genre of game. And the modding community (and the support they get) is just as fantastic, along with the community itself. Everyone who plays this always has a few great stories of misery or triumph to walk away with, and then come back for another 4 month binge. Tynan Sylvester has truly made one of the finest games of this generation, and the only real issue I see with it is what little coverage it seems to get. Now that it's on Steam though, hopefully that'll change.10/10, would cannabalize again. Well done, Tynan.

								I've never actually posted a review in Steam, and I've never played a game like Rimworld. By that I mean top down view, that and side scrollers just aren't my style. I was even nervous purchasing it. Then I realized I will never regret it. This game s amazing, the stories that come up just from normal gameplay are amazing. My pig farm, was struck by lightning, most of the herd was killed instantly, the fences caught on fire, and my house almost went with it. I sat there in amazement that my entire heard just died from a freak accident in less than a second, as my colonists enjoyed their last pork dinners for a long while. The complexity of Rimworld is extremely deep, the basics are easy to pick up, and the story of what happens to your people will be unparalleled.

Early Access Review
								One of the few Kickstarted games that lives up to the hype, meets literally every single one of its stated goals, and is actually a fun game.There's a ridiculous amount of depth in RimWorld: shooting people hits body parts, body parts can get scarred and infected, a dirty hospital increases the chance of diesease and infection plaguing your colony. A colonist dies because of a weakened immune system from old age, and then their daughter goes berserk and punches someone else.RimWorld is one of the Dwarf Fortress-like games that can actually match the depth in mechanics, but presents gameplay in a much cleaner art style and has a straightforward UI. For those worried about the amount of content: there's a metric ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of mods. Mods as far as the eye can see, and the game is really easy to mod.

content:
Posted: July 29, 2016
Early Access Review
								Four guests visited my colony. One of them went berserk and attacked its nearby faction mates.His friends incapacitated him, then one of them took him and left the colony through the open main gate. The other two guests in that moment mined their way through my walls to leave after him, ignoring the opened entrance.After they left, i got a message that the faction blames me for their berserk friends injuries, loosing some goodwill with their faction.10/10 Now for the serious part ---> EARLY ACCESS REVIEW - described content may change in the future <---Welcome to the deepest sci-fi colony-builder game, i ever played. Rimworld offers hours of gameplay over just a single colony. You control your colonists in form of job priorities - you pick your best constructors to focus on constructing houses, cooks to prepare meal for others, artists to produce sculptures to make envinorment prettier for colonists. You will have to help your colonists survive through tough challenges game has prepared for you, including occasional enemy faction attacks trying to capture your colonists, surviving the sudden heat waves or dealing with some weird space ships crashing next to you... Colonists form stories Colonists always come with stories, that are interesting to watch as time passes. Everyone (even enemy attackers) have their "backstory" which informs you what the person used to be before landing on rimworld - these backstories may sometimes affect their skills levels and traits.All characters have traits that change their behaviour. You can have "lazy" colonists, that work slower than others, "slowpokes" moves slower than the others, you can have "pessimist" whose mood is always a bit worse... During the game, your colonist form a friendships and enemies among themselves, colonists may decide to get married to the ones they like or to insult the ones they dont like, which may lead to some injuries as well... (I had one colonist "insult" another one, which led him to cut his middle finger off - yes its THAT detailed!) Easier said than done Game starts in the empty land with some mountains and trees around. Your first colonists arrive and youre ready to start building. Game offers frequent "hints" during first few days telling you what to do, but there is no actual tutorial - which makes the game hard to learn. Prepare to have your colonies wasted during first few playthroughs, as surviving in wild is harder than it looks - unless you look up some guides, be ready to learn from your mistakes (and to restart few times). Official goal of the game is to survive long enough to research and build a ship and leave the planet. This will hovewer take few ingame years and even if you manage to build the ship you may not want to leave the colony and you may just want to keep expanding. Community adds a lot of variety Did you finally had a succesful run and done everything you wanted to? No problem - game offers three different "storytellers", which differs in the way random events appear. There are also 5 difficulty levels to beat.And if you feel like you want to see something new, check out steam workshop - community is currently very active with mods, that adds a lot of new unofficial content. You may decide to try out Hospitality mod, which adds interactions with guests or Zombie Apocalypse mod, which will unleash zombies against you.+ Long playthrough+ Insanely detailed information about everything (e.g. you know EXACTLY where colonists was hit..)+ Active community in workshop- No Decent Tutorial - Learn from your mistakes- Official end-game goal is not interestingGame may seem a bit overpriced on the first look, but the hours i spent and going to spend in this game (and i have much more hours off-steam) makes it worth for me even more!9/10

content:
Posted: October 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								This tale begins with a small colony of three as they start building their base. Within the first 20 days of their perilous journey they recieve a notification that a lone woman is nearby running away from some pirates and is looking for protection. Not only that, but she is the mother of Alice (one of the three colonists!). The colonists gladly accept her plea and valiantly give her solace in the base while they manage to fend off the pirates with their shoddy weapons.Alice is sent to tend to her mothers wounds hoping her mother will join the colony. As her mother wakes up she is startled and begins to run away. Alice begins chasing after her mother desperatley trying to convince her to stop but with no avail. In a last desperate effort to stop her mother from running away Alice attempts to arrest her mother and bring her back to the base. This breaks out into a fight and now Alice is fighting her mother with her bare hands. They exchange punches but Alice gets the better of her mother and gives her one last punch which ends up destroying Alice's middle finger. Her mother lies there...dead.Alice now finds it difficult to do any tasks which require her to use her hands... every time she does... she is reminded of the horrific tale which destroyed her finger.10/10 - would send Alice to arrest mother again.

content:
Posted: November 14, 2016
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								Dwarf Fortress was a game I played a few years back, and one I would like to play again when it 'eventually' gets closer to completion. RimWorld helps to scratch that itch of managing a colony though, and it does it well. As of this review, I have been playing the game during Alpha 15. I can safely say that this is an excellent game that I've poured several hours already without fully mastering all RimWorld's content.For what its worth, RimWorld is a fantastic game in the colony builder genre. Compared to Dwarf Fortress it perhaps dumbs down some things - like having you mine steel out of walls instead of mining iron and working it into steel first. However if you can get past some of the simplification there is still quite a bit of depth in the game. There is a still caring and managing of your different colonists through assigning them all different work tasks and ensuring they are fed and happy; and while you probably won't have failure due to tantrum spirals, you still have to watch out for the safety of your colonists - be it from dangerous predators, roving raiders, infectious diseases, and rather 'fickle' weather.Something to bring up as well is that if you are coming from Dwarf Fortress, or just picking up a colony builder game for the first time, you won't be spending a whole lot of time trying to figure out how to play. The game features a very basic tutorial - and even without the tutorial the game has a sweet user interface which makes it very easy to actually sit down and just play the game.I certainly encourage buying this game, even in Early Access. It does indeed play quite well without much in the ways of irritating bugs, and the developer seems quite busy in continuing to add new content to the game as well. Check It Out.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 20, 2016
Early Access Review
 Rimworld is	 is a carefully thoughtout survival title and a basebuilding game if you can survive long enough. This is my 1st time playing the game after watching countless Let's Play from YouTubers like Cromulent Archer who has many playlist covering each major update and Yeti who has some interesting campaign twists that are too fun to pass up. I loved the direction the developer was going from the beginning.It should be said from the jump that this is a polarizing title as some people will find it frustratingly difficult to learn while others will see the learning curve as a worthwhile hurdle and get micro-nergasms when they see things play out perfectly. Difficulty -This title will not hand-hold and honestly does very little in building a strong tutorial that gives the player full understanding of some of the extremely in-depth mechanics here. My suggestion: play the game on an easy mode and learn from there before jumping into the game full-on. This will get you to the point that you can make and experiment with all the tools at your pawns/colonist's disposal.-The challenge increases as your base value increases.-Social Dynamics among colonists plays a large role in either succeeding or drunken binges that end in fights that can result in colonists killing each other.-This game is hard. Colonists will die, lose limbs, become depressed, be kidnapped, have affairs etc.... when it's not hard it becomes rather dull in my opinion, as most survival games can be. Fortunately, that's when you drink your beer/coffee. User Interface/Commands -Possibly the most polarizing part of recommending this game or not is the ability or desire to learn how to play the game. Likely, most people, including myself, will treat it like a RTS game and instantly be lost in how to make things happen. I found myself using the  Wiki [rimworldwiki.com] ALOT.-Rarely do you directly control your colonist. You can gauge how well you're doing by how often you need to directly control them. Your goal is to fine tune their priorities and zones to a point that they eventually run themselves a majoritiy of the time. (there is downtime that you can enjoy a coffee or beer while waiting for an event to happen but I like both coffee and beer so not always bad)-There will be times that you do not know where to click to make something happen. I Should say I'm not sure that is avoidable given the amount of options. The developer did a good job of making some command intuitive however I would suggest changing keybinds once you become more comfortable. Not a problem for clicky gamers, however.-You can alter almost the entire HUD fairly easily.-This game is like coding a program without the script.- This game is an Object-Oriented programmers dream. Depth/Replayability -There is information about everything. Want to know how old the tree is you're about to cut down? It's there. Want to know if your colonist has a pirate nephew? Who wouldn't? It's there. This game has depth.-This is not a casual title. Not even slightly. Can't think of anything hear a casual gamer would enjoy. Even starting a new game can take a long time to prepare.-Make your own backstory/challenges/campaigns/colonists. This is a sandbox game that gives you not only the box and sand, but the bucket, shovel, weeds and rain.-Mod Support. Developer encourages it and often does updates that will conflict with them as little as possible. In-Short -Not for Casual gamers-Step learning curve-Insane Depth and replayability-Content vs. price makes this an amazing value

content:

Early Access Review
								Incredible game. At times it's survival drama where you lose days to sickness, lose animals to predators, limbs to explosions and your companions to attacking tribes. At other times survival horror, executing prisoners while sealing off excavated caves filled with ancient dangers who want to end your time on their Rimworld. Then sometimes it's survival fun, everything is working, your crops are growing and the five people who tried to raid you are lying naked in your courtyard while you consider whether or not to feed them to your pack of Yorkshire terriers or harvest their organs to sell to orbital traders.Menu heavy, and slight learning curve. However the narratives that play out everytime among my survivors in this alpha game are amazing and at times rival AAA storytelling.Randomly generated everything means tons of content and reasons to build another base and keep trying.Perma death is a nice option, and my preferred playstyle. But there is always the option to not turn it on.

content:
Posted: July 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								The legend of Gareth.Gareth was a rich man, here to start his new life alongside his best friend Olive, a cat. He landed on a strange new planet and quickly established a base in an old ruin, building a farm and beds to ensure the best life for him and Olive. One day whilst farming Gareth spotted a man in the distance, stumbling across the wasteland. This is how Gordon was introduced to Gareths simple but happy life. Gordon didn't have many skills, in fact, Gordon had no skills. He was a nudist and a pacifist, allowing Gordon to deal with any threats that may come to Garethville. He took a shine to the Potato patch and spent his days farming away, rarely getting involved in anything other than his crops.Life went on in Garethville. Olive, Gareth and Gordon lived out many days happily, trading with the locals and establishing their small outpost into something they could love, a home. Things were going well, untill a shadow from Gareths past arrived, Tiffy. Tiffy was Gareth's ex lover from a his old life, determined to reunite with him. She landed badly, broken and unconcious. Gareth almost left her to bleed out in the rain, and she would have done if not for Gordon. Gordon decided potatoes were not enough for him, and with his sweaty naked body he carried Tiffy back to Garethville.Tiffy spent many days recovering, while being tended to by Gordon. Gareth stayed out the way, not wanting to confront his past. He instead occupied his time with the incresed bandits in the area. After a raid, Gareth noticed movement in the corpses. A peg legged man with a mohawk, lay unconcious and bleeding from the multiple gunshot wounds Gareth had just inflicted upon him. Taking pity on the man, Gareth brought him home to Garethville, placing him in the medical ward alongside Tiffy.Everything was gong well, Tiffy was recovering, and the man (whom Gareth had named Peggo) seemed to be getting better. In the end however, it would be Gordon, the nudist pacifist that undid everything Gareth had worked so hard to accomplish. An illness came in the night and took Peggy, causing Gareths crazy ex to eat his corpse as Gordon was late with breakfast. This sent Tiffy even crazier and she started to knock down the door. Not wanting anything to do with violence or fixing the mess he had caused by bringing her here, Gordon went back to tending his crops. As Gareth was deciding how to deal with the situation another bandit raid attacked. Four of them this time, more than Gareth had ever faced alone. Gareth decided to deal with Tiffy first, kicking down the door and attempting to knock her out with his bullets. Unfortunately she didnt survive the fight, what a shame. Gareth made his way past the crops and the ever useless Gordon to fight the bandits alone. The battle was long and Gareth held his own, killing 3 of them. The fourth got a lucky shot, curving round the side of his cover. Gareth fell, knocked out but alive, bleeding in the dirt he had worked so hard to defend. Gordon didnt care, Gordon wouldnt fight. Gordon just wanted to look after the potatoes. He watched from a distance as Gareth was carried from his home over the shoulder of a raider, never to been seen again. Moral of the story. Never trust nudists.

content:
Posted: July 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								So, I've been playing this game since Alpha 8(it's currently 14c). I've certainly put in more than 100 hours, and have tried lots of different kinds of mods, but I mostly prefer a mostly vanilla+vanilla-like mods.Rimworld has come a long, long way, and it has been consistently fun. The interface has improved quite a bit, and the features added have only made the game grow in depth. I'd still like to see the game move into the Z-axis(elevation) and thus give us the ability to build upwards, or dig underground, but for now being on a single Z-level is fine.The mental and emotional sophistication of the colonists has improved by leaps and bounds, and where they used to be replacable fodder that you thoughtlessly sent into battle, they are now much closer to organic characters. They have need and relationships with each other. They fall in love and get married(no babies though?). They get into fistfights when they disagree, and care deeply for their pets. They hide in their rooms when someone they care about dies, or if they've seen too much battle. Some of them can be emotionless sociopaths, while others can be nervous wrecks. It makes you feel a lot more interested in replacing lost body parts, and doing your best to help them recover; not so they can be ready for the next fight, but so they can get back to living their lives.If I have a complaint, it's pet animal AI. When you muster your colony to battle, the animals attend their masters and often hang around in line of fire, regardless of whether you've released them to attack or not. The only alternative at the moment is to attach all the animals to one non-combatant trainer(assuming their animal handling skill is high enough to handle the highest-skill-req animal) and keep that trainer well away from the battle, reducing your manpower. All I need is the ability to quarantine non-battle animals, or to get them to get behind the gunners until battle has closed to melee.All in all, I think that Rimworld has a ton of love and care put into it already, and the potential for more only continues to unfold. Built in mod support allows for tons of expandability, and years of continuous development seems to only be ramping up rather than slowing down. This is a game that seemingly started out as a Dwarf Fortress-like in space with a better interface, and is quickly turning into its own legend as a uniquely PC-gaming experience. You could wait for the game's official release, but I will say now: the game is wonderful in its current state, and looks like it will only get better.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 16, 2016
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								The dev team described the game as "Dwarf Fortess meets Firefly" and after playing for several hours, I can agree.General Concept:Hands-off unit direction (You give them a task, and someone will get to it.. when they're ready!), as you try to achieve more goals, starting from basic survival, to escaping the planet by building a ship, and dealing with random events that can either help you survive, or make your life hell.Pros:- Random Gen World- Small to Large gameplay areas- Customizable challenge/gameplay settings- Easy Start/Hard to Master- A lot of control over the base building aspects of the game- Every character has it's own personality, wants, needs and desires that you need to account for.Cons:- No direct unit control (w/exception for combat)- Random Gen World doesn't always spawn with needed resources (you are limited by in-game trade rng)- Every character has it's own personality, wants, needs and desires, and will take care of them in the order they want, not the order that might make the most sense.- Maps are currently only a single 'layer'- Single PlayerGameplay Overview:Dwarf Fortress is a good example of how the game plays, and what you can generally expect.  If you're carfeul about how you assign tasks, you can 'force' the AI to do certain things first, but at the of the day, if the character wants to sit and watch the clouds more than cook their food.. they're going to go hungry while enjoying the view!Release 14 introduces new modes expending on the core game, often increasing the challenge to the game (one scenario has you start with 1 character, instead of the normal 3), but ultimately is just a variation on the core game.  14 also introduces intergrated Workshop support for custom scenarios you build, which allows for much easier sharing of the scanrio with others.Thoughts:Overall, a fun game to sit down and kill a bit of free time with, but with enough to do to occupy a larger block of time if you have it to spare.  While the maps have various playfield sizes you can choose from, it is still only a single layer map (at least form what I've been able to find - I might just be missing something in the UI/game), but never felt 'small' or confined.  The NPC events (even teh bad events) tend to be fun (or at least as much impact you allow them to be, and provide a very real sense of 'Aw crap, what happened this time'.One thing I'd like to eventually see in RimWorld would be a variation of the random NPC 'story' archive you get in Dwarf Fortress.  You don't really see the characters 'story' recorded in the development of your colony/camp, and given the nature of the game, I think that could draw you in to the lives of the characters a bit more while increasing your emotional investment in them.Recommend?If you enjoy 'god' games where you do more influencing than directly control gameplay - Yes!Gameplay Livestream Recording:  


YouTube™ Video: Surprise Live Stream - Rimworld | Alpha 14 Preview
