content:
Posted: July 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								Tthe thing with rimworld though is it's not a "game" persay. It's a story, which is why suddenly and out of nowhere your entire colony is brutally slaughtered by some terrible event. You have 3 different story tellers. One of them, Randy Random can literally drop a giant pirate raid very soon after you crashland, your colony is dead and your story ends. Or you could survive for a little while, or you could survive long enough for you to build a new starship and escape the planet. Rimworld is a story, of survival and hardship. Your colonists suffer ilnesses, infections, injuries. They can lose limbs, eyes etc. They can get dementia, a bad back. A brain injury. Missing eyes. They can also fall in love, get married. Then you have families, a raiding part might attack and one the raiders if the brother of one of your colonists. Then there are rivaleries, just like in the realy world people don't always get along. Say a colonist dies, now a couple other colonist might've been good friends so they'll get a massive hit their mood, as a close friend died but another colonists hated them and now they're dead they're happy and have a spring in their step. Every colonist has traits and backstorys that are randomly generated. Some may be pyromaniacs, others may be cold tolerant, again others might be alcholics, drug addicts, hard works and the list goes on. For bakcstories, they may have been surgeons, builders, bounty hunters, royality and the list goes on. It's a very deep game and immensely satisfying. Unlike other random colony or city builders you get very attached to these colonists because of how deep this game is.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								I played this game already for countless hours before the steam release and I'm still doing so.it won't get boring, one of the advantages of a large and very good modding community. You will alway find new challenges to master. Make sure to visit the forums though, you won't find all the good mods on steam.In general, I can highly recommend this to any player who likes base building games, with a lot of strategic decisions mixed with the strong survival aspect of the game.As most of the reviews mentioned, there are a many similarities to "Prison Architect", due to the angled top down view and the the building system ( single blocks, put together to build your desired colony / prison ).I played some Prison Architect, but I never really enjoyed it, so I can say I like RimWorld a lot better!You can play your colony simply as a base builder, recruit people and have a prospering place to live. Or you can go hardcore, fight against nature and hostile factions. There is surely a setup you will enjoy. From basebuilder to real struggle to survive is everything included. This game offers you a real challenge if you are up to it!Theres is a lot of detail to the game and your colonists. Social interactions with other colonists, ranging from hate to marriage. A health system where you can lose and replace limbs and organs. Individual traits for the colonists making them a super soldier, doc or that guy who is always on the edge to a mental break.The combat system is divided into melee and ranged and you can get into big and epic firefights when 20 pirates start to raid your colony and you have to defend against them. You can set up your defensive system over the whole map and generate a new layout never seen before.Set up a big prison wing to keep all the prisoners, captured during enemy raids and convince them to join you.There are not only human threats, but also mechanoids, advanced killing machines, which can be the end to an unprepared colony. Nature itself can make it a struggle to feed everybody, when the sun is covered for months during a volcanic winter. Or a solar flare disables your heaters when its -60°C outside.A lot can happen and there is enough material for a very good story.This can make your first start a bit tricky, but over the course of time you will learn to deal with each situation and I'm sure at some point, there will be another great colony somewhere in the endless vastness of space ... There are complaints about the lack of multiplayer, but I think they are unjustified. There is no real need for it. However, I can agree that I would enjoy to visit or raid other colonies, AI or not. It goes hand in hand with the fact, that you are currently restricted to the piece of land where you start. There is no possibility to take a few colonist and wander off to start another colony on the same planet ( a generated map from where you can choose your start biome ). This would allow you to trade and do all the interactional stuff and I would love to see that.Always keep in mind that this is still an Alpha version and that there is a lot of time to implement mechanics into the game.I give a lot of credit to the developer, he keeps every new version perfectly playable. With each update there is new content to explore.If you are still not sure whether you should buy this game, there are a lot of videos about it. I already made several Let's Plays myself with various setups. You can check out the newest one here: 


YouTube™ Video: RimWorld Alpha 14 | Part 01 | Modded w/ CombatRealism | Pawn Creation & Custom Scenario 

			Views: 127		

			The two of you were living peacefully on a distant planet, somewhere in the endless vastness of space. One day raiders assaulted your hometown and imprisoned every survivor.		

This is the corresponding playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLHHfuzUMWiggnx2gXvNknHaw72KtXtxCY

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 27
Early Access Review
								Surprisingly good - this is the best way of describing RimWorld.  The last time I played an indie game with as much potential for replayability was FTL.  If you liked FTL, I'll take a leap here and say you will like RimWorld.  Very different in its concept, but similar in it's addictiveness and replayability which for me is really important.Each time you start a new colony the experience is slightly different.  Obviously there are similarities between games which have had me sighing a little when a colony goes wrong and I have start a new one, but on a whole its quite fresh each time a new game is started.  You build a base from scratch and collect resources, but the little people you start with have real vices and personalities, some are hard workers, some lazy, some hate each other, some spawn new little people if they get together!  Pets can be trained if you have a animal friendly little person too, and they can help fight off attackers or fetch resources.  This can sound gimmicky and a little micro-management heavy, and I was a little sceptical when I read about the AI story teller, but actually it really does work and is fun and balanced.If you're like me and prefer a permadeath game RimWorld comes with that option, and its great, knowing if something goes wrong (and it often does) you just have to keep going till your team recover or all is lost, and that makes the experience deeper, because sometimes you start to feel the journey with your characters, particularly if some get killed or maimed.  I actually got properly sad once when one character died and then his pet dog died defending him afterwards, I ended that game, and that was the end of that story.  The beauty is, you can then start again with new people and have another 'largely' unique adventure.Give it a go, it’s worth it just for the experience, it’s quite a unique game.

								Well here is the story of my most recent colony:  A sea ice oneLanded with three colonists. Mason,  Farrukh, and JaydenJayden was my crack shot great against raidersMason was a great researcher and constructer Farrukh grew food and cookedI get a survival shelter up, got power and a heater get up a research bench even individual bedrooms for my people.  An electric stove.On day 6 I recieve an alert "Manhunter Pack".  It is only three Muffalo I thought I could handle it.To say the least we had to leave behind Mason's foot and Jayden's eye. I didn't even have enough resources to build a butcher table. 3 raids later I still have my colonists and then I get the alert "Siege"  I grab my sniper rifles and head out. Half of my base is destroyed before hep arives including my power so hello "slept in the cold".  By now I am worried abot my numbers.  So accept the person who causes my demise.He was Table a young man a great colonist by my standards.  But the raid that comes is 10 pirates with 4 personal shields.  I grab my guns and hope for the best. I do ok utill the person with the doomsday launcher comes The only one who remains is Mason who is also, inconvienintly my Brawler. He dies in the next raidBut the game decides to troll me and gives me another colonist so I pack my bags with all my food and leave for the tundra.  After a fight with a hungry fox and an infection the game over screen popped upAfter playing 1,500 hours of this game I can easily give it 100/10 and say it is my favorite game.  And it is still in development!!

content:

Early Access Review
								I am going to do this review while the last game is fresh in my mind.I only play on Extreme difficulty with permadeath mode, this game was with Cassandra Classic as the storyteller.5 Colonists doing ok, I had weathered through multiple Solar flares coupled with heatwaves, Cold snaps in the fall that coincided with a Toxic Fallout for about a month of game time.  Food was scarce, but I built some Hydroponics stations to stay fed and ventured outside only when necessary.Fought off a couple minor raids, acquired a few machine guns from the dead.Life is good after the toxic fallout.  Full pantry, 2 geothermal generators indoors to keep warm in winter and supply power,  tons of excess steel, wood, etc for whatever needs building.See a large pack of 8 deer waltz in, 2 older ones, let's harvest the old and top off the freezer.Niklas is a level 13 Shooter armed with a Light Machine Gun, I'm quite certain he can mow these two geriatrics down and we're all set.NOPE.First deer goes down and then the pack gets enraged.  Niklas makes it about 85% of the way home and is knocked unconcious.  Send Makkinen to the rescue.  Makkinen makes it to the front door and is battered to a pulp with Niklas draped over his shoulders.  Front door is now open so I have a multi-buck problem in the living room.  Blitz is armed with an assault rifle, gets one volley off before getting concussed in the hallway, and  Law the doctor is thrown across his bedroom.  Only Komp the brawler armed with a silver mace is alive, and cornered in the foundry.Komp batters 3 deer to death before collapsing in a heap.Minutes later Komp is able to walk and gets the rest of the colony to their beds before collapsing again.Hours pass before the rest of the colony is limping about, banged up but alive.Slowly rebuilding the wrecked interior of the colony and trying to salvage the dropped food and weapons.DROP POD RAID FROM THE LOCAL PIRATES.Armed with frag grenades, sniper and charge rifles, they bust through the weakened doors, mow down my cat Java, my Warg Terror, and my Boomrat, all 5 colonists shredded, steal my @Q#$%! air conditioners for the parts...like seriously? Don't take the 815 silver in the storage room, but take my !@#%!~@#$^@#$^ air conditioners!?!Just buy the game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 5
Early Access Review
								This game is astonishing. The stories that are created as you struggle to survive everything the game throws at you will stay in your head for a while, from great triumphs to the (more likely) bitter defeats. There's something morbidly satisfying of watching you colony burn to the ground, swarming with raiders, as your colonists bleed out alone on the floor.  Developer is hugely active in both development and community; both through their own website and on reddit's /r/rimworld. Mods are constantly being developed that change the dynamic of your play-style.First game to make me actively weigh the pros and cons of cannibalism. You can harvest human skin and turn it into leather for cowboy hats. Favorite crafter has asthma? Take a prisoner and harvest their lungs. Sure, the prisoner will die, but your crafter can breathe easily again! Or build towards an entirely bionic colony and travel the globe murdering everything in your way. You can just capture them all and sell them into slavery instead, which is a great way to make bank. Although drug production is a rather lucrative option as well, if you're willing to deal with the occasional addicted dog that got into your cocaine stash.You can see average hours of other reviewers, and you can see the fascinating stories. The price does appear a bit steep as you're browsing around the Steam Store, but I, personally, have found it to be worth every penny. That steep price actually led me to download the free* version to make sure I wasn't being swindled by EA promises (oh StarForge, how you've betrayed me). Three hours in, I deleted it and happily bought the official version. Now I'm actually debating on picking up another copy or two to gift to Steam friends, to both further support the developer, and spread the gift of catastrophe.Get it now.*Yeah, there isn't a free version, but I think we all got that.

content:
Posted: July 17, 2016
Early Access Review
								Rimworld is exceptional because the developers have had their ear to the community of players for 14 alpha releases.The actual experience can be described as "story of woe generator" because each game you play turns into an epic drama of survival and hardship, usually progressing to tragedy.  Yes, you can play the easy basebuilder mode and just learn how to create a mega colony, but thats not where your best hours will be in this game.Check out Ludeon's forums where players tell stories of how their colonists had to resort to cannibalism to survive an epic cold snap that wiped out their crops.  How they captured raiding tribesmen, and harvested their organs to save a sick member of the colony.  How a small herd of Alpacas went mad and attacked a fledgling colony, ultimately burning it to the ground.  My most recent game included a pair of colonists who were madly in love with each other.  However, one of the lovers had a crazy sister.  Social time was a little awkward up until the wedding.  The Ceremony was beautiful and the attendees went to bed with a large buff to their mood.   Then, the sister went mad with rage and set the colony on fire while everyone else was sleeping.  10/10 will bring popcorn to the next episode of "What insane way will my colony fail today?"

content:
Posted: July 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								I have had this game for over two years now and it finally just got released on steam. Here is what I can say:The Good: The charecter design allows greater resources to be poured into the game systems making them very complex. Multiple levels of difficulty allow the player to decide if they want to play a "basebuilder" game or go full blown survival mode. Fairly smart AI strategies when raiding the player. AI director keeps things "exciting". Allot of love and care went into the social sytems in the game. People have emotions, needs, dependencies, realistic relationships, backstories, and skills. Fairly transparent feedback from the devolper. I am rarely dissapointed because expectations are always set correctly.The Bad: Sometimes the balance of this game can be brutal. Although the random elements have been cut down a bit,♥♥♥♥♥♥can get bad real fast. Releases can take a long time (please refer to my transparency point above, it makes this less of an issue) After years it still seems colonists will rather roll around in filth and almost starve to death while happily chopping trees or mining rather then proactivaely collecting some food or cleaning the blood off the floor They could do allot more with the different colonies and clans you interact with. There are no politics between clans other than a number which increases or decrease how much they like you by the actions you take.It was worth $30 then and it's certainly worth it now.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 18, 2016
Early Access Review
								So I create my first world and I start naming the characters my friends names and my name also.  I tried to match the traits closest to my friends and we got pretty good results.  But that's not what I am going to talk about.  So one of my colonists was a really good shooter and they had a trait that made then a super good shot but take extra time.  I didn't think much, but what I noticed is that they were really inaccurate.  I was so confused about this because a lot of the shots he took weren't even hard shots. K, enough of that back to the story.One day my character, Adam, became unstable because of the heat and I have been rejected so many times and I lose it.  I start attacking a rat and some of the other colonists.  Matt comes to the rescue and lands 2 really hard consecutive shots.  I was complaining because I don't know why he couldn't do that before with a darn beaver.Matt then rescues me and puts me in a medical bed where I then learn that his shots blew off both of my legs!  So I had no legs and that put my character in an uncomfortable situation.  Since Matt was also our best doctor I told him to do an operation to put 2 peg legs on me.  He puts the first peg leg on with ease but the second one was a whole different situation.  While putting in the left peg leg he somehow managed to take out my lung and failed the operation.  I just lost it at this point because I was so confused how you took out a lung instead of put a peg leg on!  Those are 2 totally different parts of the body.  I ignored it.Fast forward time to like a season later.  Some cobras attacked us and Matt came out to save us.  I was melee attacking the cobras while Matt was sniping them from far away.  Matt missed one of his shots and it hit me.  It hit my torso and caused me to pass out.I quit that world and started another one.  We got to have Matt and Adam on the roster again for this world.  So Matt became emotionally unstable early on in this world, so I shot him.  I guess my character wants revenge on this world.This game is great though.  For an Early Access Game this is like one of the best you can get.  I definately recommend it!

content:

Early Access Review
								I started this game and before I knew it 10 hours had passed.  My first play through was a disaster, but it was a disaster that was so engrossing that I couldn't look away.  TL:DR Buy the game.To me the whole story was about Mary or "Mars" as everyone called her. She was stranded on this planet with her son and a rough looking miner who had an eye for her. They sat up a colony by the side of a lake until a soldier named Jack radioed for help. The colonists of Laketown rescued him and patched his wounds. Mars and Jack fell in love almost instantly. Jack was the backbone of the colony and made sure everything ran smoothly, Mars was proud to love a man like that. One bright day, Jack stumbled into some ruins filled with mechanized warriors. They were hostile and chased him back to the colony. One by one the colonists fell, until only Mars and a girl named AJ were left. They were able to finish off the robots and to try to treat the wounds of the other colonists. It was pointless though, all the medicine was gone and there were no traders in the area. The first cassuality was her son, he got an infection in his leg, then Jack, her beloved Jack, then the rough space miner had to be euthanized because of a shattered spine, AJ did that, she never liked him and got a little pleasure out of it, Mars thought she was sick. That was the breaking point for Mars, she snapped and killed all of the other colonist, suffering mortal wounds as she did. Mars died alone in her bed, insane with grief. They say when you visit the lake on a quite night, you can hear Mars, her son and Jack all laughing and playing horse shoes, united together again.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 17, 2016
Early Access Review
								Most of my complaints are not about the game itself, but some of the misleading reviews. They're quick to compare RimWorld to Dwarf Fortress, but it honestly seems like most of them have just heard of it in passing and don't want to be teased for not knowing what a dwarven atom smasher is. RimWorld is somewhere between Prison Architect and Dwarf Fortress in complexity, and would best be explained as diet, caffeine-free, dolphin-safe Dwarf Fortress in a nice-looking can just as willing to run your colony into the ground with misfortune you can't help but laugh at.The tutorials aren't the best, but if you're relying on those to teach you how to play, you're going to have a bad time. Take some time to explore the menus available to you and the map around you. There are no Z-levels, so you're stuck playing on and gathering resources from only one plane. Steel is not produced as an alloy, but gathered from salvage and compacted steel, the latter of which is dug out from any terrain you might happen to have on the surface.And the game really doesn't need multiplayer, not that there is any at the time of this review. Honestly, that's just a recipe for disaster in a colony management game like this. If you want multiplayer, roll the same seed as your friend and pick the same starting zone, then compare how you both do.So I guess I recommend it if you really like colony management games, because this one is already more finished than most of the ones on Steam. Not entirely certain about dropping 30$ on it, but I figured I've been spoiled by enough sales that I don't mind playing full price to give a game like this a go.

content:
Posted: September 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								I have been playing this game for a good number of hours and I must say, every minute has been a blast. Constantly waiting for that one event that will turn your well oiled machine to chaos. To give you an example I'll tell a little story about one of my latest endavours on one of these unforgiving Rimworlds.Quellin was a happy place, tucked away in a little alcove with a plenty of food, clothing and weaponry. Most of the colonists were as happy as they'd ever be. Fred and Marcia were enjoying the company of their Yorkshire terriers and their collegues all had their duties in and around the little settlement.One day, Fred went out hunting and had set his eyes on the white-wooled Muffalo, as he'd seen a large herd the day before, at least eleven of them, not too far to the south. He set out with his trusty greatbow and managed to get a hit in but then disaster struck, the Muffalos turned on him and before he even managed to turn around he was getting swarmed by five of them while the rest was making their way north, towards the settlement. Most of the people there were still unsuspecting of any danger and even though a few archers had been set out as sentries, the town was soon overrun. Fred's body was nothing more than a meaty pulp and along the way Martin, who had a bad back, was overrun by the wooly ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s, knocking him out cold and leaving him to die as the set out for more violence. Bashing down the front door of my main recreational space and catching yet another colonist off-guard. The two Terriers weren't afraid of these brutes and they charged in, biting at the bovine's ankles but apart from spilling a few drops of blood it was to no avail, both of them became scraps on the muffalo's hooves long before the first one fell to a well placed arrow by an enraged Marcia, losing her husband was the first blow and the loss of her favorite furry friend pushed her over the edge. She charged out and managed to take down one of the invaders but soon joined her husband in the afterlife.The remaining inhabitants were hiding in the cooler, plenty of food and double doors would keep them happy for a while, at least, if the bloodthirsty herbivores would ever leave. I let time run by for a few days but the beasts were unforgiving and were dead-set on wiping out the hunters, in retribution to the death of their kin I suppose.How gruesome all of this may seem, I enjoyed every second of it and reminded me that this game is relentless.I love it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								RimWorld is like Steam Early Access: a black hole from which nothing escapes. This game is an absolute diamond that wasn't on my radar at all, but has fully enthralled me for way longer than it should have. RimWorld is all about managing a colony of people whom you will get to know and love or hate.Before you begin a game, RimWorld presents you with a randomized selection of colonists. Each of these folks has a varying skill proficiency list which includes basic skills like Cleaning, Hauling, and Harvesting or more advanced skills like Medicine, Crafting, and Warden (Sheriff). Along with a skillset, your colonists may also have other traits such as Pyromania, Drug Addictions, and even old injuries. Just as you would assume traits can have quite an effect on your colonist, sometimes for better and yet other times for worse.There are several biomes in which you can land in (or migrate to if starting as Tribals) and colonize all of which have positives and negatives. Are you in a boreal forest location? Winter will come eventually and your people need warm clothes and warm rooms if they are to survive without complaint. Did you pick a desert? Most of the year you'll have to combat high temperatures and a lack of some materials that would be plentiful elsewhere.When you decide your initial band of survivors and colony location, you'll be dropped into the game proper. Immediately your group is in dire straits: you need shelter and food. Luckily RimWorld is populated with many different types of materials with which to build and much in the way of things to eat.Besides constructing actual buildings for your pawns to live in there are also different crafting stations that allow the creation of various items like weapons and armor to clothes and drugs. If you are feeling a little country, you can try your hand at farming crops and tending animals. Electricity is another option and there are several ways to generate it as well as several ways to expend it including colored lights and television.After you get your colony up and running, your chosen A.I. will start throwing you curve-balls depending on your difficulty choices. Random events will occur and they can range from a raid by Pirates who definitely want that booty to wandering packs of animals that will join you or attempt to eat you.RimWorld is incredibly fun when things are going as you plan. However the game really shines when it is able to exploit a flaw in your colony setup. When you first lose a colonist, it is a painful experience. The next hundred lives lost don't go by any easier. Many may be tempted to simply start a new colony or reload a save game, but these losses are where the player learns how to deal with and react to each situation. Without the possibility of loss, the game would have little substance. That being said, there is a generous amount of frustration here for those unwilling or unable to let go of their village people and animals. Luckily we can construct tombs with which to honor their sacrifice.I was not an early backer for RimWorld. I learned of it's existence shortly after it arrived on Steam. Kotaku had a RimWorld article about some guy's crazy naked doctor that ate people and I knew I needed this, damn whatever flaws it would have being Alpha. This is the most complete game in Early Access that I have ever played. It is more complete than many AAA games that we pay twice the price for. However this is something that people need to understand: there are features still being added. When a major patch is put out, your progress up to that point is made invalid without some workaround. While that does suck, a major patch usually means a new feature or two so it is a bittersweet thing at worst.

content:
Posted: July 17, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've been playing RimWorld since Jan 2014 and I can't recommend it enough. It's like playing a top down version of the Sims only 100x better. :) You start out with a few colonists and start building up the colony from there. You will be utilizing various different types of people, which don't always get along.Each playthrough is a unique story and you'll likely be relating the story to people around you. My friend and I have swapped RimWorld stories over lunch at Taco Bell many many times. The stories are created by you, but also by the story telling AI. It keeps an eye on everything you're doing and throws little curves your way to bring you down a bit or help you a long if you are struggling. There are various different types of story tellers and various difficulties in each style you choose. With the steam release and Steam Workshop integration, using Mods and shared scenarios will be easier than ever.  I honestly can't recommend this game enough. If you like base building or management games you'll love RimWorld.

content:
Posted: August 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is a drama generator disguised as a game. You could just go through the motions and play this challenging survival game. Or you could take a few moments to actually read about the characters you are playing with and watch the story unfold.In one game, an overweight male cook crash lands on a RimWorld with two naked female sex slaves. The women are constantly frustrated at their lack of clothes. Mr. Cook is constantly hitting on the girls and trying to get lucky, and is constantly rejected. The girls who have the necessary survival skills between them (except cooking) ignore the cook's advances. The cook eventually goes insane and runs around in a crazy stupor until he eventually starves to death. The girls who cannot cook eventually get depressed over having to eat the corpses of animals they hunted raw and end up fighting. The one with medical skills is knocked out. The survivor has no medical or hunting skills. They both starve to death...In another game a family consisting of a daughter who is a researcher with some medical skills, her mother the botanist, and the ex husband/father who was a soldier, crash land near the pole with their pet Husky. The botanist can't do anything without a hydroponic set up as nothing grows in the cold and ice. The mother can also cook. The daughter can hunt and cook. And the father can build a shelter. They manage to build a small, heated space and have plans to create an indoor hydroponic set up to feed themselves as there are very few things to hunt out on the ice.Then the daughter is attacked by a polar bear while hunting a rabbit. The father rescues her. While she is in bed recovering, the father and mother can't take the stress of being in such close company anymore and start fighting. The mother is injured. The father has no medical skills. The daughter gets an infection which can't be treated and gets gradually worse. There's a short in the battery room and power is knocked out - with no power there's no heat. Mother - with some medical skills - gets hypothermia. Father can't repair the battery as there's no metal left, and the daughter had the mining skills. Besides - the polar bears are still out there...Eventually food runs out - the daughter dies of her infection. The mother dies of hypothermia. The father can't bear to eat the corpses of his family and starves to death. The dog survives by eating their corpses. Eventually, a wanderer stumbles upon the settlement. He figures he could just live there, mine some metal and fix the hydroponic set up. There's no food, but he has no problem with eating this frozen human protein lying around. He survives for days, repairs the battery compartment, and is re-buidling the hydroponics.A few days later an escape pod crashes near the shelter. The old man rescues the young woman - the girl of his dreams! He locks her in a room while she recovers, hoping to woo her and convince her to stay with him, that cannibalism isn't all that bad and that people are actually quite tasty. But she rejects him. Eventually he goes insane from digging up the frozen corpses and butchering them, and in his madness he attacks the dog. The dog incapacitates him outside the shelter, and the old man - unable to get back inside - freezes to death. The young woman locked in her cell starves to death...10/10 would turn cannibal and abduct women again!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								Rimworld is astonishingly fun and addictive for an Early Access game.  Don't let the relatively simple graphics fool you (though they're certainly less abstract than, say, Dwarf Fortress which Rimworld is frequently likened to) ... the game feels quite immersive.  It becomes very easy to empathize with your colonists as individuals, to feel pride in their skill level, to want to please them by providing for their comfort in their bedrooms and ensuring proper entertainment.  Starting from scratch, you have to act quickly to build shelter and beds, get crops going and build production stations for cooking food, producing clothing and weapons, crafting art and building a variety of goods for trade when the traders come.There are threats galore, of course -- pirate raiders, hostile primitive tribes, manhunter-maddened animals and disasters both manmade (toxic fallout) and natural (volcanic eruptions).The gameplay and the characters are complex, and its easy to lose all track of real-life time.This game has been absolutely dominating my gameplay time for over a year already (I bought the game back in Alpha 7 days; this review is a few days following Alpha 14 and the initial Steam launch).  I definitely recommend it!

content:
Posted: January 4
Early Access Review
								This is the story of the badass Barkeeper. 3  pods crashed to the surface of a Rimworld. One of them was known as Clark Hendrix, or as I like to call him, "The bad♥♥♥♥♥Barkeep". Along with him was Lu, a former servant, and  Watson, a Vatgrown Solider. They started a colony. One day, as everything was going smoothly, Hendrix attempted to woo Lu. lu rejected him, and he was hurt. Now, let me tell you something about Hendrix. What he wants, he gets. So, maybe a day passes, and he's at it again, trying to woo Lu. This time, he succeeds. A few days pass, and a man by the name of Thompson comes to live in the colony. Thompson was... A simple man. very simple. A hard worker, and he absouloutly despised technology. But, he was nonetheless an important part of the colony. In the end, though, Thompson died of an infection. The reason behinde this was probably because of that cut he had gotten in a recent skirmish with the wildlife, beavers to be more presise. He was honored, and placed in a sarcaufugus. Hendrix made it himself, considering he was Thompsons closest friend. Some more days pass, and a ship crashs, and a non-vilonet man named Scizo or something is found in a crash. Though he's completly irrelevant because even though he was saved he ultimatley left without giving two ♥♥♥♥s about the resources these people had used in hopes of him joining them. But, yet another pod crashed, and this one carrying the most useless person anyone could have ever met. A man by the name of Isov. Isov had a weird entitlement about him. he felt he didn't need to do ANY LABOR AT ALL. So occaitionaly he would help Watson with reasearch, and help train Raymond, the pet warg. But when it came down to it, Isov was the most useless human being in existance. Though, that didn't stop Hendrix from befriending him anyways. Hendrix was, by any means, a people person. He was a hunter too. And a fighter when the colony needed him to be. Now, a new day begins, and there is a woman on the comms channel, a criminal surgeon by the name of Toni. She needed some help getting away from a local tribe by the name of "The Orange Plain Nation". So Hendrix had her come, for he knew they were in desperate need of a medical practitioner. Her attackers, a male warrior, and a lesbian who absouloutly despised men. Hendrix, getting everyone into formation, repels the attackers. He bravly shoots down warrior, while the lesbian attacks the colony's solar pannel. She flees, when she realizes that her scum partner is dead. Hendrix leads the charge and scares her off for good. In the time after that, Hendrix found himself doing more for the colony, such as building a heater for Toni's room, and growing crops. But then, one day, a herd of angry boar enter the area. Hendrix knows what he must do. He gathers Watson and Lu, who are the only other two in the colony with guns, and they fight off the boar. When Hendrix realized that his, at this time, fiance'a(However you spell that) Lu was going to be killed by a boar, he bravely swooped in and meleed the boar to death, while 2 more boar fight him. He managed to knock one unconsiouns, but the other boar, oh, that ♥♥♥♥ing other boar, killed Hendrix. Watson, in complete rage killed the boar and all other boars in the area. In the days afterwards, a steel sarcophagus was made to honor Hendrix, and all his contributions to the colony. Without him, the colony may very well have died. Though it isn't a happy ending for anyone, especially Lu, who finnaly broke after Hendrix died. She went on a fire starting spree, but before she could, Watson arrested her. Now shes gone insane in that prison, and people wander if she'll ever get better. As for Watson and Isov, they have contracted some sort of disease, and it is feared they may very well die from it, leaving Toni to a colony full of bad memories, and an insane woman who may never recover.So, that's my story after playing "Rimworld". I am still playing on that save, still kind of want to see is Watson and Isov will pull through or not, but I doubt it. Heck, maybe I'll get lucky and Watson will live while Isov dies a very painful death, and he can refelct on how being a self-entitled ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ turns out in the end. Hope you enjoyed reading, I am having and will continue to have, a great time with this game, and I hope you might to, if you decide to get the game!

content:
Posted: August 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								Well,after all this time,I don't remember a good enough story to tell. But,there was this one time where I led a group of tribals,and gave the leader an A.I chip,Bionic arms and legs,all Synthetic organs... Hell,if I saw that guy,I'd run and tell my faction to worship him. Besides,everyone who fought him ended up casually persuaded to join or shot to death by powerful,futuristic weapons.EDIT:New story! After seeing chapter one of Rock Paper Shotgun's "Bogdan's Rest" I made Big Boss Hotel. With a LOT of mods,including Glittertech and more furniture,fashionrimsta,and MORE,I built a massive hotel in a Boreal Forest inside of a hotel. We had Kevin "Boss" Lewis,with great social skills,Craig Boone,who keeps talking about how his wife is dead,but then shoots millions more to death,and Shauna "Food" Gray,who makes food. We quickly made a grand entrance hall,and right above the entrance,we made a massive power room.  To the left,we dug further into the corner and built our rec center,where our first infestation was. Boss beat some bugs to death with his baton,but Boone came in and killed the rest in around one shot while Food ran outside and hid behind a tree. We then dug below the rec room,and expanded to the rooms. The first 2 were guest rooms,and the next 2 were for staff. Staff rooms were larger and had colours based on the personality and name of the character. We dug so far down,and then came our first visitors! They were a group of Outlanders and had some good stuff to trade. They all went into thier rooms. One guy brought some drugs,he began smoking flake,then died. He overdosed or something. We happily took his stuff,and when Boone was wearing his jacket,noone suspected a thing. After a while,they left,and were so amazed they turned over the rest of thier drugs to us! Remember kids,don't do drugs,give them to random strangers!1 season LaterARK! GET AT THE DOOR! BOONE! GRAB THE RIFLE! COOKE! GET OUT THERE!Fourty Rhinoceri outside,bashing at the doors,invading Teh Coive (Our stockpile) and bashing our Enmergency Exit. Boone one shots them all,until they blindly run away to maul a caribous. Cooke charges out there and shoots the legs off of 3 of the beasts. They fall over as Ark guards the entrance,blindly firing her assault rifle at the monsters. Our turrets finally regain power from the solar flare,and mow down the rhinos. As the others begin to wander off,as they've gotten bored of death,we all rush back in and go to the hospital. Down below,a prison break occurs. The Pirate Leader we captured has decided enough is enough. With his useless Lackey,Justin,they break out and grab some wood from a nearby room,under construction. Boss rushes to deal with them,as he is our noble warden. He whacks Maker on his head,and as Justin draws near,Boss flees upward to get more reinforcements. Our pregant,and brave dog,Taffy,charges forth. She bites Maker's arm,and he whacks her tail and legs with his wood. Maker,in a smidge of pain,takes a bow from an equipment locker in a room,and shoots Taffy. She dies in one hit. Her middle-stage fetus,is never shown the beauty of this world. In a fit of rage,Boss charges Maker and beats him senseless. He knocks him over,he falls in pain. Justin,in fear that his beloved boss was struck down,rushes back to his cell. Later,we put Taffy in a Sarcophagus. Maker recovers and stays in his cell,as the hated Dog-Killer. Our colony mourns the death of Taffy still. The save continues on to this day.     Get RimWorld today for many great stories and tales of drama,action,bloodshed,and Romance!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								I played this game already for countless hours before the steam release and I'm still doing so.it won't get boring, one of the advantages of a large and very good modding community. You will alway find new challenges to master. Make sure to visit the forums though, you won't find all the good mods on steam.In general, I can highly recommend this to any player who likes base building games, with a lot of strategic decisions mixed with the strong survival aspect of the game.As most of the reviews mentioned, there are a many similarities to "Prison Architect", due to the angled top down view and the the building system ( single blocks, put together to build your desired colony / prison ).I played some Prison Architect, but I never really enjoyed it, so I can say I like RimWorld a lot better!You can play your colony simply as a base builder, recruit people and have a prospering place to live. Or you can go hardcore, fight against nature and hostile factions. There is surely a setup you will enjoy. From basebuilder to real struggle to survive is everything included. This game offers you a real challenge if you are up to it!Theres is a lot of detail to the game and your colonists. Social interactions with other colonists, ranging from hate to marriage. A health system where you can lose and replace limbs and organs. Individual traits for the colonists making them a super soldier, doc or that guy who is always on the edge to a mental break.The combat system is divided into melee and ranged and you can get into big and epic firefights when 20 pirates start to raid your colony and you have to defend against them. You can set up your defensive system over the whole map and generate a new layout never seen before.Set up a big prison wing to keep all the prisoners, captured during enemy raids and convince them to join you.There are not only human threats, but also mechanoids, advanced killing machines, which can be the end to an unprepared colony. Nature itself can make it a struggle to feed everybody, when the sun is covered for months during a volcanic winter. Or a solar flare disables your heaters when its -60°C outside.A lot can happen and there is enough material for a very good story.This can make your first start a bit tricky, but over the course of time you will learn to deal with each situation and I'm sure at some point, there will be another great colony somewhere in the endless vastness of space ... There are complaints about the lack of multiplayer, but I think they are unjustified. There is no real need for it. However, I can agree that I would enjoy to visit or raid other colonies, AI or not. It goes hand in hand with the fact, that you are currently restricted to the piece of land where you start. There is no possibility to take a few colonist and wander off to start another colony on the same planet ( a generated map from where you can choose your start biome ). This would allow you to trade and do all the interactional stuff and I would love to see that.Always keep in mind that this is still an Alpha version and that there is a lot of time to implement mechanics into the game.I give a lot of credit to the developer, he keeps every new version perfectly playable. With each update there is new content to explore.If you are still not sure whether you should buy this game, there are a lot of videos about it. I already made several Let's Plays myself with various setups. You can check out the newest one here: 


YouTube™ Video: RimWorld Alpha 14 | Part 01 | Modded w/ CombatRealism | Pawn Creation & Custom Scenario 

			Views: 127		

			The two of you were living peacefully on a distant planet, somewhere in the endless vastness of space. One day raiders assaulted your hometown and imprisoned every survivor.		

This is the corresponding playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLHHfuzUMWiggnx2gXvNknHaw72KtXtxCY

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								Although Steam tells you something different, I have bought this game soon after it's Kickstarter campaign and easily collected over 100 hours of playtime in the past three years. I can say that this was literally the game I waited for without knowing it when I first saw it. While it has an excellent presentation it gives you the complete freedom of choice how to develop your colony on the one hand, but also an ultimate goal, building a spaceship, on the other.Before you keep on reading a word to the few negative reviews from new players: Yes, this is a complex game. As someone said on the discussions: "It's not a FPS where you start on heroic difficulty becasue you know shooters." It's a game with many mechanics you will have to learn before beeing good at it, I recommend enableing the adaptive tutorial to learn the basic systems. It's also a very slow paced game with eventual peaks in form of raids or such. The two hours you have to decide if you want to refund are not nearly enough to see all the facades of the game and get a complete picture of it. Now on to the positives.Wether you want to build an underground complex or a large fortress, all stragtegies are viable and have their own advantages and disadvantages. If you need to hold a large base you will have lots of walls which you need to defend and the enemy may break through at different locations. But while you can keep your entry small and defendable if you go underground, you eventually will have to fight bug hives which can spread sub-surface and enemies which are equipped with granades and pickaxes in order to dig their way to you.The incredible amount of replayability also thrives from the different biomes and the recently added scenario system. Each of the eight climatic environments has unique weather, animals, diseases and challenges. The scenarios give you the ability to never play twice with the same starting condition, may it be the number of colonists, items and conditions of the map or forced cannibalism.There is also an active mod community which has specialised on vanilla- and lore friendly mods that truely expand the game to it's full potential. Every veteran will be able to give you a list of some length with mods that he/she considers necessary to play the game. Of course it's not unplayable without mods but they do add many quality-of-life improvements which make playing the game easier.Many people ask why they should pay 30$ for an early access title. Bear in mind that the early access is there to indicate that the game is still beeing worked on. However it has met all his goals, is polished, optimized and generally bug-free. You are basically looking at a finished game which will get expanded in the future and thus is marked as an early access. The developer, Tynan Sylvester, who made this game almost on his own, usually releases new mayor builds every three to four months, introducing new and basic game mechanics, like the scenario system, but we will have to see how steam dynamic will change this. If there are bugs which survived the extensive testing phase, you can count on a hotfix beeing published within days.RimWorld is what it says: a story generator. Usually I'm very suspicious about games who claim that, but in this case it is totally correct. Stories on the forums range from prisoners getting torn apart in order to sell their organs to colonists which give their lives in a heroic last stand to save the colony. If you're not sure, head over to the  stories forum [ludeon.com] and read one or two to a glass of your favourite relaxing drink.Anyone who has an interest in strategy, building and/or science fiction should buy this game and probably wont be disappointed.

content:
Posted: April 2
Early Access Review
								I don't think I could possibly say enough about this game.  It definitely earns its Overwhelmingly Positive rating in my books.Don't be fooled by its simplistic 2D look.  There's surprisingly a lot that is hidden under the hood.  For a survival colony simulator, this one has an enormous amount of detail.  Also, don't let the Early Access tag throw you off of buying now.  This game is surpisingly mature even now and is remarkably complete despite being in Early Access.It covers all of the bases when it comes to basic survival against nature... climate (whether it be too hot or cold, or even uninhabitable due to some other factor like toxic fallout), hunting and growing food, finding sources of power, heat, and refrigeration for food storage, etc.  Then it throws in the added things like raider attacks, or attacks by mechanoids, among a huge list of other possible events.  But part of the additional appeal is that this game manages to simulate the personalities and mental states of every living creature on the map.  Not only do you have to worry about keeping your colonists well fed, happy, living together peacefully, and from going nuts, but there's also the chance that you may, at some point have to defend yourself from one or more animals that suddenly go mad (like a herd of squirrels... I'm not joking).The game does such a good job emulating the personalities of the individual colonists, I actually found I was getting attached to my colonists.  I cheered them on as they developed relationships among each other, some of which eventually led to marriages.  I would sometimes curse at them when they didn't do what I expected.  I was always leery of any newcomers.... like the pyromaniac girl I saved who was going through drug withdrawal symptoms who kept going nuts and starting fires all over the place.  But I nursed her through her rough time and she became one of the leading members of my colony.But besides all of that, it also allows you to run your colony how you like to.  If you're fed up with running a colony based on the morals/laws of current society, and would rather have a colony entirely made up of nudist cannibals, then go for it!  I know I used to run a pretty straight forward colony except that if I were attacked by raiders and survived, I would patch up any surviving raiders and sell them off as slaves and butcher the dead ones to feed to my livestock.  That is, of course, if the cannibals among the members of my colony could keep their hands off the human meat long enough for me to turn it into kibble.All in all, I generally have a hard time really getting into a game and sticking with it for a long time, but with this one I've put over 300 hours of game play (as of the time I write this) into this game so far.  It was extremely easy to become addicted.  Every day brought new events and new adventures.Extreme thumbs up for this one!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 8
Early Access Review
								If you want to step up your casual gaming from The Sims series to something more extreme, RimWorld is it. It's as difficult as Dwarf Fortress, but there are easier difficulties (and three different 'storytellers' that control what happens) that you could pretend like you're playing The Sims. Plus, there's no household cap of 8! Anyone that survives, crashing into your colony - or enemies you capture from a raid - you can *convince* them to join your colony and become a part of the family. :)  Once you're comfortable with observing your Sims, I mean, colonists get cozy - bump up the difficulty for hordes of your neighbors, space pirates, and even space alien robots. No one could make fun of you for that. Yes, sure, you can make people into hats.

content:
Posted: July 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								As a rule I generally don't write reviews; not out of some arbitrary reasoning, but out of fear that I don't have insight to either advising picking up a game or steering clear of it.This is not the case with Rimworld.Rimworld is arguably one of the finest crafted games ever released for the colony/survival genre. Boasting a huge range of character traits, a complex relationship system between characters and a potentially harsh or easy world to survive in. The game is entirely fantastic in it's ability to tailor your experience from a relatively easy adventure through a lush, temperate forest; all the way up to a ball-crushing torture fest of surviving in the harsh, arctic tundra, or the equally terrifying super dry deserts.If you have even the slightest interest in this game, please do yourself the favour and pick it up. Whilst it's only just come out on Steam, I have well over 500 hours of gameplay prior to it's release: and I've loved every single second of it. You will not regret this purchase, it's ♥♥♥♥ing fantastic!

content:
Posted: August 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								Well,after all this time,I don't remember a good enough story to tell. But,there was this one time where I led a group of tribals,and gave the leader an A.I chip,Bionic arms and legs,all Synthetic organs... Hell,if I saw that guy,I'd run and tell my faction to worship him. Besides,everyone who fought him ended up casually persuaded to join or shot to death by powerful,futuristic weapons.EDIT:New story! After seeing chapter one of Rock Paper Shotgun's "Bogdan's Rest" I made Big Boss Hotel. With a LOT of mods,including Glittertech and more furniture,fashionrimsta,and MORE,I built a massive hotel in a Boreal Forest inside of a hotel. We had Kevin "Boss" Lewis,with great social skills,Craig Boone,who keeps talking about how his wife is dead,but then shoots millions more to death,and Shauna "Food" Gray,who makes food. We quickly made a grand entrance hall,and right above the entrance,we made a massive power room.  To the left,we dug further into the corner and built our rec center,where our first infestation was. Boss beat some bugs to death with his baton,but Boone came in and killed the rest in around one shot while Food ran outside and hid behind a tree. We then dug below the rec room,and expanded to the rooms. The first 2 were guest rooms,and the next 2 were for staff. Staff rooms were larger and had colours based on the personality and name of the character. We dug so far down,and then came our first visitors! They were a group of Outlanders and had some good stuff to trade. They all went into thier rooms. One guy brought some drugs,he began smoking flake,then died. He overdosed or something. We happily took his stuff,and when Boone was wearing his jacket,noone suspected a thing. After a while,they left,and were so amazed they turned over the rest of thier drugs to us! Remember kids,don't do drugs,give them to random strangers!1 season LaterARK! GET AT THE DOOR! BOONE! GRAB THE RIFLE! COOKE! GET OUT THERE!Fourty Rhinoceri outside,bashing at the doors,invading Teh Coive (Our stockpile) and bashing our Enmergency Exit. Boone one shots them all,until they blindly run away to maul a caribous. Cooke charges out there and shoots the legs off of 3 of the beasts. They fall over as Ark guards the entrance,blindly firing her assault rifle at the monsters. Our turrets finally regain power from the solar flare,and mow down the rhinos. As the others begin to wander off,as they've gotten bored of death,we all rush back in and go to the hospital. Down below,a prison break occurs. The Pirate Leader we captured has decided enough is enough. With his useless Lackey,Justin,they break out and grab some wood from a nearby room,under construction. Boss rushes to deal with them,as he is our noble warden. He whacks Maker on his head,and as Justin draws near,Boss flees upward to get more reinforcements. Our pregant,and brave dog,Taffy,charges forth. She bites Maker's arm,and he whacks her tail and legs with his wood. Maker,in a smidge of pain,takes a bow from an equipment locker in a room,and shoots Taffy. She dies in one hit. Her middle-stage fetus,is never shown the beauty of this world. In a fit of rage,Boss charges Maker and beats him senseless. He knocks him over,he falls in pain. Justin,in fear that his beloved boss was struck down,rushes back to his cell. Later,we put Taffy in a Sarcophagus. Maker recovers and stays in his cell,as the hated Dog-Killer. Our colony mourns the death of Taffy still. The save continues on to this day.     Get RimWorld today for many great stories and tales of drama,action,bloodshed,and Romance!

content:
Posted: July 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								It's finally out, go get it!  Really though, if you enjoy ant farms, building, seting up things to fail/succeed..then this is the game for you.I have been involved with Rimworld as far back as October 2013, back when it was a REALLY barren world. Watching and and being involved with the game over the past 3 years has made this game feel like a family member you watched grow into a successful young adult.   Game notes: A smart AI lays out a story for you, either the traditional 3 colonists, 5 club wielding/ backwards tech colonists, or the challenging 1 colonist. All of which can be speced to your personal choices.  TONS of REPLAYABILITY   -A sandbox, with countless stories to tell.   -A refreshing sense of humor is laced in.   -Incredible Mod support built in.   -Easy to learn, hard to master   -Great ablility to indirectley control your colonists   -Epic battles, strategy, resources   -Play intense pirate over-run worlds, or peaceful sim-cities   -Tech Tree   -Survival   -Colonists interact, get married, party, fight..it's all here   -Good Soudtrack   -A great deal for what you pay.  So if you enjoy the above then Rimworld is for you. A game I have played for 3 years, and I still love it!

content:
Posted: March 5
Early Access Review
								Yes buy it.It still has very minor issues in the day to day gameplay.  It has a good balance between planning and execution, with random events taking place provided by which storyteller you choose.  I.e. the storyteller (apparently) provides the non-deterministic events in the world, which can range from pirate raids or lunar eclipses to the wildlife going crazy.It seems to play like a D20 game.The Good:- Characters have to sleep each day - which usually means hitting fast forward.  This provides a casual feeling to the game - the game is not rushed.- It might even be the most casual "chill" game I can remember.  You can pause the clock at any moment or revert to an old save.  So even when things are getting heavy you can think through what needs to happen.- The game setting is living in the wild and pulling together a survival plan in the midst of the storyteller generating random events.  It's very easy-going this way -- not like Prison Architect which was too heavy and dark for me.- Grizzly bears seem to just eat berries.  Now you know storyteller will make them go crazy at any moment - so try to figure out a way to deal with them.The Bad:- The price feels high before you buy it.  So it might take longer before many people try this game.  - The game could provide more pointers.  "Just look it up on the Wiki."  I suppose if you're hardcore you will want to figure everything out - but this is the blurry line between gameplay-based enjoyment and arbitrary recipe search-space Easter Egg hunting.- There's no demo.  You can watch youtube videos all day - you'll think this is a Dwarf fortress thing like I did, but it's not, and all the videos don't do the game justice.  A demo would have helped me get over the price hump.As it is this game is easily worth the asking price.  Listen - you have 2 hours to figure it out - if you still want a refund, you'll know after first hour.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 18
Early Access Review
								If you enjoy micromanging every moment of your game, this is the challenge you're looking for. RimWorld, or as I like to call it: RimJob. RJ will keep you engaged with a plenty of random events to deal with from whichever AI you pick. From lightining srikes that turn a single flame into a raging inferno, poison clouds that suffocate every living thing for days at a time, to emotional instablities of your colonists. Most days are a new struggle with some rewarding moments thrown in.SQUARETOP:Life in the colony of Squaretop wasn't easy. Stranded on a new planet with a few meals and essentials destined for survival. We had to build walls and build quickly. The initial crew (Vurn, Dacil and Sephicite) survived fires, 3-man raider attacks, and captured many raider prisoners whom after some time were convinced by Vurn to join our cause. After 10 years the Harambe faction became the most coveted in the area, we heavily invested silver into creating nearby allies that we could trade with and call on for help. The poison clouds wiped our crops and killed our animals but still we remained strong. Our stockpile of food encased in Marble walls kept the colony of 9 happy while the natural disasters came and went. It seemed all was well, Joy was reaching new levels, simple meals turned into fine meals. Sweltering heat blistered each year but the A/C kept us cool. Squaretop had it's first gay male couple; Sephicite fell in love with a captured prisoner turned colonist named Ray. He was known throughout as RayJ for how he liked to sing sweet love songs to all the colonists. RayJ was desperately seeking love with any living being in the colony. It didn't matter if you had a peg leg, prosthetic arm, or a brain implant. After multiple rejections RayJ found love with Sephicite in a hopeless place. The colony held a wedding and a party in their honor, everyone attended. Life hummed along and the Squaretop expanded quickly and researched many new technologies. YEAR 15:In year 15, our luck started to turn: Vurn died in a mining accident when a roof collapsed and crushed his body. None of his remains were found. The entire colony was disheartened by our Warden's and best doctor passing. He was a social butterly that no longer graced our marble floors or hospital beds with his presence. During this year a firestorm wiped out the majority of the map but our research in firefoam poppers kept the colony walls safe from a fiery intrusion.While in awe of the firestorm a infestion of bugs manifested itself inside our primary mining node. Several colonists were called on to clear the infestation after preparing for a few days. During the preparation the bugs multiplied in number. The 4 man clearing team was severely wounded and spent 5 days in the med bay recovering after the mission. The team mostly returned to their daily work and was effective even if their movement was a bit slower than before, except for one. Sephicite caught multiple stray friendly fire bullets to the head during the infestation mission and had lost his eyesight. He was unable to navigate around the colony or continue his duty as a Hunter. After much debate it was deterined that he was a useless member of the colony and was euthanized in the 15th year by his lover RayJ. A burial was held in his honor, a sandstone sarcophagus was formed by Dacil as his final resting place. RayJ entered a state of depression and began to experience mental breaks. RayJ had a tendency to be a pyromaniac and began to burn down the colony from the inside out. RayJ successfully burned down the food and medical supplies. The fire was contained and so was RayJ. He was placed in a steel walled room with no door and concrete floors. I determined RayJ will be tortured for what he has done to the remaining 7 colonists. The warm exhaust of a cooling vent pushed the temps to over 80C in his contained cell. RayJ died from heat exhaustion and was buried in a wooden sarcophagus next to his dead lover. There was no ceremony held for RayJ. The colony was desparately trying to replenish food supplies through hunting and trade. RAIDER TEAM ALPHA:That's when the best equipped raider team we have ever seen showed up. It had just turned to the 16th year when raider crew B.A.M.F showed up with mortars and established a permiter of sandbags for defense. They brought survival meals and were ready for a long battle. What once was 9 colonists was now only 6 for defense. Of the 6 remaining Diver was incapable of fighting though he was drafted anyway. He would serve as a human meat shield and if possible would haul the wounded to the hospital. We called our allies for help, they would arrive in 3 days and the colony was drafted and formed up on preparation positions. I determined 3 would attack head on lead by Diver the meat shield and 3 flanking from the east side to take out the mortar operator. Diver was immediately hit with the most accurate shots I've seen in RimJob to date. The five man raider crew landed direct hits and he was the first casualty killed instantly. There would be no rescue for Diver. Dacil lead the flanking team and they sucessfully downed two raiders. The head on meat shield team now lead by Tako the Brawler another former prisoner was badly hurt. He was losing blood quickly and the hospital was far away. They would have to fight and try to survive. Moments later Tako was downed by shotgun fire and his mate Erin attepted to rescue him. Erin made it out of small arms fire range when she caught a direct Mortar round with her face. Tako and Erin died instantly. RIP. Three colonists of Squaretop were remaining and four raiders left. We only needed to down one more raider and it was likely they would retreat. The flanking crew hid behind trees and attempted to take down the raiders from range using assault rifles. The colony aim wasn't true that day and the raiders were operating like the legendary Chris Kyle. I sent Mikey south as a distraction and tried to reposition my crew closer to the sandbags. Mikey caught a mortar, was downed, and began to bleed out from a missing left leg. Dacil's movement was impaired from multiple gun wounds to both legs and torso. The only colonist left capable of moving was Curry. Chef Curry was the colonist cook and he had a recipe for disaster. Chef Curry retreated out of sight when I seen the aid show up from our neighboring ally. I sent Curry back in the fight to bake the raiders from the south while they were attacking the allied force. The 3 allies were ill equipped to handle the 4 heavily armed raiders. Poor quality clubs were no match for the raiders as the allies were also taken down, 2 were killed, one downed and left for dead. Curry couldn't hit the side of a barn during this time and was also downed by assault rifle fire. At this point the remaining raiders had won... My colonists were being captured and taken away. Dacil the last remaining downed colonist remained. Once she died, the colony of Squaretop was no more.THE END:This was my 5th RJ colony and I'd say every single one was a major learning experience. I played without save points (Save only on exit, the True RJ experience) The randomness of my attackers fire during the final raider fight was enough for me to quit the game permanently. I mostly just stared in awe as things went from OK to OH to WOW to WTF. I had several crew that were 13/20 and higher shooters and they couldn't hit anything even when equipped with superior weapons. RNG FTW. This also happened while hunting turkeys at times being unable to shoot them at melee range. Seems a bit ridiculous. I'd still recommend the game to anyone with a lot of patience.

content:
Posted: March 20
Early Access Review
								This is probably my favorite colony simulation game. The music is great, the art style is neat and the gameplay sucks you in for hours and hours at a time.Almost every game I've played winds up in disaster as killer robots invade, someone has a mental break and sets everything on fire or everyone drops dead from sickness after the only doctor is mauled to death by angry beavers during a hunting accident. But that's part of the joy. Seeing how your colonists will interact,  what the AI will throw at you next and how (or should that be if) you'll handle it.It's a game that's better in the early access stage than a lot of games are after years of post release support.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 27
Early Access Review
								Surprisingly good - this is the best way of describing RimWorld.  The last time I played an indie game with as much potential for replayability was FTL.  If you liked FTL, I'll take a leap here and say you will like RimWorld.  Very different in its concept, but similar in it's addictiveness and replayability which for me is really important.Each time you start a new colony the experience is slightly different.  Obviously there are similarities between games which have had me sighing a little when a colony goes wrong and I have start a new one, but on a whole its quite fresh each time a new game is started.  You build a base from scratch and collect resources, but the little people you start with have real vices and personalities, some are hard workers, some lazy, some hate each other, some spawn new little people if they get together!  Pets can be trained if you have a animal friendly little person too, and they can help fight off attackers or fetch resources.  This can sound gimmicky and a little micro-management heavy, and I was a little sceptical when I read about the AI story teller, but actually it really does work and is fun and balanced.If you're like me and prefer a permadeath game RimWorld comes with that option, and its great, knowing if something goes wrong (and it often does) you just have to keep going till your team recover or all is lost, and that makes the experience deeper, because sometimes you start to feel the journey with your characters, particularly if some get killed or maimed.  I actually got properly sad once when one character died and then his pet dog died defending him afterwards, I ended that game, and that was the end of that story.  The beauty is, you can then start again with new people and have another 'largely' unique adventure.Give it a go, it’s worth it just for the experience, it’s quite a unique game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								Tthe thing with rimworld though is it's not a "game" persay. It's a story, which is why suddenly and out of nowhere your entire colony is brutally slaughtered by some terrible event. You have 3 different story tellers. One of them, Randy Random can literally drop a giant pirate raid very soon after you crashland, your colony is dead and your story ends. Or you could survive for a little while, or you could survive long enough for you to build a new starship and escape the planet. Rimworld is a story, of survival and hardship. Your colonists suffer ilnesses, infections, injuries. They can lose limbs, eyes etc. They can get dementia, a bad back. A brain injury. Missing eyes. They can also fall in love, get married. Then you have families, a raiding part might attack and one the raiders if the brother of one of your colonists. Then there are rivaleries, just like in the realy world people don't always get along. Say a colonist dies, now a couple other colonist might've been good friends so they'll get a massive hit their mood, as a close friend died but another colonists hated them and now they're dead they're happy and have a spring in their step. Every colonist has traits and backstorys that are randomly generated. Some may be pyromaniacs, others may be cold tolerant, again others might be alcholics, drug addicts, hard works and the list goes on. For bakcstories, they may have been surgeons, builders, bounty hunters, royality and the list goes on. It's a very deep game and immensely satisfying. Unlike other random colony or city builders you get very attached to these colonists because of how deep this game is.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								Tynan is one of the most transparent developers I have ever spoken to. Now more than ever, you have to be very careful about buying into an early access game. Many early access games have faded into obscurity or failed to deliver on any of their promise. RimWorld is not one of those games. The modding community for this game is already great, and will be made even better with workshop support. Whether you're a masochist that doesn't mind your entire colony being decimated every other day or a casual base builder, the game and the modding community has something to enhance your experience. Every update comes with a ton of new features to try out.If you like Prison Architect, this game is probably right up your alley. You have to manage all aspects of your colonist's lives: their joy, moods, health, food, living spaces...I recommend checking out the Twitch community for RimWorld if you are debating whether or not to get the game. Sacriel is probably one of the biggest streamers that plays. However, an entire other community has evolved for the game as well. There is a group that does speed running for the game (you can launch a ship to escape the world) to see who can get off the planet first. These streamers (ZeebosZone, disnof, spartyon7) play at the highest difficulty and often with storytellers that can send multiple raids each day. They also do other fun challenges, such as the Ice Sheet challenge (starting off on the coldest map seed and trying to survive), or the Cannibalism Only challenge. The fact that there are so many different challenges and restrictions you can make for yourself is one of the greatest things about this game and ensures for a ton of replayability.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								Rimworld is astonishingly fun and addictive for an Early Access game.  Don't let the relatively simple graphics fool you (though they're certainly less abstract than, say, Dwarf Fortress which Rimworld is frequently likened to) ... the game feels quite immersive.  It becomes very easy to empathize with your colonists as individuals, to feel pride in their skill level, to want to please them by providing for their comfort in their bedrooms and ensuring proper entertainment.  Starting from scratch, you have to act quickly to build shelter and beds, get crops going and build production stations for cooking food, producing clothing and weapons, crafting art and building a variety of goods for trade when the traders come.There are threats galore, of course -- pirate raiders, hostile primitive tribes, manhunter-maddened animals and disasters both manmade (toxic fallout) and natural (volcanic eruptions).The gameplay and the characters are complex, and its easy to lose all track of real-life time.This game has been absolutely dominating my gameplay time for over a year already (I bought the game back in Alpha 7 days; this review is a few days following Alpha 14 and the initial Steam launch).  I definitely recommend it!

Early Access Review
								First off let me say that although this game says early access, it in no way feels like an early access game. I've rarely, if ever, ran into a bug that greatly affected gameplay or anything like that.I'm always amazed at the amount of detail put into this game every time I play it. From some colonists missing a middle toe to someone having a jaw injury due to their background as a soldier which impairs their ability to talk and trade with others.Every colony really is truly different because of the randomly generated worlds and all the unique combinations of skills you can get on a colonist. Theres also the many random events that can take place such as anything from a small raid by a local tribe to a nuclear fallout which forces everyone indoors until it subsides.I've never had a boring experience playing this game and it's always fun trying to figure out how I will get past the next challenge, I highly reccommend this game :^)

Mia might have had a chance, but seeing all the bloodshed caused something in Fields to snap and she killed Mia before going on a killing rampage against helpless forest creatures. After taking a nap in the same bed where her dead friend still laid, she went on another rampage before a fox took vengeance for all his furry friends. The moral of this story: Killing woodland creatures is never a good stress reliever.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								Dwarf Fortress Lite with a UI. For those who haven't played DF, it is a top-down colony management sim where you set goals for your colonists and they carry them out. I really enjoyed this game and easily got my $30 worth. There's a lot of priorities to balance and different paths to success. One thing I like about it over DF is that there is an actual end-game goal (which you can prioritize or ignore at your leisure). There are various difficulty levels from trivial basebuilder paradise to really hard ones where you are essentially under siege from all sides. Despite being a much simpler game than DF, I still felt that the combat was implemented better. Economy is simpler but still complex enough to keep you busy. Highly recommended, you will lose a weekend to this.
