Mia might have had a chance, but seeing all the bloodshed caused something in Fields to snap and she killed Mia before going on a killing rampage against helpless forest creatures. After taking a nap in the same bed where her dead friend still laid, she went on another rampage before a fox took vengeance for all his furry friends. The moral of this story: Killing woodland creatures is never a good stress reliever.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								Dwarf Fortress Lite with a UI. For those who haven't played DF, it is a top-down colony management sim where you set goals for your colonists and they carry them out. I really enjoyed this game and easily got my $30 worth. There's a lot of priorities to balance and different paths to success. One thing I like about it over DF is that there is an actual end-game goal (which you can prioritize or ignore at your leisure). There are various difficulty levels from trivial basebuilder paradise to really hard ones where you are essentially under siege from all sides. Despite being a much simpler game than DF, I still felt that the combat was implemented better. Economy is simpler but still complex enough to keep you busy. Highly recommended, you will lose a weekend to this.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is a drama generator disguised as a game. You could just go through the motions and play this challenging survival game. Or you could take a few moments to actually read about the characters you are playing with and watch the story unfold.In one game, an overweight male cook crash lands on a RimWorld with two naked female sex slaves. The women are constantly frustrated at their lack of clothes. Mr. Cook is constantly hitting on the girls and trying to get lucky, and is constantly rejected. The girls who have the necessary survival skills between them (except cooking) ignore the cook's advances. The cook eventually goes insane and runs around in a crazy stupor until he eventually starves to death. The girls who cannot cook eventually get depressed over having to eat the corpses of animals they hunted raw and end up fighting. The one with medical skills is knocked out. The survivor has no medical or hunting skills. They both starve to death...In another game a family consisting of a daughter who is a researcher with some medical skills, her mother the botanist, and the ex husband/father who was a soldier, crash land near the pole with their pet Husky. The botanist can't do anything without a hydroponic set up as nothing grows in the cold and ice. The mother can also cook. The daughter can hunt and cook. And the father can build a shelter. They manage to build a small, heated space and have plans to create an indoor hydroponic set up to feed themselves as there are very few things to hunt out on the ice.Then the daughter is attacked by a polar bear while hunting a rabbit. The father rescues her. While she is in bed recovering, the father and mother can't take the stress of being in such close company anymore and start fighting. The mother is injured. The father has no medical skills. The daughter gets an infection which can't be treated and gets gradually worse. There's a short in the battery room and power is knocked out - with no power there's no heat. Mother - with some medical skills - gets hypothermia. Father can't repair the battery as there's no metal left, and the daughter had the mining skills. Besides - the polar bears are still out there...Eventually food runs out - the daughter dies of her infection. The mother dies of hypothermia. The father can't bear to eat the corpses of his family and starves to death. The dog survives by eating their corpses. Eventually, a wanderer stumbles upon the settlement. He figures he could just live there, mine some metal and fix the hydroponic set up. There's no food, but he has no problem with eating this frozen human protein lying around. He survives for days, repairs the battery compartment, and is re-buidling the hydroponics.A few days later an escape pod crashes near the shelter. The old man rescues the young woman - the girl of his dreams! He locks her in a room while she recovers, hoping to woo her and convince her to stay with him, that cannibalism isn't all that bad and that people are actually quite tasty. But she rejects him. Eventually he goes insane from digging up the frozen corpses and butchering them, and in his madness he attacks the dog. The dog incapacitates him outside the shelter, and the old man - unable to get back inside - freezes to death. The young woman locked in her cell starves to death...10/10 would turn cannibal and abduct women again!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 17, 2016
Early Access Review
								My partner bought this game and I decided to give it a shot and was immediatley hooked.I have just around 6 hours and I have decided to tab out of my game to write this review on why i believe you should buy this gmae. The following harrowing tale has just taken place in the space of about 15 minutes irl time and nothing i am about to recount has been made up. It has all just unfolded in front of my eyes and i just had to share the experience before i forget all the minor details.It is the 6th of summer. After being banished from their previous tribe this band of plucky cavemen and women set out to start a new.After a month of toil and food all but run out. Today is the day of the big harvest, at least, it was supposed to be.It is a chilly morning. 3 degrees c but the sun has risen and its warming up niceley. Everyone is ready to take in the harvest when V3trox spies some raiders to the north. Fortunatley we have prepared for this. The tribe is all skilled in the use of bows and our recent addition "toad" has been working hard to equip everyone with a bow.V3trox calls the whole tribe to arms but leaves toad behind as she is an outsider and has no place fighting for the tribe and is left to perform the cleaning duties.3 radiers come into sight. One armed with a shotgun, another with an smg and the last with a pistol. 3 against 5. We may have more men, but they have gunpowder. V3trox takes the head of the group. Velaniel, Mantis, Berro and Hawk stand behind him. The bows out range the guns, but not by much, enough to to get a wave of arrows in befor the enemy come in range.The first withering hail of arrows is released in a catastrophic failure, All 5 arrows completley miss, the tone of the battle is set. The first raider, armed with an smg opens up with a burst of shots. The group of tribesmen is peppered but mostly superficial wounds. A leg is shot here, an arm there but the tribesmen hold their ground and let loose another round of arrows. A couple hit but the damage is superficial. All 3 raiders are in range.The tribesmen are quickly mowed down in a merciless shower of leaded death. V3trox is the first to fall. A shotgun sweeps across him. His torso shredded, a hole in his stomach, damage to his left leg, his left foot is nowhere to be seen and in its place just a bloodied stump. Mantis is decimated. Smg rounds in every part of his body including his spine.Berro takes two full shotgun blasts. Blood pooling beneath herHawk takes the worst. Every raider scores a good hit on poor Hawk with both kidneys sporting nasty bullet holes.At this point all the tribesmen are still alive, albiet downed in pools of blood and vicera. Some concious and unable to walk. Others plain unconciousVelaniel retreats to the safety of the camp and to seek aid from Toad but all is not lost. One of the raiders is downed under the pouring stream of arrows. The  remaining 2 raiders, satisfied with the damage they have caused proceed to try and take a prisoner each and proceed to pick up Hawk and V3trox but a stray arrow landing on the floor forces one raider to drop v3trox on the ground. The raider turns around to see Toad screeming at the top of her lungs brandishing a spear. He gets hit, somewhere in the torso. The raider lashes out. A flurry of punches knocks Toad to the ground giving the raider time to flee. Toad is down and out. The final raider, a blonde female, runs with v3trox over her shoulder. Who knows what these raiders want but she was desperate to get v3trox back to her camp.Velaniel is trying to chase but struggles to breath. A stray bullet from the initial engagment has punctured her lung. Thats not going to stop her though. She continues the chase, launching arrows at the final raider. Each one lands a hit, each arrow slowing the raider to a bloodied stop. The fight is over, Velaniel gasping for air refuses to give in. The future of her tribe is at stake. She cannot afford to simply lay down and give up. She grabs v3trox and takes him back to the camp. She does the same to the rest of the downed tribesmen. Bleeding and gasping for breath she gets them all home. Velaniel stares at her dying tribe. No one will survive, they have all lost to much blood, had to many damaged organs. Only one person will survive. She walkes up to toads bed. What a ♥♥♥♥♥. A few punches and she was on the ground unconcious. This outsider. With only a few cuts and bruises. Velaniel tries to patch up some of the cuts whilst all the tribesmen she worked so hard to rescue all bleedout in their beds.Velaniel applies the final bandage before passing out on the floor, air failing to fill one lung. Toad awakes to see her saviour lying on the floor and carries her to her bed and applies whatever medical care she can muster...Will she survive without meds.This was too good for me not to share. I could restart with a new game or i could struggle to survive with just one survivor, maybe two but its unlikely

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								No one ever thinks they’ll stoop to cannibalism.  But, then again, you don’t normally expect a bandit raid, 20 man strong, to storm your base in the dead of night while bunkered down for the winter.  12 colonists dead, 20 bandits laying frozen in the snow outside, and it’s just Cythia left to keep the joint running.Well… Cythia and Sam.  But Sam has never quite been the same after taking that bullet to the head and somehow surviving.  He used to be head of research but… he can’t keep up with much anymore.  Most he can do is push a broom around the joint, and even that doesn’t convince me I shouldn't just gut him for parts and be done with him.“You dolt.  You didn’t store anything in the walk-in storage?”Well… I did.  But the fire that broke out during the raid gutted my stores.And Cythia can’t run this joint on her own.  Which, really, she pretty much is.And there are all these perfectly good, frozen, man-shaped bags of meat just… sitting there… right outside my door.Like I said.  You don’t start off thinking you’ll have to eat someone but….====Don’t let the hours fool ya.  I backed this a couple years back direct from the developer and have been playing dev build after dev build, watching it grow in complexity.  I’m excited to see it out on Steam now, and can’t wait to see what the community does for the game through the Steam Workshop.It is a FANTASTIC game that has kept me occupied for countless hours.  One of the best parts, especially after you get your friends hooked in a few secessions of their own, is telling the stories of what was.Some damn brutal stories of survival, triumph… and a lot of failure.

content:

Early Access Review
								I bought this game at the end of 2014 and have been in love with it ever since.It is a truly remarkable basebuilder. It accomplishes this by mixing a few geners into it. It is part basebuilder, part RPG, part survival and part towerdefense.Playing the game feels like being in a constant crisis, death is ALWAYS looming for your colonists. It will take a long while before you can relax a couple of minutes, there is just too much that HAS to be done. Maybe you could also call the game a crisis management simulator.Other things i like:Good balance between micro and macroYou can designate global tasks for your settlers but can also give them a specific tasks if neededCrisp graphicsAlthough simple and 2d, the graphics are very crisp and clean.Decent interfaceHardly any bugsGood modding supportCool soundtrackGood replayabilityI usually don't play games after i finished it once but i have with rimworld. The different biomes and difficulty settings allow for very different experiences.

content:
Posted: July 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								I’ve been playing RImWorld for well over a year now. It is a cross between unrelenting frustration and exquisite joy. This game makes most micromanagement games look weak. You micromanage your micromanaging. Which can be a bit frustrating of course. From setting up schedules to making sure someone is working on research of some kind. Protecting yourself from attacks and building a rocket to escape the planet, everything needs to be planned and then planned again. When you learn how to do something, win a siege or build that rocket, there is a sense of accomplishment. Now that it is on Steam perhaps others will have a chance to hear about it and give it a try. It’s a real lot of fun, and the mods for it….wow. The community long before it found its way here to Steam was outstanding. Some of the mods were incorporated into the game in the past. The team that works on RimWorld really listened to us in the past, and I do not see that changing anytime soon. Worth the price and then some Don’t let “Early Access” fool you, this is a well-polished game and then some.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								I played this game already for countless hours before the steam release and I'm still doing so.it won't get boring, one of the advantages of a large and very good modding community. You will alway find new challenges to master. Make sure to visit the forums though, you won't find all the good mods on steam.In general, I can highly recommend this to any player who likes base building games, with a lot of strategic decisions mixed with the strong survival aspect of the game.As most of the reviews mentioned, there are a many similarities to "Prison Architect", due to the angled top down view and the the building system ( single blocks, put together to build your desired colony / prison ).I played some Prison Architect, but I never really enjoyed it, so I can say I like RimWorld a lot better!You can play your colony simply as a base builder, recruit people and have a prospering place to live. Or you can go hardcore, fight against nature and hostile factions. There is surely a setup you will enjoy. From basebuilder to real struggle to survive is everything included. This game offers you a real challenge if you are up to it!Theres is a lot of detail to the game and your colonists. Social interactions with other colonists, ranging from hate to marriage. A health system where you can lose and replace limbs and organs. Individual traits for the colonists making them a super soldier, doc or that guy who is always on the edge to a mental break.The combat system is divided into melee and ranged and you can get into big and epic firefights when 20 pirates start to raid your colony and you have to defend against them. You can set up your defensive system over the whole map and generate a new layout never seen before.Set up a big prison wing to keep all the prisoners, captured during enemy raids and convince them to join you.There are not only human threats, but also mechanoids, advanced killing machines, which can be the end to an unprepared colony. Nature itself can make it a struggle to feed everybody, when the sun is covered for months during a volcanic winter. Or a solar flare disables your heaters when its -60°C outside.A lot can happen and there is enough material for a very good story.This can make your first start a bit tricky, but over the course of time you will learn to deal with each situation and I'm sure at some point, there will be another great colony somewhere in the endless vastness of space ... There are complaints about the lack of multiplayer, but I think they are unjustified. There is no real need for it. However, I can agree that I would enjoy to visit or raid other colonies, AI or not. It goes hand in hand with the fact, that you are currently restricted to the piece of land where you start. There is no possibility to take a few colonist and wander off to start another colony on the same planet ( a generated map from where you can choose your start biome ). This would allow you to trade and do all the interactional stuff and I would love to see that.Always keep in mind that this is still an Alpha version and that there is a lot of time to implement mechanics into the game.I give a lot of credit to the developer, he keeps every new version perfectly playable. With each update there is new content to explore.If you are still not sure whether you should buy this game, there are a lot of videos about it. I already made several Let's Plays myself with various setups. You can check out the newest one here: 


YouTube™ Video: RimWorld Alpha 14 | Part 01 | Modded w/ CombatRealism | Pawn Creation & Custom Scenario 

			Views: 127		

			The two of you were living peacefully on a distant planet, somewhere in the endless vastness of space. One day raiders assaulted your hometown and imprisoned every survivor.		

This is the corresponding playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLHHfuzUMWiggnx2gXvNknHaw72KtXtxCY

Posted: August 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								The stories and challenges to throws at you are amazing.One run I did I had four colonist's let call take Jim, Jack, Fred and Sally.Now Jim and Fred are brothers.Jim, Jack and Fred are all gay.Fred falls in love with Jack.But Jack loves Jim.Jack and Jim end up dating.But Fred doesn't give up he keeps on trying to impress Jack; who keeps rejecting him.Until Fred in a fit of depression because of all this rejection has a psychotic break, attacking Jack (who has a shotgun). Jack fires just one shot - BAM; and Fred is dead.Horrified that Jack killed his brother Jim kicks Jack out of his bedroom and refuses to have anything to with any of them.Meanwhile Sally, the one straight female character here,has been trying to reconcile all these guys, finally snaps and refuses to leave her room even to eat.Seriously the amazing stories that are organically grown out of the randomness that this game provides are amazing.Or my other run;Things were going strong into winter.When toxic fallout hit.As it his a lone wander joined, running through the toxic gas.Everyone was safe, we had heaps of food, we just need to sit still till things are safe.But no, the newbie who joined is a pyromaniac. He starts burning things, he runs outside and start smashing my solar panels (the only thing from keeping everyone from freezing to death), He attacks the other colonists and generally threatens everything. In the end he had to go, he was shoot trying to destroy our batteries. The fires are out, then suddenly we are attacked by 8 dudes with rocketlaunchers and frag grenades.ripping open my base (in the middle of toxic fallout). The run in, its a mess but somehow we fight them off.The rest of the winter is a fight, but we make it, half way through spring the toxic fallout finishes, my hapines fades as I then get hit by a cold snap and an infestation.Stories like this are what elevates this beyond other management games.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								(Review written on Rimworld Alpha 14 Steam Release)This game doesn't grant me a single hour of sleep. Horrors, nightmares, constant fear of stuff breaking down and colonists going berserk.You want an example:- New colony, 3 ppl, going on well, spring looking good.- Base building up fine, new folks coming in.- Lots of hunting and growing for the winter.- 7. of fall, manhunting pack of 18 wild boars tearing through my wooden base doors, killing my only meele guy, his dog goes berserk, eating the prisoners whilst the boars kill and eat my colonists.- Colony up for over half a game year. A wire in a wall had a short circuit, ignited the oven in the fridge, that ignited the food.- Temperatures went over 300°C in minutes, killing 2 colonists who tried to put out the fire through a heatstroke.- ALL food and all medicine burned, no animals around because it was winter.- Colony starved to death in days.Haven't had this much fun since Minecraft. Rimworld has the same addictive potential.Full mod support via Steam Workshop3 different storyteller AI with additional difficulty settings, can be changed ingame at any time.Scenario editor: Adjust existing scenarios or create your very own colony conditions:- Constant eclipse so solar cells and growing plants won't work? As you please.- Tribesman colony with cannibals on the ice shelf of the south pole? No problem.- A thunderstorm all the time with colonists exploding on death? Well, here it is, have fun.Constant updates, bugfixes and balancing adjustments.Good combat system.If you like pain, colony macromanagement and combat micromanagement I absolutely recommand this game to you.11/10!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								Started out by making a base above ground.  Spent a lot of time planning and making sure everything was taken care of... then a rabid rabbit ate the survivor with the most medical skill.  Well, heck.  Oh another person joined!  Good.  Wait... a raid?  Okay, grab the rifle and let's do this!  Okay, he's dead.  Oh... food... right.Everyone died.Second game, I know!  I'll build in a cave!  Set a huge area to mine.  Half way through, carrying resources out, the ceiling caves in, killing two.  Third eaten by a rabid boar.Nearly 50 hours later, I have a working base and am having the most fun ever!A hardcore simulation in the vein of Dwarf Fortress, deep in strategy.  The graphics are simple but do a great job conveying information without being too taxing.  The events are varied and fun and the scenario editor is a great way to make exactly what you want.It's a game where you can make your own stories, spend a long time building, then have it all taken out by a lighting bolt setting fire to your mostly wooden structure.  Cave building is a good thing, just don't dig too big and make sure you set up an outside base for your people to sleep while you're mining.Plant potatoes first.  You can hunt for meat and all but potatoes are a life saver.The game is still in active development.  I recommend it now and I can't wait to see what is coming.  There is huge potential!

content:
Posted: July 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've been playing this game since A10, I think - dabbled with it on and off before that but not enough to really pay attention to versions or the like, I kickstarted it because the concept seemed interesting and I wanted to see if the dev could deliver.Simply put: They delivered. It's fantastic. This game will eat your free time. If you're into colony management type games, if you've ever wanted to play Dwarf Fortress with an actually functional GUI, this is almost certainly going to scratch that itch for you.There's minor annoyances, like with any management game - the lack of any easy way to prioritize jobs by area is a bit irritating, but I recall a mod for that in A12 and I'm sure it'll find its way to A14 sooner rather than later. Simply put, anything that bothers you, you'll probably be able to mod out or adjust to your liking.Pick it up if you're looking for something to sink hours into.

content:
Posted: September 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								When i first saw this game on upcoming early access games it just seemed like a ordinary ♥♥♥♥♥♥ ea game that devs had already abandoned, i was not interested in it until release. Overwhelmingly positive reviews, interesting gameplay and fairly original idea got me buying the game, gotta say i am not disappointed at all. The game has incredibly high replayability value since there are so many different events and the map is randomly generated. What in my opinion makes Rimworld really unique are the colonists everyone has their own traits, skills and weaknesses. Mood meter for every colonist keeps the game interesting since you can't just build a huge inpenetrable wall that has nothing but farms inside of it, that would only lead to breakdowns and insanity, raiders would eventually get trough because everyone is losing their mind and are unable to repair the walls. There is just the right amount of complexity to not make playing boring. Overall amzing game 10/10 m8

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								When I decided to give this game a try, I was expecting a simple and fun little base builder, but I couldn't have been more wrong. For an early access game, Rimworld is packed with content that will last your for a long time. With a charming artstyle, addictive gameplay, great music, devoted development team, and massive modding community, this game is sure to be a success. Like I said, this game doesn't feel like an early access game at all. It has enough content to be released now and still get great reviews, which is always a good thing when buying a game. And even when you feel like your done with the game, take a look at the steam workshop, because the modding community is one of the most passionant I've ever seen. For the $15 price, I would definintely recommend this game, however that doesn't mean it's perfect.My first playthrough, I had no idea what I was doing, and my colony immediately crashed and burned, and even after my 10th playthrough, I'm still learning new things you can do in this game, and it's also not easy what so ever. That being said, this game is much more complicated that it looks, and the learning curve can be kinda frightening.However, if you're a fan of building games, management games, strategy games, or top down combat games, you're sure to like this game, and spend a lot of time with it.

content:
Posted: March 27
Early Access Review
								There are two kinds of people who play this game: 1) hardcore players who live for the thrill of almost-certain death (really, it only takes time--plague WILL get you), or 2) p*ssies who reload saves when a beloved colonist's head gets one-shotted into oblivion. I am (mostly) unashamed to say that I am one of the latter. Point is, there's a place in this great game for both types. So for all those tender-hearted people out there who have heard about how amazing this game is but are aghast after reading about man-hunting wild boars, psychopathic organ harvesters and vomitty plague, worry not. Go ahead and build your little utopic base for your colonists, because you only wanted to escape your tacky old pop superstar life after your career tanked in that unfashionable old midworld to make ugly-*ss statues which you can never sell because you foolishly made them out of pure gold that the traders won't ever have enough money to buy and instead will be sniffed out by raiders who have a true appreciation for your unique artistry. Really, there's no shame in it. There's even flowers.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 9, 2016
Early Access Review
								RimWorld is nostalgic of old, great, later 90's-early 2000's village simulation games. It has great touches of many genre's, which shows the depth of knowledge the developer has of games. The developer, however small, is smart and deserves the credit for making a game as genuine and knowledgeable to core, enjoyable, gameplay mechanics. I personally give this game 9/10, on my scale, if it had better graphics, less repetitive and less frustrating raids/mood mechanics, maybe it would be perfect, and perfectly easier to beat for the higher difficulties. Honestly struggle a lot on the higher difficulties, but that's another thing that makes this game special. The randomness, the struggles, the attachments and efforts you make to protect your fort and your people, is amazing and a feeling you don't often get in most games. Buy the game, play it, support smart devlopers, who knows how to build a smart/great game. I sometimes wish the game's goal wasn't to leave RimWorld, but to stay. That's how much I enjoyed my time with it.

content:
Posted: August 9, 2016
Early Access Review
								RimWorld is nostalgic of old, great, later 90's-early 2000's village simulation games. It has great touches of many genre's, which shows the depth of knowledge the developer has of games. The developer, however small, is smart and deserves the credit for making a game as genuine and knowledgeable to core, enjoyable, gameplay mechanics. I personally give this game 9/10, on my scale, if it had better graphics, less repetitive and less frustrating raids/mood mechanics, maybe it would be perfect, and perfectly easier to beat for the higher difficulties. Honestly struggle a lot on the higher difficulties, but that's another thing that makes this game special. The randomness, the struggles, the attachments and efforts you make to protect your fort and your people, is amazing and a feeling you don't often get in most games. Buy the game, play it, support smart devlopers, who knows how to build a smart/great game. I sometimes wish the game's goal wasn't to leave RimWorld, but to stay. That's how much I enjoyed my time with it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								Rimworld is, frankly, one of the best games I've played all year. Its a great mix of roguelike/permadeath, survival, and mangament games. Each of your colonists has a unique set of traits and skills, making them better or worse at a variety of activities. You gotta manage your base, the moods and needs of your colonists, all while slowly teching up and building a spaceship so your colonists can continue the cycle of traveling the stars and seeding rimworlds. Each playthrough is unique. There are a variety of different random events, some good: like getting a herd of puppies to self tame themselves to your colony, and some are bad, like getting attacked by an army of space pirates. There are a lot of details that make the game very in depth, despite its highly cyclical nature. Even good, talented players will likely fail their first half a dozen playthroughs, I know I've come nowhere close to victory after all the hours I've put in. Honestly, it doesn't seem to matter, I have fun each time, and every time its a little different.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								I played this game already for countless hours before the steam release and I'm still doing so.it won't get boring, one of the advantages of a large and very good modding community. You will alway find new challenges to master. Make sure to visit the forums though, you won't find all the good mods on steam.In general, I can highly recommend this to any player who likes base building games, with a lot of strategic decisions mixed with the strong survival aspect of the game.As most of the reviews mentioned, there are a many similarities to "Prison Architect", due to the angled top down view and the the building system ( single blocks, put together to build your desired colony / prison ).I played some Prison Architect, but I never really enjoyed it, so I can say I like RimWorld a lot better!You can play your colony simply as a base builder, recruit people and have a prospering place to live. Or you can go hardcore, fight against nature and hostile factions. There is surely a setup you will enjoy. From basebuilder to real struggle to survive is everything included. This game offers you a real challenge if you are up to it!Theres is a lot of detail to the game and your colonists. Social interactions with other colonists, ranging from hate to marriage. A health system where you can lose and replace limbs and organs. Individual traits for the colonists making them a super soldier, doc or that guy who is always on the edge to a mental break.The combat system is divided into melee and ranged and you can get into big and epic firefights when 20 pirates start to raid your colony and you have to defend against them. You can set up your defensive system over the whole map and generate a new layout never seen before.Set up a big prison wing to keep all the prisoners, captured during enemy raids and convince them to join you.There are not only human threats, but also mechanoids, advanced killing machines, which can be the end to an unprepared colony. Nature itself can make it a struggle to feed everybody, when the sun is covered for months during a volcanic winter. Or a solar flare disables your heaters when its -60°C outside.A lot can happen and there is enough material for a very good story.This can make your first start a bit tricky, but over the course of time you will learn to deal with each situation and I'm sure at some point, there will be another great colony somewhere in the endless vastness of space ... There are complaints about the lack of multiplayer, but I think they are unjustified. There is no real need for it. However, I can agree that I would enjoy to visit or raid other colonies, AI or not. It goes hand in hand with the fact, that you are currently restricted to the piece of land where you start. There is no possibility to take a few colonist and wander off to start another colony on the same planet ( a generated map from where you can choose your start biome ). This would allow you to trade and do all the interactional stuff and I would love to see that.Always keep in mind that this is still an Alpha version and that there is a lot of time to implement mechanics into the game.I give a lot of credit to the developer, he keeps every new version perfectly playable. With each update there is new content to explore.If you are still not sure whether you should buy this game, there are a lot of videos about it. I already made several Let's Plays myself with various setups. You can check out the newest one here: 


YouTube™ Video: RimWorld Alpha 14 | Part 01 | Modded w/ CombatRealism | Pawn Creation & Custom Scenario 

			Views: 127		

			The two of you were living peacefully on a distant planet, somewhere in the endless vastness of space. One day raiders assaulted your hometown and imprisoned every survivor.		

This is the corresponding playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLHHfuzUMWiggnx2gXvNknHaw72KtXtxCY

								This game is probably the best in it's genre. You'll witness tragedies and triumphs, celebrations and struggles. Your colonists and their varied strengths and weaknesses become personable and intricate in itself. The way you choose to play is completely up to you. You can create a thriving utopia on a fertile plain with minimal raiding problems, or you can choose to carve out a living in the ice steppe by creating a subterranean bunker with hydroponics. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								(Note: 0 hours on record at time of writing, but have been playing since alpha 3f; the game has been available outside of Steam through its website for over two years, and during that time I've spent many hundreds of hours on the game and am the maintainer of a small pack of mods.)RimWorld is amazing. It's a game that I am certain will come to be spoken of with similar awe and respect as Dwarf Fortress - except this time, there's graphics and a UI that won't melt your brain!As a colony management sim you will encounter tragedy and comedy, usually at the same time, as your colonists struggle to survive by collecting materials from their surroundings to build shelter, construct furniture, and make power sources and workbenches to produce advanced goods or process stuff into other stuff. As if keeping people fed, warm, and happy wasn't enough, you'll have to deal with bandits, mad animals, solar flares, heatwaves...Inter-colonist relationships? Check. Trading? Check. Traditional and hydroponic farming? Check. Research? Check. Art and mastercrafting? Check. Your colony being thrown into turmoil because a psychic wave turned a herd of llamas into a vicious manhunting pack of death? Check. RimWorld has all this and much more that I won't spoil, along with a superb soundtrack that perfectly fits the mood and never feels repetitive. If you get tired of the vanilla game, there's dozens of times more content available via mods.Honestly, you cannot call yourself a true fan of colony sandboxes until you give RimWorld a spin. The price is absolutely fair for the enjoyment it'll give you.

								Rimworld is easily one of my favorite games. Vanilla RW is polished, engaging, full-featured, and grim. The community is ranked among the best: friendly, helpful, and industrious. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 17, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've been playing RimWorld since Jan 2014 and I can't recommend it enough. It's like playing a top down version of the Sims only 100x better. :) You start out with a few colonists and start building up the colony from there. You will be utilizing various different types of people, which don't always get along.Each playthrough is a unique story and you'll likely be relating the story to people around you. My friend and I have swapped RimWorld stories over lunch at Taco Bell many many times. The stories are created by you, but also by the story telling AI. It keeps an eye on everything you're doing and throws little curves your way to bring you down a bit or help you a long if you are struggling. There are various different types of story tellers and various difficulties in each style you choose. With the steam release and Steam Workshop integration, using Mods and shared scenarios will be easier than ever.  I honestly can't recommend this game enough. If you like base building or management games you'll love RimWorld.

								I've owned RimWorld pre Steam release and for me it's one of the most solid early access purchases I've ever made. Posted: July 17, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've been playing this game off and on again for the last two years before it came to steam. It's an amazing game, and it's very easy to find yourself playing this game for hours and hours at a time without realizing. The game has a built in storyteller which determines the events that happen to or arround the colony, this makes it so that even when you may lose and your game may end, it's usually to something different each time and keeps the game interesting and fresh. It makes it a lot less painful when you lose and have to begin a new colony. Which is probably something you'll end up doing quite a bit. So pretty much buy it, it's worth a lot more than it costs.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								RimWorld is an example of Early Access done right. The current state of the game is more feature-complete and bug-free than many full releases, yet Ludeon Studios continues to improve and add new features to what has become my favorite 'base builder' game. The game is very mod friendly and integrates with the Steam Workshop to provide hundreds of mods and custom scenarios. The AI storyteller will often produce hilariously frustrating situations that are reminiscent of Dwarf Fortress. A DRM-free version is available if you purchase the game through their website.

content:

Early Access Review
								This game is awesome!I've been playing since the early Alphas and boy it has evolved into such a great game. It does not have all the complexity of Dwarf Fortress which it is obviously based on, but it is no pushover either. The mod support is great and the only thing I really find to be missing is the possibility to play on multiple Z-Levels. That being said, I simply adore this game and, though I do tire of it from time to time, I continually find myself coming back to it when looking for a good fun game to play. I don't think I will ever stop playing this game.Though the price right now may seem a little steep at first when you look at the store page, know that if you want a Dwarf fortress-like game that doesn't dissapoint you, this is probably one of your best bets and worth the price.TL:DR I love this this game and recommend it to anyone that likes prison architect and/or Dwarf Fortress.

Early Access Review
								Don't let the dark looking and prison architect copied/inspired graphic style step you back.In Rimworld, every playthrough is a complete different story, a thrilling, success, happy, sad, terror story. The amount of mechanics and content in this game are astonishing and they actually play along with each other affecting the colony in diverse ways. Coupled with a dynamic world filled with dangers, you will never get a rest.You can set the gameplay style and difficulty level at start which actually make a big difference making it a high replay value game.You can choose how many people and materials you want to start with.You can choose which type of biome you want to land on which will affect all your decisions and how you build your base.A true gem of a game like no other.

Early Access Review
								This game even though it is in early access is more polished then many games at release. So if you're typically staying away from early access due to lack of content and polish then you might want to make an exception for this game.As the game description says one could call it Dwarf Fortress with a pretty interface, but that would be selling this game short. The storyteller will always find something new to throw at you to see if you can handle it.

								Sawyer looked after every one. Her last two friends ultimately succumbed to their wounds in their beds while she desperately tended to their dying needs. Overcome with grief, she decided to exact revenge on the prisoner they kept in the holding cell. She quickly executed the prisoner and left the corpse where it was.For the next few days she was dead to the world as she slept to heal from the wound incurred from the last raid. Unbeknownst to her, a basket of berries had kept the cold storage room door ajar and the last of her food had spoilt. Though she could have resolved to start over and rebuild, she said "$&# it" and headed to the prisoner's cell.A few days later, this message:Sawyer, Doctor has gone berserk! The final straw was: Ate corpse.Sawyer was last seen running into the woods, engaging in melee combat with a boomalope.I hate/love this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								RimWorld is gold. If you like simulations and emergent gameplay, similar but not identical to Dwarf Fortress, this game is an absolute gem. I really hope the developer keeps adding additional gameplay mechanics, but even if they don't this is an outstanding simulation/survival/sandbox game as it exists today.I originally played the default game mode where you have 3 colonists from the start, just to learn the game a little. I came back and started over with the solo colonist because I figured it would be an easier way to start with just one person and it was. So far it has been awesome. I spent a while using my single colonist working on a simple home and camp. Then I was notified someone was fleeing pirates and I could either help them or ignore them, I chose to help. I killed the pirates chasing her and then found out she was a cannibal. Unexpected to say the least. Later someone decied to join my colony, she was also a cannibal, we're talking 2/3 are cannibals and I never had any say in this, it was emergent. Suddenly I'm dealing with a colony that is mostly cannibals. So now when pirates raid me or folks fall from the sky in cargo pods that I can't get to right away, well.... lets just say they don't go to waste, in a disturbing kind of way ;)This game is awesome, it's worth the money if you like this sort of thing, if you like Dwarf Fortress and just wished it had reasonable graphics and a far better interface (like use of mouse), this is your game, hands down. It's not as detailed as Dwarf Fortress, but it's also not shallow either.I won't go into all the details but suffice to say:- Detailed control over everything you build, down to the walls and doors- Detailed control over your colonists, when they should sleep, what activities they are responsible for, etc.- Use based skill system, the more a colonist uses a skill the better they are at it- Detailed control over combat, control where your colonist goes and whom they target- Emergent game play; colonists traits and weaknesses when observed will encourage you to do things you probably wouldn't normally do; some colonists would rather wield a ranged weapon, others would rather be awake at night rather than dayThe ONLY thing I can complain about, is the lack of height, Dwarf Fortress supports multiple levels of elevation, but this game only supports one, it's a missed opportunity, but I understand the complexities of supporting it, it's a bit of a bummer but at the same time, it's a hell of a lot more manageable this way as well.

content:
Posted: January 3
Early Access Review
								I don't normally write reviews, but here is one of my stories that just happened:Andrea started this colony on her own with her dog, Mandy. Over time,♥♥♥♥♥♥ Lidia, Calvin, Othello, and Ian join the crew. Now♥♥♥♥♥♥was there from day 3. I tried to get them to hook up, but then Lidia came crashing out of the sky (literally) and won over♥♥♥♥♥♥ That was fine. Now let's talk about Calvin. Calvin was this big guy that joined the colony sometime after Lidia and♥♥♥♥♥♥started sleeping together. Calvin had a thing for Lidia. Lidia didn't care. Andrea, however, was that friend next door/co-worker type; You saw them all the time and talked, but you didn't see them as anything more. Some time went on and Ian joined the group. Ian was Andrea's long lost brother and no one liked him (including me, but that's beside the point).One day Ian goes out hunting and pulls a Robert Baratheon (mauled by a boar). Ian dies and Andrea is devastated. Calvin and Andrea start to talk a bit more here and there. Next thing I know, they are lovers. Before bed on their first night, they vist the grave of Ian. They go to bed and wake up as usual. That's when it happened.Two raiders appear.Now Lidia and♥♥♥♥♥♥don't do♥♥♥♥♥♥(incapable of violence bull♥♥♥♥♥♥. Othello, Calvin, and Andrea run out and take these thugs down. Calvin is attacking one raider while Othello is taken out by the other and being carried away. Andrea runs to save Othello because Calvin is a big guy and is holding his own. Andrea takes out the raider, but it's too late for Othello. She runs back to Calvin to find the raider has killed him. She beats the holy hell out of that raider and heads to the hospital nearly dead herself. While this is all happening, our only prisoner has gone berserk and breaks out of prison. The prisoner attacks Andrea's dog, Mandy, and beats her to death.Andrea sleeps in the hospital for a whole day and wakes up on the brink of a meltdown.♥♥♥♥♥♥and Lidia try to help with the healing and cleaning, but Andrea winds up wandering off into the forest because of all the grief. I wanted to follow right along side her.Moral of this story: do not become attached. I was warned and learned the hard way. This game is amazing. Buy it already. I read many of these reviews for the stories and was so glad when I finally created some of my own. I can't wait to see what else they do with this game.5/7

content:
Posted: July 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								Before anything; READ THE FICTION PRIMER!!I know, reading is boring, but it fleshes out the game so much it's almost a shame to pay for it and not know the lore.Here's a little hint to get you started: Humanity never discovered FTL-travel, yet we've conquered the galaxy...What makes Rimworld so good, for me personally, is the depth it has.I know of no other games where your colonists can have fingers shot off, broken wrists, etc.I also know of no other game in which you can harvest organs to implant if your colonist has an old heart!Diseases, psychological breakdowns, a nice social system, ...It all adds up to very immersive gameplay, which I happen to like.It has a large community and a lot of mods, so browse through the workshop a few times in the next few days to add some stuff that you might find usefull to reduce the micromanagement a bit or to add buildings/features. Or visit the nexus(but, since there's a workshop, I'm more lazy than impatient about mods so I'll just browse daily).

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								Tthe thing with rimworld though is it's not a "game" persay. It's a story, which is why suddenly and out of nowhere your entire colony is brutally slaughtered by some terrible event. You have 3 different story tellers. One of them, Randy Random can literally drop a giant pirate raid very soon after you crashland, your colony is dead and your story ends. Or you could survive for a little while, or you could survive long enough for you to build a new starship and escape the planet. Rimworld is a story, of survival and hardship. Your colonists suffer ilnesses, infections, injuries. They can lose limbs, eyes etc. They can get dementia, a bad back. A brain injury. Missing eyes. They can also fall in love, get married. Then you have families, a raiding part might attack and one the raiders if the brother of one of your colonists. Then there are rivaleries, just like in the realy world people don't always get along. Say a colonist dies, now a couple other colonist might've been good friends so they'll get a massive hit their mood, as a close friend died but another colonists hated them and now they're dead they're happy and have a spring in their step. Every colonist has traits and backstorys that are randomly generated. Some may be pyromaniacs, others may be cold tolerant, again others might be alcholics, drug addicts, hard works and the list goes on. For bakcstories, they may have been surgeons, builders, bounty hunters, royality and the list goes on. It's a very deep game and immensely satisfying. Unlike other random colony or city builders you get very attached to these colonists because of how deep this game is.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								TL:DR = build a colony, watch your colonists die, repeat.I bought this game way back in Alpha 4 I believe. It's been years in development but with every update comes a deeper, more refined game.Like many people are saying Rimworld is an unholy union of Dwarf Fortress and Prison Architect, set in a Fireflyesc universe.In the game you build and manage a group of stranded settlers. Watch as you settlement grows; your colonists develop, interact and eventually die. That last part is something you'll have to get used to as this game can be brutal.Due to this undeniable fact of Rimworld the health system for a game like this is pretty complex with various body parts and effects being simulated. If your colonist gets a toe or two shot off his movement speed will be affective, if he catches a cold his conciousness is affected..  over time your veteran colonists will more than likely loose most of their appendages and require prosthetics.. one of my colonists has none of her original organs as well as having cybernetic limbs and eyes..."she's more machine now than man".That is just one small aspect of the game however. There are others to worry about too, such as; seasons, temperature, colonist schedules, research, trading, diplomacy, to name a few.This is to say Rimworld hasn't got it flaws, but with all honesty they are usually addressed pretty quickly. At the moment the AI pathfinding can be a bit iffy but chances are this will be fixed in the next update, a sign of a good developer is that they address the underlying flaws in their game before adding new features. An example ot this was the trade caravans and raiders attacking in extreme temperature regions in the previous alpha version. with Alpha 14 they no long do this... so you won't have a trail of corpses leading to your colony after an especially cold winter or hot summer.Overall If your a fan of base builders or managment games then I would wholly recommend this game, even at the current pricetag. It is a game I always play at some point, and it's replayablity is probably one of it's strongest assets, due to it's procedual nature.So please have a go, build a colony and watch it eventually been thrown into chaos either by famine, fire or intergalactic robots.

Early Access Review
								I've never wrote a review for a game so that might say something.I'm a long time civilaztion series player and was a bit skeptical when a buddy referred me to this game.  This game was smoothly addicting right off the bat and the stories I've witnessed have been amazing.  My first playthrough ended hilariously.  I captured a raider and threw him in a cell.  Shortly thereafter a heat wave hit.  All 4 of my colonists got severe heatstroke.....and promptly went to their beds unresponsive.  The prisoner must have sensed his opportunity.  He beat down the prison door and was loose in my base.  I was mortified that he'd destroy everything but he went for the front door & beat it down for his freedom.....awww sigh of relief.  But no wait- not so fast!!! On the way out he decided to set fire to a power line. Again not terrible because the line was pretty far away from my wooden walls.  He then ran into an angry tortoise.  The tortoise bit him.....he fell back with surprise and stumbled into his own fire. He wandered into my wooden walls panicked & ablaze - fell down next to them with his last breath. He promptly burnt to a crisp.  The walls caught fire from his burning corpse. Every poor colonist laying unconsious in their beds ended in fire that day on the rim.Rip my little dudes....ripYou can't make this stuff up.  Buy it now- this game will not disappoint

content:
Posted: August 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is a great strategy and base building game that has so much to offer. The core game is great, but the mod community makes the game even better. I have been using mods to create massive bases and have raids against dozens of raiders and it is a blast. I also have a barebones game where I am struggling with few resources on hand. There is a lot going on this game and the documentation is alright, but I learned a lot by trial and error and watching youtube videos. The events in the game like diseases and toxic fallouts keep you on your toes. It can be really intense as you struggle to keep everything in working order. I would recommend this game to anyone and everyone who enjoys base building games. I can't wait to see what the final product looks like as the development team seems to really know what they are doing. I would be shocked if they fell into the rut that many game developers do where the alpha is good but they make changes that seem to make no sense and upset the players. 9/10 would harvest organs of prisoners again

content:
Posted: March 27
Early Access Review
								Really fun & innovative game. I'm a big fan of crafting & settlement building, & Rimworld has a pretty good system for both. I think my favorite part is how indepth the traits & interactions of these little pawns are. I find myself getting really attached to my settlers because they each have their own personalities. I also love the modding community around Rimworld. There are mods for just about everything in the game. The modders are usually very helpful, & the developer actually pays attention to what the modders are making. Occasionally, you'll see that the developer has added contact from a mod into the actual base game.Overall, very fun little survival crafting game. I'd highly recommend it to people who like chill base building, like me, (easier modes), & those who like more challenging stategic fortess builders (harder modes). 8.5/10.

content:
Posted: March 27
Early Access Review
								There are two kinds of people who play this game: 1) hardcore players who live for the thrill of almost-certain death (really, it only takes time--plague WILL get you), or 2) p*ssies who reload saves when a beloved colonist's head gets one-shotted into oblivion. I am (mostly) unashamed to say that I am one of the latter. Point is, there's a place in this great game for both types. So for all those tender-hearted people out there who have heard about how amazing this game is but are aghast after reading about man-hunting wild boars, psychopathic organ harvesters and vomitty plague, worry not. Go ahead and build your little utopic base for your colonists, because you only wanted to escape your tacky old pop superstar life after your career tanked in that unfashionable old midworld to make ugly-*ss statues which you can never sell because you foolishly made them out of pure gold that the traders won't ever have enough money to buy and instead will be sniffed out by raiders who have a true appreciation for your unique artistry. Really, there's no shame in it. There's even flowers.

content:

Early Access Review
								First of all, I already bought the game about 1.5 years before steam launch which explains the low amount of hrs on record!In my opinion Rimworld is incredibly well made. It is both a challenging and fun game which offers a lot of variation with many interesting surprises throughout the gameplay. Quite frequently I just had to smile about the creativity of the developers, when getting challenged by different situations. But most of all I love the atmosphere! The vibe of Rimworld is very unique and makes the whole gameplay really enjoyable. Furthermore, the developers are fantastic. When I purchased the game there was a daily log everyone could follow, which showed what the devs had been working with on a daily basis. Generally, it feels like the project is taken seriously, with regular updates and good development transparency. Also, although early access this game gives more a feel of a finished game in terms of content and replay value.I can only recommend the game and think the price is absolutely decent for what you get.

Had decent stats and burning passion in shooting.>saved this guy who was running away from a pirate. ended up capturing the pirate who was a gay masochistic female>Recruited her.>Got raided by like 5 tribals, she accidentally blows off the head of the guy I saved. Then blows out my guy's stomach (Bad guys were on the other side and she was really innacurate with the sniper rifle... Being masochist probably didn't help any)>Saved a doctor from another gang of pirates. Recruit another baddie.>Everything's smooth till manhunting muffalo comes in, bites my dude's ear off before my guys slaughter the whole herd. Plenty of meat for the winter>During winter a Psychic ship lands in my area. Have to kill it because it's driving my people insane. Do so without a hitch, killing the mechanoid baddie that was protecting it>Survive winter.>Fight off a raid that blows off my guy's left leg and shoots my right, so it became infected. Had to amputate because the infection got so bad it was gonna kill him>Marshall now has 1 ear, no stomach, 2 peg legs. What a ♥♥♥♥ing beast.>Another manhunting pack of muffalo comes at us. Peg legs saves the day as everyone else was downed. Peg leg cracked in the fight lol. Repaired doe.>Second winter coming>Finally died when 14 tribesmen rushed him and he couldn't run away quick enough to save himself. Most epic.I funded this game before it was on steam and have had so many horus of enjoyment out of this game. The additions made to the steam version weren't really bragged about by the developers as much, but they have added so much to the game, and the fact that they made light of those additions makes me believe that there's much more that they're planning to add, which is so huge because I've already given this game countless hours (unlogged, as I mostly play in offline mode).If there is a game that has come out in the past 5 years worth spending money on even in early access. It's Rimworld.I haven't read any of the negative reviews (Not that there are many), but I can only think of one negative, and that's that the maps only have 1 level (You can't climb hills, or dig downward) and maybe that's something the developers will add at some point. Still worth the money, maybe even more than asking price to be honest. This game will be a classic that will be talked about years from now, provided humans survive the coming world war.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								RimWorld is like Steam Early Access: a black hole from which nothing escapes. This game is an absolute diamond that wasn't on my radar at all, but has fully enthralled me for way longer than it should have. RimWorld is all about managing a colony of people whom you will get to know and love or hate.Before you begin a game, RimWorld presents you with a randomized selection of colonists. Each of these folks has a varying skill proficiency list which includes basic skills like Cleaning, Hauling, and Harvesting or more advanced skills like Medicine, Crafting, and Warden (Sheriff). Along with a skillset, your colonists may also have other traits such as Pyromania, Drug Addictions, and even old injuries. Just as you would assume traits can have quite an effect on your colonist, sometimes for better and yet other times for worse.There are several biomes in which you can land in (or migrate to if starting as Tribals) and colonize all of which have positives and negatives. Are you in a boreal forest location? Winter will come eventually and your people need warm clothes and warm rooms if they are to survive without complaint. Did you pick a desert? Most of the year you'll have to combat high temperatures and a lack of some materials that would be plentiful elsewhere.When you decide your initial band of survivors and colony location, you'll be dropped into the game proper. Immediately your group is in dire straits: you need shelter and food. Luckily RimWorld is populated with many different types of materials with which to build and much in the way of things to eat.Besides constructing actual buildings for your pawns to live in there are also different crafting stations that allow the creation of various items like weapons and armor to clothes and drugs. If you are feeling a little country, you can try your hand at farming crops and tending animals. Electricity is another option and there are several ways to generate it as well as several ways to expend it including colored lights and television.After you get your colony up and running, your chosen A.I. will start throwing you curve-balls depending on your difficulty choices. Random events will occur and they can range from a raid by Pirates who definitely want that booty to wandering packs of animals that will join you or attempt to eat you.RimWorld is incredibly fun when things are going as you plan. However the game really shines when it is able to exploit a flaw in your colony setup. When you first lose a colonist, it is a painful experience. The next hundred lives lost don't go by any easier. Many may be tempted to simply start a new colony or reload a save game, but these losses are where the player learns how to deal with and react to each situation. Without the possibility of loss, the game would have little substance. That being said, there is a generous amount of frustration here for those unwilling or unable to let go of their village people and animals. Luckily we can construct tombs with which to honor their sacrifice.I was not an early backer for RimWorld. I learned of it's existence shortly after it arrived on Steam. Kotaku had a RimWorld article about some guy's crazy naked doctor that ate people and I knew I needed this, damn whatever flaws it would have being Alpha. This is the most complete game in Early Access that I have ever played. It is more complete than many AAA games that we pay twice the price for. However this is something that people need to understand: there are features still being added. When a major patch is put out, your progress up to that point is made invalid without some workaround. While that does suck, a major patch usually means a new feature or two so it is a bittersweet thing at worst.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								Tynan is one of the most transparent developers I have ever spoken to. Now more than ever, you have to be very careful about buying into an early access game. Many early access games have faded into obscurity or failed to deliver on any of their promise. RimWorld is not one of those games. The modding community for this game is already great, and will be made even better with workshop support. Whether you're a masochist that doesn't mind your entire colony being decimated every other day or a casual base builder, the game and the modding community has something to enhance your experience. Every update comes with a ton of new features to try out.If you like Prison Architect, this game is probably right up your alley. You have to manage all aspects of your colonist's lives: their joy, moods, health, food, living spaces...I recommend checking out the Twitch community for RimWorld if you are debating whether or not to get the game. Sacriel is probably one of the biggest streamers that plays. However, an entire other community has evolved for the game as well. There is a group that does speed running for the game (you can launch a ship to escape the world) to see who can get off the planet first. These streamers (ZeebosZone, disnof, spartyon7) play at the highest difficulty and often with storytellers that can send multiple raids each day. They also do other fun challenges, such as the Ice Sheet challenge (starting off on the coldest map seed and trying to survive), or the Cannibalism Only challenge. The fact that there are so many different challenges and restrictions you can make for yourself is one of the greatest things about this game and ensures for a ton of replayability.

content:
Posted: July 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								Definitely a game of stories. It is what makes this game so amazing. Here is my favorite so far.Ricky and Anna were 2 of 3 crash survivors. Anna was a medic, and Ricky could build practically anything. Together they built a life on Rimworld, and made the most of a bad situation. They found solace in each other after many hardships, and eventually they moved in and spent a couple of seasons bunked up. Things were looking up. Progress on their community was moving at an incredible speed with Ricky's engineering background. Anna kept everyone happy and healthy through the random raids. But new settlers arrived, and everything changed. One was a slimmer fellow by the name of Alpha (fitting). Anna took a liking to Alpha, but Ricky had no idea. He was in love with Anna and asked her to marry him. She turned him down, and shortly after, Ricky found out she was cheating on him with Alpha. This broke Ricky's heart. He built his own home, and watched as Anna and Alpha moved in together. This ate at him. Each day his mood became darker and darker until eventually he could take it no more. He caught Anna alone outside of the perimeter and attacked her with a knife, cut her right ear off, and stabbed her numerous times. She fell to the ground bleeding profusely. One of the guards showed up and subdued Ricky, locking him up with other prisoners. Alpha, with a bit of medical background, was able to save Anna, and nurse her back to health. He also helped Ricky recover...a mistake that would almost destroy the community.Even after healing up, Ricky had become highly unstable. Nothing could sate his rage. The community needed him for his building skills, but every time he seemed to improve, madness would overcome him, and he would have to be subdued by a guard or warden before he could do more harm. The community made a mistake keeping Ricky and the other prisoners in wooden rooms. Trying to earn their trust, perhaps welcoming them into the colony one day. Ricky took advantage of this. He, with two other prisoners, staged a prison break. While the other two prisoners went to dig their way out of a back room, Ricky began rampaging through the colony. He was finally shot and killed by a guard with a shotgun. Ricky had gone too far. The other two prisoners managed to escape, never to be seen again. Thankfully Anna had recovered by the time of the prison break, and with Alpha's help, they nursed the injured community members back to health. They all visit his grave from time to time and give what thanks they can to this troubled man who almost single handedly built their community, and almost tore it apart. A season later and Anna and Alpha are getting married come summer. After surviving a toxic fallout winter, and other hardships, apparently they grew closer together. Anna also just passed her 54 birthday, and as a gift, the gods gave her Carcinoma.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								Although Steam tells you something different, I have bought this game soon after it's Kickstarter campaign and easily collected over 100 hours of playtime in the past three years. I can say that this was literally the game I waited for without knowing it when I first saw it. While it has an excellent presentation it gives you the complete freedom of choice how to develop your colony on the one hand, but also an ultimate goal, building a spaceship, on the other.Before you keep on reading a word to the few negative reviews from new players: Yes, this is a complex game. As someone said on the discussions: "It's not a FPS where you start on heroic difficulty becasue you know shooters." It's a game with many mechanics you will have to learn before beeing good at it, I recommend enableing the adaptive tutorial to learn the basic systems. It's also a very slow paced game with eventual peaks in form of raids or such. The two hours you have to decide if you want to refund are not nearly enough to see all the facades of the game and get a complete picture of it. Now on to the positives.Wether you want to build an underground complex or a large fortress, all stragtegies are viable and have their own advantages and disadvantages. If you need to hold a large base you will have lots of walls which you need to defend and the enemy may break through at different locations. But while you can keep your entry small and defendable if you go underground, you eventually will have to fight bug hives which can spread sub-surface and enemies which are equipped with granades and pickaxes in order to dig their way to you.The incredible amount of replayability also thrives from the different biomes and the recently added scenario system. Each of the eight climatic environments has unique weather, animals, diseases and challenges. The scenarios give you the ability to never play twice with the same starting condition, may it be the number of colonists, items and conditions of the map or forced cannibalism.There is also an active mod community which has specialised on vanilla- and lore friendly mods that truely expand the game to it's full potential. Every veteran will be able to give you a list of some length with mods that he/she considers necessary to play the game. Of course it's not unplayable without mods but they do add many quality-of-life improvements which make playing the game easier.Many people ask why they should pay 30$ for an early access title. Bear in mind that the early access is there to indicate that the game is still beeing worked on. However it has met all his goals, is polished, optimized and generally bug-free. You are basically looking at a finished game which will get expanded in the future and thus is marked as an early access. The developer, Tynan Sylvester, who made this game almost on his own, usually releases new mayor builds every three to four months, introducing new and basic game mechanics, like the scenario system, but we will have to see how steam dynamic will change this. If there are bugs which survived the extensive testing phase, you can count on a hotfix beeing published within days.RimWorld is what it says: a story generator. Usually I'm very suspicious about games who claim that, but in this case it is totally correct. Stories on the forums range from prisoners getting torn apart in order to sell their organs to colonists which give their lives in a heroic last stand to save the colony. If you're not sure, head over to the  stories forum [ludeon.com] and read one or two to a glass of your favourite relaxing drink.Anyone who has an interest in strategy, building and/or science fiction should buy this game and probably wont be disappointed.

content:
Posted: January 5
Early Access Review
								This game is astonishing. The stories that are created as you struggle to survive everything the game throws at you will stay in your head for a while, from great triumphs to the (more likely) bitter defeats. There's something morbidly satisfying of watching you colony burn to the ground, swarming with raiders, as your colonists bleed out alone on the floor.  Developer is hugely active in both development and community; both through their own website and on reddit's /r/rimworld. Mods are constantly being developed that change the dynamic of your play-style.First game to make me actively weigh the pros and cons of cannibalism. You can harvest human skin and turn it into leather for cowboy hats. Favorite crafter has asthma? Take a prisoner and harvest their lungs. Sure, the prisoner will die, but your crafter can breathe easily again! Or build towards an entirely bionic colony and travel the globe murdering everything in your way. You can just capture them all and sell them into slavery instead, which is a great way to make bank. Although drug production is a rather lucrative option as well, if you're willing to deal with the occasional addicted dog that got into your cocaine stash.You can see average hours of other reviewers, and you can see the fascinating stories. The price does appear a bit steep as you're browsing around the Steam Store, but I, personally, have found it to be worth every penny. That steep price actually led me to download the free* version to make sure I wasn't being swindled by EA promises (oh StarForge, how you've betrayed me). Three hours in, I deleted it and happily bought the official version. Now I'm actually debating on picking up another copy or two to gift to Steam friends, to both further support the developer, and spread the gift of catastrophe.Get it now.*Yeah, there isn't a free version, but I think we all got that.

content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								I started this game and before I knew it 10 hours had passed.  My first play through was a disaster, but it was a disaster that was so engrossing that I couldn't look away.  TL:DR Buy the game.To me the whole story was about Mary or "Mars" as everyone called her. She was stranded on this planet with her son and a rough looking miner who had an eye for her. They sat up a colony by the side of a lake until a soldier named Jack radioed for help. The colonists of Laketown rescued him and patched his wounds. Mars and Jack fell in love almost instantly. Jack was the backbone of the colony and made sure everything ran smoothly, Mars was proud to love a man like that. One bright day, Jack stumbled into some ruins filled with mechanized warriors. They were hostile and chased him back to the colony. One by one the colonists fell, until only Mars and a girl named AJ were left. They were able to finish off the robots and to try to treat the wounds of the other colonists. It was pointless though, all the medicine was gone and there were no traders in the area. The first cassuality was her son, he got an infection in his leg, then Jack, her beloved Jack, then the rough space miner had to be euthanized because of a shattered spine, AJ did that, she never liked him and got a little pleasure out of it, Mars thought she was sick. That was the breaking point for Mars, she snapped and killed all of the other colonist, suffering mortal wounds as she did. Mars died alone in her bed, insane with grief. They say when you visit the lake on a quite night, you can hear Mars, her son and Jack all laughing and playing horse shoes, united together again.

content:
Posted: July 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								So everything was lovely in "Melhadfs World", crops were growing indoors under a sun lamp safely, everyone had a bedroom, the solar power surplus was enough to get through a winter night without difficulty. Even Raids were easily defeated.But then a storm came, greater than anything else. Lightning tore the sky, and my colonists slept.  Nothing could disturb the sleep of the hard working survivors. They had earned it.Over the horizon a predawn light grew, a flicker at first in the distance, then another on the opposite horizon and a third to the south. The light grew brighter, a blaze slowly enveloping the screen. the colonists awoke to fire ripping through the roof, all but one immeditately started to put out the blaze.  The other one, well she did the most british thing possible, she prepared a meal and cup of tea for the firefighters.But the blaze was too out of control, slowly people succumbed to the effects of the fire, passing out and being consumed in the blaze. While the lone tea maker wondered what had happened. She eventually went looking for them, upon seeing their corpses she ran into the blaze to save her lover... but it was not to be and she died just out of arms reach of him.The fire consumed everything, leaving nothing but 8 burnt bodies.
