content:
Posted: April 5
Early Access Review
								Surpisingly fun and addictive! Having bought this game on a whim, I had little to no expectations going forward, now I'm sorry I didn't buy it sooner! Rimworld provides a unique approach to city management, resource management, building, and simulation / strategy genres while remaining simple enough in gameplay to quickly pick up and run with it. Though simple in design, there are enough random elements and variables within the characters and maps to make for a true infinite possibility of gameplay, true re-playability at its finest. If you've been on the fence about this game make the leap, you'll be sorry you didn't do it sooner! Worth it at full price (truthfully worth more than the full price)Pros:Simple, engaging, and addicitive (maybe that's a con)Controls, UI, and time management make this easy to play on any system with any amount of time availableInfinite replayability and random aspects of gameplay, no two games will ever be the sameCons:Some of the more complex gameplay features are a little hard to deduce the first time throughStill in development; until full release it's hard to give a true 100% review.Worth it at full price, a must buy when on sale! 4.5 / 5

								tl:dr - Do try this game.  Don't get attached to your colonists. Kill all the cougars.There were five of us.Daniel "Dan"Olesya "Lalande"Theodore "Seraph"his brother, TanIvanand Flora, our retriever.We started out with a modest farm, built into the mountain, slept out in the cold.  Things weren't easy but there were livable.  Tan was getting over his Flake addiction by taking up sculpting, Dan trained Flora and they were inseperable. Lalande and Seraph hooked up on day one.  Ivan was Ivan.We managed to get up a solar panel, a battery, and a freezer within just a few days.  Next task was working on living quarters.  However before too long a pair of raiders came hunting us down.  We killed one and knocked out the other one.  Threw him in a makeshift cell and learned his name at least. Finn wasn't so bad.  Ivan sort of befriended him.  A day after that a woman ran into camp to hide from some local tribe.  Her name was Carson.  We took care of the pair of tribesmen rather quickly.  Things couldn't be going better.  It was only a matter of time before something happened.A cougar, of all things.  Started huntin Flora.  It was by far the better predator and killed our dog.  Daniel lost her leg to that thing before we managed to put it down.  The damage was done.  So we made a tomb for Flora, and set Daniel in bed.  We had used up all our medicine so we couldn't do much about a prosthetic.  Sometime after that, Seraph and Lalande got engaged, Ivan convinced Finn to join us, then started dating Carson.  I guess Ivan isn't so odd after all.  A drop pod got us some medication so Daniel could get the medical procedure she needed to walk again.Then we hit a dry spell.  Nothing happened for days.  We built rooms for everyone. Celebrated the Wedding of Seraph and Lalande, and even Ivan ended up proposing.  Everything went to hell so fast.  Middle of the night, a battery overloaded and started a fire in the freezer.  All our food went up in flames.  Ivan and Carson died trying to put out the fire.  They never got to get married.  The rest of them waited outside as the fire died down. Our farms survived.  We had four stable crops that gave a steady supply almost daily.  So we started rebuilding.  What would you know another damn cougar shows up and takes down Daniel.  Finn tried to lay some cover fire, and Lalande grabbed a knife.  Sadly they weren't quick enough.  Daniel died that day.  It took her arm this time, and even chewed off a bit of Lalande's toe.  Finn started cowering and Tan finished it off before it could get more of Lalande.So now there's four of us.  And I still can't stop playing despite the pain and suffering.  I can't help but cheer on the survivors, and hope for the best.  At least I've got Tan, Seraph, and Lalande.

								This game is incredible. If you're a fan of city builders, or survival games, and you can deal with the graphics, this game will give you hours of fun.My longest colony went on for about nearly 8 years, all of the original members still kicking. I sent out 4 of my colonists in a caravan and a day later was attacked by a large raid and all but 2 people were wiped out, leaving 1 a vegetable. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 5
Early Access Review
								Surpisingly fun and addictive! Having bought this game on a whim, I had little to no expectations going forward, now I'm sorry I didn't buy it sooner! Rimworld provides a unique approach to city management, resource management, building, and simulation / strategy genres while remaining simple enough in gameplay to quickly pick up and run with it. Though simple in design, there are enough random elements and variables within the characters and maps to make for a true infinite possibility of gameplay, true re-playability at its finest. If you've been on the fence about this game make the leap, you'll be sorry you didn't do it sooner! Worth it at full price (truthfully worth more than the full price)Pros:Simple, engaging, and addicitive (maybe that's a con)Controls, UI, and time management make this easy to play on any system with any amount of time availableInfinite replayability and random aspects of gameplay, no two games will ever be the sameCons:Some of the more complex gameplay features are a little hard to deduce the first time throughStill in development; until full release it's hard to give a true 100% review.Worth it at full price, a must buy when on sale! 4.5 / 5

								I have been playing RimWorld since very early alpha, about 2 years now. This is the best colony simulator I have ever played, and I have played them all up to now.If you are worried about this being Alpha, don't be. I imagine modding will be even better (if possible) on steam.Graphics are awesome (kind of like Prison Architect) gameplay is incredible and depth of immersion is fantastic.I can't give this game less than a 10 out of 10.If you love colony type games (DF, Gnomoria, etc...) You will love RimWorld! Buy it now! You will not be burned by "early access" on this one. The game is already 100% playable.

content:
Posted: July 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								Fun and addicting game. Primely features town simulation and survival.I lost a lot of sleep when I first started this game.What I like about this developer is that he is always participating on his own forums too.And Rimworld doesn't really count as Early Access any more.Now. Surviving on a Rimworld...A colonist gets their foot and arm shot off, or cut off by the assorted wildlife and invaders.This makes them very innefficient, and I notice how bad this was after watching the injured colonist hunt elephants one handed, and limp away very slowly.I luckily have a prisoner that I kidnapped from a recent raid.I chop them up for spare body parts.Transplant those onto my injured colonist.Good as new!Now the rest of the colony is horrified towards what was done on the prisoner.But they had a fun party recently, which calms them down. One colonist was a beautiful woman, but after losing a hand and an eyeball, nobody in the colony likes looking at her any more.Fixed this by inserting an eyeball made out of solid gold and giving her a wooden hook hand.Now they think she's beautiful again.Another pirate gets a lucky shot and shoots a colonist in the head. Damaging her brain so bad she becomes a vegetable.Colonists have to deliver her food each day to keep her alive.Have to find a brain implant to fix her.An orbital trader eventually comes along and has one.It's more expensive than the rest of my colony combined.Food stores are getting low, and I now really have to consider whether it's worth it to keep this vegetable colonist alive.Surgeryworld.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've only played 15 hours so far, but I know I have a great many to come. For my review, I'll talk about some gameplay I had.My last colony, I started with one man, Arkady (and dog, Orange), some rss and a joywire. Built some simple rooms against the rock face. Joined by one guy, Stephen, helps me mine out some more rooms into the rock face. A little later a good grower and cook comes along, Anna. Things are really starting to go well, making meals and growing crops, lots of steel. Fought off an attack well, got some extra guns but Orange died. Arkady upset, buries the dog.Get a message about an escape pod. I rescue the pod lady, but as soon as she regains the ability to walk she is off. I check her health, she's bleeding and as I watch one of her stats drops a level. Ok, draft Stephen and arrest her. She can stay here until she is healed. I forget about her for a bit and things go on well.Then, a larger raider group comes through with high calibre weaponry and the skill to use it. Right, draft all my guys up, let's get out there and shoot these guys. Did well the first time.As we approached, Arkady and Anna take up long ranged positions. Enemy sniper shoots first. Blows Arkady's leg clean off. Second shot destroyed his stomach. Stephen roared, charged the sniper, who calmly blew his head off. Anna, without stopping to think, grabs up the screaming mess that was Arkady and runs back to base, locks the door and tries to stop the blood pouring from Arkady's ruined lower body.The raiders take a few items but never enter the base itself, leaving a few hours later. Between feeding the prisoner and tending Arkady's wounds, Anna built a prosthetic peg leg for Arkady. It was then she noticed he wasn't eating, slowly starving to death. Of course, the stomach was destroyed. This is when the prisoner came to mind.That night, when the pod lady was sleeping, Anna stole into the cell and put her under anesthetic. A short while later, pod lady's stomach had been removed without killing the patient, and transplanted (as well as the peg leg) into Arkady. Who became infected.While Anna tried to keep up with the cooking, feeding and treatment of Arkady, the pod lady awoke. She was not happy at all. In fact, she flew into a full on psychotic rage. Can't say I blame her, she'd been held against her will for several days now and had woken to find her stomach gone. Anna tried to explain that this was never what they meant to happen, while pod lady proceeded to pummel her into unconsciousness before fleeing into the night.Arkady heard all this, slowly dying from infection. Depressed about the loss of Stephen and Orange, barely conscious, he slipped away later that night. Perhaps he just lost the will. Anna lay in the halfway outside, slowly bleeding out while drifting in and out of consciousness. Her last thought was how it had all been for nothing in the end. They'd taken her stomach, and he had died anyway.Pod lady's future is unknown. Maybe she found help in time. Most likely she starved in the forest, without even a rumbling of her, now rotting, stomach. END.Each of my play throughs has had this unique feel to it, with stories generated from the game naturally. The difficulty and struggle, coupled with the ability to make morally questionable choices in order to survive, make this feel very real. Would steal someones stomach again.Note: I played Dwarf fortress for many hours, and that is a very good game. Its inpiration to this game is very clear in the mechnics and playstyle of this game. DF is, however, very complex and very niche. Rimworld is DF that is accessible to both hardcore and casual gamers.Small Update: Some hours further in with the vanilla game, having a lot of fun. Decided to check out and run some mods. There are a lot of very good mods. Very active, dedicated and talaneted collection of modders in this community. The developers of this game have made mod support a priority, this much is evident. The vanilla game has a huge number of playable hours, practically limitless because of the variations. With mods, the combinations of play styles, stories and setting are truly uncountable. TL;DR If I could put five thumbs up, I would.

content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								Fun sci-fi colony builder with great replayability and cool random encounters.From my last permadeath playthrough:- Food is running low, so I mark a stag for hunting.- My hunter shoots the stag and knocks him out.- The rest of the herd notice, become agressive towards my hunter and knock him out.- Their bloodlust not sated, the herd turn towards my colony and starts rampaging through the buildings.- I order the remaining colonists to bunker down in the mess hall.- The herd tries to crash through the door, but it mercifully holds. The colonists cower in fear.- Using the door I carefully start luring the deer in my kill zone.- Finally manage to kill all the deer. My dog is in rough shape and the hunter, though alive, still needs rescuing.- Take care of the wounded.- Carve up all the animals and use their meat to make meals.- Close call, but the colony suddenly has enough food to last for two seasons.... Awesome :)

content:
Posted: July 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								Day 4:-Three Raiders attack my settlement, armed with clubs and knives.-Two of my Three people rush in to defend.  The third won't attack because he is incapable of violence.-My men get in position - one has a pistol and is behind some cover close to the entrance of my base.  One has a rifle and is standing back a bit.-The raiders enter the mountain pass in approach to my base.  The first shot of the battle rings.-My pistol wielding soldier falls to the ground.  Shot in the back of the head by my soldier wielding the rifle.  The shot missed it's mark.  The fight is now 2v3.-Another bang sounds through the air.  The shot misses.-A 3rd shot from the rifle whirls through the air.  Another miss.  The Raiders are getting closer.-A 4th shot scores a direct hit...... on a bear that was sleeping 50 yards away from the Raiders.  The fight is now 2v4.-The bear runs past the Raiders, clearly running towards the soldier with the rifle.-I close my eyes and hear the loud "CRUNCH!!!!" sound of my soldier losing a leg.  The other would follow soon.  Followed by the arms...... the rifle soldier was now dead.  The fight is now 1v4.-The last man standing is the solider that is incapable of violence...-BOOM! The first bear swipe at my wooden door.-BOOM! The 2nd swipe at my wooden door.  My pacifist soldier is standing in a dark room - saying his final words.-BANG!  A gunshot rings again.  The Raiders are trying to shoot through the door.  The shot lands on the bear's back.-CRUNCH!!!! The first Raider loses his head immediately.  The other two follow, although not as quickly.-CRUNCH!!!! The bear feasts on the Raider's corpses.  -ZZZZZZZ.  The sound of the bear falling asleep, clearly content with his meal.Day 6,971-The Pacifist King tells the story of the two brave soldiers, the three Raiders, and the bear.-The King jumps into his ship and blasts into orbit, leaving the harsh world behind him ....... His people watch the ship blast off into the sky without them.10/10  Would hide again.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've played a few early access games and Riwworld is one of my favourite games.   I've backed this back in 2013 and I tend to play couple of hours a week with it.   No two games are the same when playing and it can be super frustrating or super awesome.   I've still yet to actually escape from this Rimworld but I've loved every second.      The game can seem super complicated at first but it's easy to pick up the basics and you will soon be growing, mining, researching and maybe eating human flesh.The basic premise of the game is you crash land on a planet and have to survive.   Will you dig deep into the mountains and make a fortress, build a massive log castle outside that might just get set fire to by raiders or wait and build up super strong stone walls.Now about the game the standard vanilla rimworld is lots of fun and will give you hours of gameplay.  But then if you add in the fact this game loves mods and some of the mods people produce are insanely good.   Do you like zombies then there is a mod, do you like raiders on atv's there is a mod for that, how about mods that manage your resource levels yep again there is a mod.With the inbuilt modding in alpha 14 it makes it super easy to apply mods and you can do it all from in game from the steam workshop which is AMAZING.   If you struggle installing mods as it seems complicated you will love this.Oh and alpha 14 now has a scenario editor so you can create custom scenarios to play.   Imagine starting out a new colony with 100 pet elephants yes you can become hannibal and have a horde of elephants its mucho fun.I think the price is fine considering this came out three years and I'm still playing it, it's still got an active developer and super passionate fans.  So don't think you are getting a buggy early game with placeholder game as you are buying an awesome game.Just don't blame me after launching the game and hours have vanished from your life haha.

content:
Posted: August 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								My short review:  Wow - just wow!I haven't been this hooked on a game in years!  It's tough, your colonists will die and sometimes your entire colonies will die - but the experience is incredibly fun.  It's definitely not an easy game (at least not when playing on the 3rd difficulty level), but it is very rewarding.The depth in this game is amazing.  Colonists have lots of different personality traits, there are lots of things to research and build, each world is different, and there are many types of random events.  And the really cool thing is all of these things are significant.  Also, the modding community is great.  The base game is loads of fun, but I highly recommend getting some of the popular mods once you get used to the basics.  Personally, I've never been a mod person, but in this case I found about 30 I really like - they add depth to the game without affecting the balance.  (although there are mods out there that affect balance)Many thanks to Tynan for giving us this gem of a game!

content:
Posted: July 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								Ignore my steam in game time because I have played well over 100 hours of this game before it hit steam. What is this game: Rimworld is a game where you are a dungeon keeper type being who controls a small population of colonists for either their benefit, or detriment. This is a game where one minute you are taming cute bunnies then harvesting your prisoners for hearts, lungs, livers, and kidneys or, trading for some stell with other local populus then fight some mechanical centipedes from space. Ok, it may just be drawf fortress but it is *announcer voice* IN SPACE* and is much more user freindly.If you don't know what dwarf fortress is doesn't matter, this game is a strategy/sim game through and through with combat and can make some very interesting situations happen that you would not expect. It is great for people who love to micromanage but you don't have to do if you  don't want the game allows you to be as indepth or shallow as you like with its controls.If you know someone with the game ask if they have a download link, then if you enjoy it, buy it, the small team who makes this game deserves it ten fold.

content:
Posted: July 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								Let me begin by saying this: buy this game right now, you won't regret it. So i've been playing this game for just about 2 years now, and presumably hundreds of hours later, (already have 23 on steam alone and it just came out) I can not recommend this game enough. This game is an absolute blast. A challenging, infuriating, exciting blast. The visuals are simple, but beautiful. The music is brilliant. The gameplay is emergent and you will never get the same game twice no matter how hard you try. Over the time ive had with this game I still am not good at it, and I still love it. I always see peoples huge fortresses, and thats what I shoot for, but something always goes wrong. Even through that it has been an absolute blast. As a huge fan of Dwarf Fortress, I have tried many other games inspired by it and they just havent been up to snuff. Rimworld manages to, while not being as complex as Dwarf Fortress (and who could blame Tynan for that), be continually more and more complex and interesting while never getting stale. I remember when my friend first showed me this game, back in around July 2014, I thought it looked too good to be true. Absolutely not, it is fantastic. And it just keeps getting better. This is not one of those early access skeletons of a game for a quick cash grab. Tynan truly pours his heart and soul into this game and it shows, Rimworld is astoundingly fun. This game generates a story, a story of a colony, that probably goes down in flames. And its a story thats engaging every single time I play. Bonds are made, raids are fought off (sometimes), cropped are blighted, and fun is had. Just as the mantra of dwarf fortress says -- Losing is fun. Stop thinking about it, buy this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								As a rule I generally don't write reviews; not out of some arbitrary reasoning, but out of fear that I don't have insight to either advising picking up a game or steering clear of it.This is not the case with Rimworld.Rimworld is arguably one of the finest crafted games ever released for the colony/survival genre. Boasting a huge range of character traits, a complex relationship system between characters and a potentially harsh or easy world to survive in. The game is entirely fantastic in it's ability to tailor your experience from a relatively easy adventure through a lush, temperate forest; all the way up to a ball-crushing torture fest of surviving in the harsh, arctic tundra, or the equally terrifying super dry deserts.If you have even the slightest interest in this game, please do yourself the favour and pick it up. Whilst it's only just come out on Steam, I have well over 500 hours of gameplay prior to it's release: and I've loved every single second of it. You will not regret this purchase, it's ♥♥♥♥ing fantastic!

content:
Posted: January 3
Early Access Review
								I don't normally write reviews, but here is one of my stories that just happened:Andrea started this colony on her own with her dog, Mandy. Over time,♥♥♥♥♥♥ Lidia, Calvin, Othello, and Ian join the crew. Now♥♥♥♥♥♥was there from day 3. I tried to get them to hook up, but then Lidia came crashing out of the sky (literally) and won over♥♥♥♥♥♥ That was fine. Now let's talk about Calvin. Calvin was this big guy that joined the colony sometime after Lidia and♥♥♥♥♥♥started sleeping together. Calvin had a thing for Lidia. Lidia didn't care. Andrea, however, was that friend next door/co-worker type; You saw them all the time and talked, but you didn't see them as anything more. Some time went on and Ian joined the group. Ian was Andrea's long lost brother and no one liked him (including me, but that's beside the point).One day Ian goes out hunting and pulls a Robert Baratheon (mauled by a boar). Ian dies and Andrea is devastated. Calvin and Andrea start to talk a bit more here and there. Next thing I know, they are lovers. Before bed on their first night, they vist the grave of Ian. They go to bed and wake up as usual. That's when it happened.Two raiders appear.Now Lidia and♥♥♥♥♥♥don't do♥♥♥♥♥♥(incapable of violence bull♥♥♥♥♥♥. Othello, Calvin, and Andrea run out and take these thugs down. Calvin is attacking one raider while Othello is taken out by the other and being carried away. Andrea runs to save Othello because Calvin is a big guy and is holding his own. Andrea takes out the raider, but it's too late for Othello. She runs back to Calvin to find the raider has killed him. She beats the holy hell out of that raider and heads to the hospital nearly dead herself. While this is all happening, our only prisoner has gone berserk and breaks out of prison. The prisoner attacks Andrea's dog, Mandy, and beats her to death.Andrea sleeps in the hospital for a whole day and wakes up on the brink of a meltdown.♥♥♥♥♥♥and Lidia try to help with the healing and cleaning, but Andrea winds up wandering off into the forest because of all the grief. I wanted to follow right along side her.Moral of this story: do not become attached. I was warned and learned the hard way. This game is amazing. Buy it already. I read many of these reviews for the stories and was so glad when I finally created some of my own. I can't wait to see what else they do with this game.5/7

content:
Posted: July 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								What more can you say when you can cram 5h a day to play a game, while pulling long hours at work for 10 consecutive days (weekend included)?I have only played 19h so far, and even though I'm as tired as I ever was, I'm afraid to start up this game, because I'm fairly sure I will end up playing for another 4-5 straight hours, before finally heading to sleep at 4am. Again.Disclaimer: my pedigree includes everything from ATARI to Spectrum, 386, 486, Pentium, MMX, and so on. While Quake and CoD are fun to play, the games I typically invest more time are games such as XCom (the old school ones: Enemy Unknown and Apocalypse), Europa Universalis Rome,  Sword of the Stars, and even Majesty.I am a sucker for a challange and an awesome AI that doesn't resort to cheats to trample over my dead body.Now how does RimWorld rank?With a steep learning curve, I took 3-4 hours to learn the ropes. Now, I'm learning about defense, research, trading, herding, resource management, beautifying the settlement, joy, and everything else. The list is too big.I have around 5-6 stories, but one that touched me a bit more than the others. I will update this review later, when I'm not so tired. Will probably play this now. Damn.10/10Quick update: managed to only play 3 hours.Finally had an awesome home base with 5 settlers, until the game decided it was getting a bit boring and unilateraly decided Malaria would make things more fun. Skip forward several game days.Now, 2 settlers left, moody and sad, and 1 gone crazy... "Engi". First Engi striped naked and walked around, refusing to eat or sleep. Her BFF "Nine" had to arrest her so they could finally force feed her.That didn't last very long, considering Engi almost imediately jumped up and went on a rampage, trying to force the prison door open.Engi's best friend Nine shot her on the spot. And yet, Nine rescued Engi immediately, and tried her best to tend to her dear Engi. That's true friendship, I have no doubt. Engi ended up dying of infection, a few days later.Outlook is bleak... But I will come back to "Rimville" tomorrow. All odds are this story will end just as all others... a sea of hopelessness, desperation, sorrow and suffering. 11/10.On a final note... Screw herbal medicine, might as well pack it with dirt, rambo style (hint @ game dev).

content:
Posted: July 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								Im going to break down this review in 2 parts: for people that know what Dwarf Fortress and those that dont.if you know what DF is and you like it, just buy this game. you will definetly enjoy it. maybe you wont think its better or anything but it is worth your time and i personally think that it could surpass DF with enough time and dedication.if you dont know what DF is and never had your Dorfs mauled by a carp before, this game is basically a colony builder where you try to keep your "pawns" alive as best you can in a border world. these types of games are usually realy daunting at first but RW in general does a very good job of easing you into the core gameplay loop and has several features (such as being able to control your drafted pawns directly during attacks in a similar fashion to other grid based games) and being able to manually tell someone to do a specific task goes a long way towards making the game more player-friendly. i suggest watching youtube videos of people getting their colonys up and running, dosent matter the version. its real hard to put into words exactly the type of game/gameplay you can expect out of it but just 5 minutes with a video and you will have a fairly clear idea of what to expect.in general its a solid game. several things can and will be improved, either by the devs or modders, but with just what they got now you will have a lot of enjoyment out of this game. i havent experienced any annoying bugs either, some stuff definetly needs to be balanced/worked on and stuff like that but it runs just fine.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								Okay, so this is one of the few games I pirated before buying, just because I didn't really want to waste $30 on a game I wouldn't play. And I know about Steam refunds, but I find that I need a bit more than just 2 hours to get full impressions on a game, but that's besides the point.The point is that this game is, to put it simply, bloody fantastic. The level of depth that this game goes into is simply amazing. I won't go into the gameplay that much, because I find it's more fun to discover it for yourself, but I will give you a brief overview of the plot if you play the standard scenario. Three colonists are in cryptosleep, only to be awaken by their ship falling apart. They barely manage to make it to the escape pods, which land on an unknown rimworld. Your job, as a hive-mind commander sort of thing, is to help your colonists survive by giving them indirect (or sometimes direct) orders. Whilst trying to keep your colony alive and happy through random events (good or bad) that occur. These include, but are not limited to: raids, flashstorms, trade caravans and heatwaves. These events are determined by an AI story teller you choose before starting the game, each having different personalities. Depending on how you play this game and what AI you choose, crazy things can happen. As an example, once my colonist, who's son had just died, went on a rampage, shot his cat with a minigun, then ate it. So yea...So if you are a fan of Prison Architect or Dwarf Fortress, then I definitely recommend picking up this game. Even if you aren't a fan of either of those games, still check this game out. "What? You don't make human leather cowboy hats? It's a great market to get into."

content:
Posted: July 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								RimWorld. A game of survival. This game Is one of my favorite games to play. The endless replayability and many different objects, scenarios, people, tribes, weapons, foods, plants, animals, tools, Its all just a great game. I love the art style. its very similar to prison architect in art style which is also a great game. One of my favorite moments was when one of my colonists leg was shot off after a raid.  He was stuck and injured so i brought him to a medical bed. I then order a surgury so we could install a peg leg. My Doctor at the time had a skill of 15 which is pretty good. I started watching hi  preform the sugury but i got bored and started designing some other part of my colony. A little message pops up say *the surgury went slightly wrong* so i was thinking oh maybe he messed up and needs to try again. I move back over to the medical bed where my colonist was on and i see him bleeding out on the bed. Very confused i click on him and check on health. The first thing i see is *stomach removed* "what, excuse me" how the ♥♥♥♥ while trying to install a peg leg did you miss and cut his stomach out. And then i see *severe heart bleeding* and again i like "what the ♥♥♥♥ happened" how is it that while doing surgury on someones leg did you *slip* while cutting and cut a mans entire stomach out with one swoop and slice is heart open. AND THEN, i see the docter, WALKING AWAY TO EAT. Like Oh boy after that surgical mishap it would be a great time for a lunch break. While the colonist is still bleeding out on the damn medical bed.  I laughed for a good 10 minutes about it, and shared the story with all my friends who thought it also hilarious and all found an interest in the game!I would Reccomend this game 10/10 if someone is looking for a Crash landing survival simulator with a prison architect kindof feel. It is worth the purchase as it can be replayed many times and has hours and hours and hours of content

content:

Early Access Review
								I have had this game from the very early stages of Alpha, and for the $30.00 I purchased this game, in that infancy it has by far surpassed my expectations more than any other game I have every prepurchased; so much so that I just had to write a review when finding out about the steam link because it's a great game that really needs its moment in the spotlight. To begin with it has simple and quite refreshing visuals, although it may be quite comparable to Prison Architect , and the game does play out slightly in the same style, it sure does bring a feeling quite unique to its name. If you love survival and enjoy a sandbox with scalable challenges as well as a diverse and respectable modding community, you need to get this game. Even if you don't have a very powerful rig, this game plays quite well on older models (such as my acer aspire v3). There should be no reason for you not to try this game and hopefully enjoy it as much as I do.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								So far, I have gone through 334 hrs of game play on 4 of the many biomes (desert, tundra, tropical rainforest, and temperate forest). At an “ALPHA” development stage, I must say that this looks more like a beta than anything else. Off course, the possibilities with this game are endless given that in real life there are many more biomes around the world like the Gobi cold desert in Mongolia. I would like to see them all incorporated into the game in future updates. Also, given that this game is a graphically enhanced version of a dwarf fortress like of game, the developers could be adding content to it for the rest of their life to add value to what they already have. I think I understand why they call it an “ALPHA” stage game, and it may be related to content because it seems to me that it is well balanced. It does not have as much content as Dwarf Fortress (DF) but in time it could get there. Off course, the themes are different (DF is more a fantasy like scenario while RW is more a wild west steampunk environment) but I would like to see in RW as much content as there is in DF. It would be nice to see the implementation of a Z level layer into the game like there is in similar games of the gender. It would be a huge thing.Since it is a randomly generated seeded game the playability is also endless. Try ‘mesa’ for example, it is a good seed. In addition, the emergency situations are randomly generated and there are many but this is an area where the developers could also expand.In conclusion, for an “ALPHA” stage game, your gone get more than you pay for in hours of enjoyment playing it and the possibilities are endless given the amount of mods available, and the amount of content the developers could add in future updates.

content:
Posted: July 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								Been playing this for a few years now.  The developer makes regular, awesome updates and keeps the playerbase informed along the way.As for the game itself, it's just incredible.  The game experience is incredibly customizable.  If you want a brutal, no holds barred full on fight for survival, you can have it.  If you want to sit back and build a huge colony, you can do that too, and everywhere in between.A lot of city/colony builders will tell you that "no game is the same twice", and they often fall flat, Rimworld does not.  There's just so much good here.  Rimworld is like nothing you've ever played.  The game oozes character out of every orifice.  You're going to die, but you're going to have fun doing it.Now go, cut that stubborn prisoner up for lunch and sit down for a nice meal, and get your rifles ready, because there's a horde of really♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off squirrels about to come and wreck your♥♥♥♥♥♥real soon.

								Rimworld, is a deliciously deep game with non-intensive graphics and great gameplay. You will most likely grow an attatchment to your colonists, and cry manly tears of sorrow at their death. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 11, 2016
Early Access Review
								At the time of this writing, I've had Rimworld for about three weeks, and I have already put 60 hours of gameplay into it. This game is, quite frankly, amazing; It is one of the few early access titles that I'd ever recommend to someone, simply because it is already a complete, filled game. The gameplay is fun, if a tad micromanagey; You (usually, you can play other scenarios) play three crash landed colonists, and guide them throughout life on a harsh world, trying to keep them from getting killed, or killing eachother, and eventually work your way from that, towards trying to build a ship to get off the planet; All in all, a complete experience.Alongside that, the game's already large lifespan and replayability is easily extended with the massive amounts of mods available for it; there are some mods that completely overhaul parts of the game.The best thing about all of it though is that it's still being worked on, and probably will be for a while.Admittedly, the game has it's share of oddities and frustrating moments; To highlight one of them, botched surgeries can be botched extremely badly when your doctor decides that in order to amputate a leg, they must first remove the patient's head. Yeah. But all in all, the great things about this game far outshine the few negative quirks. So I have to say it, I can't really recommend this game enough; It is most definitely worth every penny. Go get it, now.

content:
Posted: July 17, 2016
Early Access Review
								(I Have Two Reviews, Long And Short, read whichever suits you.)[Long Review]      Do not underestimate this game, it might say "early Access", but I've been playing this game for about 3 years (before they released it on Steam) and it has come a long way. This is one of, if not the best space/sim/building game I have ever played. This early access game has a lot of content in it that can make you enjoy this game for hours and hours straight without getting bored. Every game is different aswell (Unless you use the same seed and always pick the same spot where you first started), but aside from that, every relationship is different, starting is different (Unless you use the same senario). Every enemy attack is different, there is randomized weather, (It also depends on what kind of biome you're playing in) randomized animals (Differs with each biome). This game is absolutly a blast (No pun intended, you damn power surges!) The developers listen to their community, fans, supporters (Whatever you want to call us) and are constantly putting out patches and new updates![Short Review]     Quit trying to save time, and just buy it already.Pros:+Cool Backround Music+Pets+Relationships+Graphics+This whole gameCons:- Can be challenging for a new player- No tutorial

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 11, 2016
Early Access Review
								Honestly, this is one of the few Early Access Games I do not regret buying.I had been burnt by many games in EA, but after reading a lot of positive reviews, I gave this a shot. This game as of writing is my favorite game on Steam. I've always been a sucker for Colony / Base-Building / Simulation games. Planetbase, Banished, Prison Architect are games that I've fallen in love with, but this one I enjoy a lot more at the moment. Speaking of Prison Architect, the art style reminds me a lot of that.You have a lot of freedom (which is expanded even further by the great Steam Workshop Mods) to start your "story" however you want. You can customize how many people will start with you, the resources, weapons and materials to make your "perfect start"The AI Storyteller can be made to be very easy or extremely brutal if you prefer.Once you land, you'll start building your base, creating rooms for your people, researching new technologies, and creating defenses. There are numerous random events that will surprise you for the good or bad.The combat is the most frustrating in my opinion. I may just be bad at it though. Also, the colonist’s attitudes can be difficult to manage at times, but hey, the game is supposed to be challenging.If you want to just free build, there is a Debug mode built into the game with a "God Mode" allowing you to freely build and spawn items if that tickles your fancy.Overall, I feel like this is a really strong game that is VERY polished for an EA Game. I will be dumping a lot more hours into this one and it was well worth the purchase!Lessons I picked up along the way:Check the “Work Tab” and make sure your people are assigned to what you want them to do. I was working on my 3rd colony before I realized only 1 person was set to cut down trees or to construct things which really slowed down my progress.I prefer mountainous regions as you can find natural chokepoints for defenses as opposed to flatlands.Sealed structures tend to hold enemies in them (usually the game will warn you too when you get near it). I’ve wiped a few colonies by deconstructing a wall to get into it before we were ready for the “ancient evils” inside.Research Stonecutting ASAP!Tailor new clothing often as your stuff will become tattered. This makes your colony angry.Create a storeroom "freezer" as soon as you can support the power. Makes preserving food for the colony so much easier.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've played a few early access games and Riwworld is one of my favourite games.   I've backed this back in 2013 and I tend to play couple of hours a week with it.   No two games are the same when playing and it can be super frustrating or super awesome.   I've still yet to actually escape from this Rimworld but I've loved every second.      The game can seem super complicated at first but it's easy to pick up the basics and you will soon be growing, mining, researching and maybe eating human flesh.The basic premise of the game is you crash land on a planet and have to survive.   Will you dig deep into the mountains and make a fortress, build a massive log castle outside that might just get set fire to by raiders or wait and build up super strong stone walls.Now about the game the standard vanilla rimworld is lots of fun and will give you hours of gameplay.  But then if you add in the fact this game loves mods and some of the mods people produce are insanely good.   Do you like zombies then there is a mod, do you like raiders on atv's there is a mod for that, how about mods that manage your resource levels yep again there is a mod.With the inbuilt modding in alpha 14 it makes it super easy to apply mods and you can do it all from in game from the steam workshop which is AMAZING.   If you struggle installing mods as it seems complicated you will love this.Oh and alpha 14 now has a scenario editor so you can create custom scenarios to play.   Imagine starting out a new colony with 100 pet elephants yes you can become hannibal and have a horde of elephants its mucho fun.I think the price is fine considering this came out three years and I'm still playing it, it's still got an active developer and super passionate fans.  So don't think you are getting a buggy early game with placeholder game as you are buying an awesome game.Just don't blame me after launching the game and hours have vanished from your life haha.


YouTube™ Video: Rimworld alpha 14 first impressions - Rimworld steam gameplay -  Rimworld scenario editor 

			Views: 933		

			Here is my Rimworld alpha 14 first impressions vdeo. This is a preview of the upcoming Rimworld steam version which features the Rimworld scenarion editor and a host of new rimworld features.

content:
Posted: August 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								Here's the story of my very first colony.So, there's a tutorial now so I did that. But, when the "Raiding" part of the tutorial came by, I decided to have my 1 melee person attack a ranged person. She managed to get up to him, and severely wound him, but her leg got ♥♥♥♥ING SHOT OFF! Then the same happened to him. I rescued her, and installed a peg leg(I know, that's ♥♥♥♥ing cool). Everything went as normal, with our colony of women with a dog. I got a fourth person somewhere around 30 minutes of play time. So, after around 2 and a half hours went by, all of the ladies were sleeping, when all of the sudden, a ♥♥♥♥ing flashstorm came by, and started the whole place on fire. Everything was complete and utter chaos. The one person I thought of as a leader went to go save someone who was in need of rescue, and when she went inside, she just collapsed. On the other hand, the person she was carrying made it out, but left her there. All of my buildings burned down, my "leader" died, and the fire kept raging on. The fire had reached some artillery shells I found, and then blew them up. That may not seem too bad, but the person the "leader" sacrificed her life for got blown up. The other two people were doing something else in a place I don't know, but then the person who got blown up died. The dog was injured too, but of course, the dog is more important then the human. What happened after that was a series of raids, that got the dog handler kidnapped. We got another person during that time, but she only had a knife. The other lady(The one that still had a gun), went beserk, and incapacitated the new blood. Then, a raider came along, killed her, and left the new blood to bleed out. She was just bleeding out for a good 15 minutes, and then it all ended.10/10 would have a tragic event happen to innocent people again.

content:
Posted: March 1
Early Access Review
								The video and images don't do the game justice.  If you want to see real samples of gameplay - watch a YouTuber.  I spent 2 weeks watching 2 YouTubers  before the week I decided I was going to buy the game.  The let's plays were much more informative, much more enlightening for the game and it's (bluntly said..) depth.  Every moving colonist, animal, mechanoid and even objects like fire and lightning add to a depth of the game that can not be described in words.  Start the game with 1 of 3 scenarios; add a random world generation, from snow to heat to forrests to mountainous terrain (and more probably); add 3 randomized colonists with traits and inabilities (No such thing as a perfect colonist); and one of 3 AI storytellers with each some 5 or so difficulty levels; and set permadeath if you want.  Phew, mouthful - but that's just setting up a save file.  Now you gotta make your colonists survive together, avoid exploding wildlife, take care of health concerns (including surgery), weddings, colonists hating each other, mental breakdowns, umm, this is an endless list.  Then the video on the store page describes raids, traders, orbiting space traders, and..  well, death.  Welcome to RimWorld!

content:
Posted: October 10, 2016
Early Access Review
 Don't let the amount of hours I have played fool you. The first thing that I noticed about this game is how well it runs. Yes, it's the not the most demanding game in terms of RAM usage etc; but it looks really nice on the eye. The textures are great to look at.I have always enjoyed games which are unpredicable, making you wonder what is going to happen next. One minute you are being attacked by a rival tribe, the next minute you have a new colonist in your home. Having a new colonist comes with strengths and weaknesses, and their weaknesses can have a massive impact on your colony. You have be sure to keep your colonists happy, as they can fall into a minor or major mental breakdown. This can affect many thing, from gathering crops to mining resources.So far I have enjoyed every minute of this game, and is worth every penny. Get it now!

content:

Early Access Review
								a game not for everyone, but personally found it very enjoyable for the short term. the game gives you options ranging from easy as pie, to death pirates will try to kill you every other day.  choosing climate and territory will also affect how your settlement grows, and you have good options on how to prioritize your people's tasks so you dont need to micro manage them all day once you take a few minutes to set them up. late game does get a bit boring and  repetitive as you simply wait for traders to show up with rare materials so you can build your ship. but for anyone who enjoys the sims or civilization type games, this is a good choice to whet your appetite between installments and expansions.

content:
Posted: November 9, 2016
Early Access Review
								So first off I want to say that buying this game, I had full intent on not liking it. I've tried a couple of games like this (Prison Architect comes to mind) and I just could not get into them at all. Now, saying that, I have been horribly, HORRIBLY addicted to Rimworld since I bought it. It has skyrocketed up on my list of favorite games ever. The $30 buy-in for this is nothing compared to the amount of fun I've had with it so far. Whether you're fighting off raiders, starvation, mad animal packs, diseases, or just mother nature herself, you will find yourself in a world of excitement every minute you play. Yes this game is in alpha, but Tynan loves his community and the feedback he gets and he puts forth a ton of effort into making this game great. He fully supports modding and even encourages modding with fully integrated workshop support. He stays connected on twitter and acts like an actual person instead of a robot. I can honestly say that if I knew how awesome this game, the community, and the developers were before I bought it, i would have zero problems spending upwards of $100 on it. We need more games like this. Definite purchase in my opinion! :)

content:
Posted: November 5, 2016
Early Access Review
								Only 32 Hours on steam at time of writing, played Rimworld much longer before steam launch.Rimworld is a shining star in the early-access landscape. Unlike most early-access games I have invested in, I have yet to be uncertain about Rimworlds future. With an active and communicative developer, Rimworld is regularly updated with new and quality additions.This game is for everyone, whether you wish to calmly construct a settlement, watch your colonists farm, thrive and advance through technology, propogate relationships and tame and train animals through friendly companionship.Conversely, you can raid a passing caravan, capture all of the survivors, remove all of their limbs, eyes, jaws' and nose' (and much more with mods!), sustain their pitiful existence for as long as you find necessary, then replace everything with bionic fittings and blades to make your very own deadly (albeit traumatised) cyborg army.I can honestly say few games have given me as many crazed laughs and hours of enjoyment as Rimworld has.10/10 would commit horrendous atrocities against humankind again!

content:
Posted: October 6, 2016
Early Access Review
								An absolute joy to play!Initially, it has that ring of “oh no, not this again”  but as you spend more time with your chosen colonists you start to see more than just generic place-holders wandering about.  Their skills have a very real effect on how things play out. The more time you spend the more you see the complex game mechanic come alive as your colonists interact with each other and not just the environment.  What initially seems like a terrible skill system suddenly becomes a complex tool to get things sorted out..Diary of a survivor:Day 1:  5 Clan members build their new home. A makeshift wooden hut with 5 beds and a broken wooden lamp. Everyone is helping, except the Chief who seems to be watching. Crops are planted, but we need food Now so someone has to go hunting.Day 2: Horrible nights sleep, the beds fine but sharing a room with 4 other people…  Give me a break.  These ratios will not last long. The Chief has gone hunting, but unless we can find some steel to make a stove, I doubt we are going to be eating healthy any time soon.  At least we have a Butcher table built.Day 3: Raw meat for breakfast, I think Im going to be sick…  Between that and the lack of sleep Im starting to loose my mind here.  Just focus on the tasks, gather wood, gather resources and make sure the Crops are okay.Day 4: Healer said she spotted a Rabid squirrel. I hope it doesnt come towards camp. We finally have the stove up, but theres little to cook. Im going to have to go hunting with the Chief.  Day 5: The squirrel found us late last night.  It bit our Healer first then attacked me as I tried to help. Toko finally killed it, but only after he got badly scratched.  We have no bandages, no way of cleaning the wounds… This could be bad.Day 6: Woke up with a fever, as did the Healer and Toko.  We could be in trouble. The Chief is doing his best but unless someone comes back with medicine soon……Day 7:  Chief cooking is terrible…  I think Id rather die from the infection than eat his soup again, and his bedside care is not much better.Day 8: Toko passed away last night, I dont know what..  I am so close to losing my mind now, Im pretty sure these beds would burn pretty well…..Day 9:  Visited Toko’s Grave, spent a good 2 hours there…  I really dont feel like doing anything today.  But we are low on food, and nobody has checked the crops in days………..-  Thats my story,  (so far) Whats yours going to be?.

content:
Posted: August 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								First attempt: Start simple, right? So I go tribal start in a rainforest. I learn the basic controls and mechanics of the game, painfully at times.All is well.Unable to build walls yet, I dig out a home in a small hill. Beds for everyone.My community thrives and slowly grows and expands its numbers and riches.Still no walls.Get raided multiple times by bandits, often having some major injury from the firefight.Into the second year nearly every living member of the tribe either has an eye patch, hook hand, or peg leg. One colonist is even totally blind, having lost both eyes.There's gotta be a better way.I know, I'll tame some attack animals. Tamed my first two panthers no problem. Never got a chance to train them before attempting panther number 3...Tanning fails. Panther attacks. Kills 3 of my 6 colonists, and injures my doctor and cook. Nothing but the hunter left who doesn't know much of medicine.He attempts to save them.During surgery on the doctor, he critically fails at installing the peg leg and removes her brain (how, I have no idea). The cook later dies of infection.My hunter lives his days in solitude until the next bandit raid. During the raid he is shot and his stomach is destroyed. He dies alone from infection.10/10 Would remove brain again

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is a fantastically enjoyable game for the obsessively detail oriented; you are building a community, but stuff happens; a mid-fall cold snap cripples the winter food supply, and you have to decide whether to eat the dogs, or hold out just a little longer waiting for that caravan you called for, hoping you have enough silver to get through til spring.Spring comes, everyone survived, even the dogs, then eight raider from a nearly tribe invade, killing half the dogs and paralyzing one of your original colonists, who helped you build everything from day one.She now sits in a hospital bed, waiting for someone to feed and talk to her, while her friends and lovers die, and are replaced by new, strange faces, living in the homes she built, her home slowly moving on without her. This game creates stories that actually make you feel things, rather than "press x to throw the baseball at the racist".

content:
Posted: August 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								Okay, so this is one of the few games I pirated before buying, just because I didn't really want to waste $30 on a game I wouldn't play. And I know about Steam refunds, but I find that I need a bit more than just 2 hours to get full impressions on a game, but that's besides the point.The point is that this game is, to put it simply, bloody fantastic. The level of depth that this game goes into is simply amazing. I won't go into the gameplay that much, because I find it's more fun to discover it for yourself, but I will give you a brief overview of the plot if you play the standard scenario. Three colonists are in cryptosleep, only to be awaken by their ship falling apart. They barely manage to make it to the escape pods, which land on an unknown rimworld. Your job, as a hive-mind commander sort of thing, is to help your colonists survive by giving them indirect (or sometimes direct) orders. Whilst trying to keep your colony alive and happy through random events (good or bad) that occur. These include, but are not limited to: raids, flashstorms, trade caravans and heatwaves. These events are determined by an AI story teller you choose before starting the game, each having different personalities. Depending on how you play this game and what AI you choose, crazy things can happen. As an example, once my colonist, who's son had just died, went on a rampage, shot his cat with a minigun, then ate it. So yea...So if you are a fan of Prison Architect or Dwarf Fortress, then I definitely recommend picking up this game. Even if you aren't a fan of either of those games, still check this game out. "What? You don't make human leather cowboy hats? It's a great market to get into."

content:
Posted: July 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've been playing this since early Alpha release about two years ago. It is hands down one of the best games I've ever played.Gameplay is straightforward once you get the hang of the Architect menus, but it has incredible depth and behind-the- scenes complexity, from its incredibly fun combat and injuries/medical systems to your colonists' interpersonal relationships and psychology to your interactions with the environment.Every game is completely different, and replayablility is ehnanced by a large and excellent modding community that continues to produce even greater varieties of play experience. And it's still only Early Access! The devs are committed, active on their forums, and have big plans.Build the base of your dreams, establish a production economy, and watch it all get torched by raiders! What more could you ask for? p.s. cannibalism isn't required - strictly speaking - but you know you're going to try it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 18, 2016
Early Access Review
								Everything was great, sun was shining, colonists were smiling. Then the Pirate Band attacked...RimWorld is a top-down God/Colony simulator. Artistically similar to games like Prison Architect, RimWorld expands on the "do as I have commanded" gameplay of similar top-down titles, and throws in a healthy dose of colonial revolt, complicated romances, creepy breathing and calamity, just to make things exciting.In this story, a colony of 5 that had crash-landed on a an arid, tree-less plain. It was cold, food was scarce and shelter was nowhere to be seen. A few seasons later, the colony was flourishing. Food and medicine a-plenty, other space-faring travellers found salvation when they joined the crew. They had healthy trade relations with other nearby colonies and tribes. A few disagreeances and minor arguments broke out between certain opinionated individuals, but for the most part everything was OK.Then a pet boomalope exploded right in the middle of the trade plaza due to malnourishment. It exploded on one of their trade partners. They didn't like that.Not. One. Bit.A battle broke out, they escaped. They thought they were safe, but it turns out this outlander colony was allied with certain powerful people. Several more seasons passed.Then the siege alarm sounded... the Space Pirates arrived...I can still hear the mortar shells exploding around me... the cries of my colonists in pain... the crackle of the fire burning my colony to the ground...11/10 would accidentally start RimWorld War 3 again.

content:
Posted: November 11, 2016
Early Access Review
								my colony came under siege, so i was forced to send my 7 soldiers out to dislodge the enemy from their position.Due to every one of my colonists having undiagnosed parkinsons diseas they managed to draw the attention of several vicious grizzly bears, which turned the Guerilla warfare operation into a 3-way battle involving legs and hands being torn off on both sides.After 2 of my colonists were downed i ordered a retreat, and brought out my previously acquired incendiary launcher to cover my retreat. As my colonist (boyle) was rescuing the husband of my pacifist doctor, Boyle was shot in the foot, slowing him down, and almost allowing the enemy to catch up.In the nick of time, Mooney, armed with an incendiary launcher, arrived to slow the enemy. The rockets from the incendiary launcher set fire to the dense forest in which the battle had taken place, effectively dooming the enemy to a horrible death.As Mooney turned to head toward my fortifications, the enemy sniper fired a lucky shot straight through Mooney's stomach, killing her instantly. Her sacrifice saved the lives of my other 8 colonists, and the one prisoner taken from the battle was made to pay for their crimes; in the form of compulsory organ donation.Never before in a game have I seen such intense and compelling stories from entirely unscripted gameplay. The Indie games industry is not about games like Ark, or Rust, they are about gems, which provide experiences unlike anything that could be had in a scripted AAA masterpiece. Could not recommend this more

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is just absolutely, utterly, unbelievably fantastic. I've been a supporter of Rimworld since 2013, when I purchased into one of the very early versions, and I've been a huge fan ever since, I've logged hundreds of hours on the game before it was released on Steam. This game crafts you a story and crazy things can and will absolutely happen. I've had spurned lovers go on rampages killing the person who spited them, a bear defending my colony kill half a dozen tribal attackers emerging only with a new collection of scars, plagues wipe out colonies in the blink of an eye, and had amputate the leg of a colonist after a vicious squirrel attack. This game never gets old, never gets reptitive, and it will always shock you with just how organic and original it can be. It's absolutely worth the purchase, a great game with an enormously responsive developer, and constant, signifcant updates. If you do get this game (Which you absolutely should) just remember, never reload a save if something terrible happens, it might be incredibly tempting if you lose a colonist during a raid, or a farming season goes badly, or a colonist goes on a cathartic drinking spree. This isn't the kind of game you play to win, it's the kind of game you play to experience.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								And with yet more hours under my belt, a story emerges with ease from my latest settlement, and the most insane colonist I've ever had.What began as a simple bid to survive amidst the mountainous waste-lands proved odder than many had ever thought. The colony first consisted of three. Gen, a depressive nudist, Aaron, the too-smart taster, and Slade, a volatile young Urbworld CriminalThey were an ecclectic bunch, but they were hard workers. Hunters, growers, miners, builders. The colony shaped. The mountain nurtured them. She housed them, sheltered them. But it could not always be a time of peace in that place they grew to call Taynid's Navel.Without warning, they came. At first few, but with time, many. The raiders of Hyenas Forest and the Pirate band known as the Murderous Vultures. Their eyes set on that place, its flourishing farms nestled before the great mountain.The colony fought.Gen and Aaron, though they were hard workers, they seemed ill equipped to deal with the harsh realities of battle. Particularly battle brought on by nothing more than greed and apathy. But Slade? He was born to it. For all his short years, he had lived it.They don't recall which; the fourth? Maybe the fifth incursion? But the son of the leader of the Hyenas himself headed a raid on the mountain's children. A proud raider, he nearly brought them their goal, too. Gen and Aaron were pinned, they were outmatched, no matter how hard they struck, the raider fought on, thriving on the violence and bloodshed.And from the ringing gunshots and yells, Slade awoke. The boy worn out from his hard night's toil, rose with fury in his heart. He disliked being disturbed. The doors of the colony slammed open, and out he stormed into the midst of battle. A bee-line was made for the Leader's son.With one brutal punch, the raider fell, crumpling to the dusty earth.Emboldened by their comrade, and the fall of the raid leader, the colony pushed back, and soon had the Hyenas on the run. The day was theirs, once more to continue building a life for themselves. Slade took from the fallen raider, his tuque, and walked back inside.Seasons passed, the colony grew, and the Hyenas came sniffing once more. This time, fuelled by grief and a hunger for vengeance, the leader of the raiders himself made himself known. The force was greater, and their goal was clear. Take revenge on those that had stolen so greatly from them.And just like his son, they struck a terrible blow against the colony, nearly bringing it to its knees. Several were wounded, but so too were the leader's forces.It would do for now. They could return at their leisure, and finish the task. As they turned, they found one of the colonists laying helpless from the fighting. A grin crossed the leader's face, and hefting the helpless figure onto his shoulder, began a trek back towards their squallid hovel, to plan, and divest the mountain of her children.Once more they had overlooked the sleeping Urbworld criminal.At the cries from the colonists still conscious, Slade made his appearance. Though he was volatile, and he had little rapport with the others, they were there with him, celebrating with him, suffering with him, working hard to eke out a living in that place. They had earned his respect.His pistol flashed, his shot rang out, and with a curse, the leader from the Hyenas Forest dropped his struggling prize.The stories spoke of the figure that had taken his son's life. The monster that had ended his most prized pillager and fighter with a single, merciless strike. A boy. A wirey boy, in poorly crafted leathers, and his son's tuque. It had to be a farce.A boy with his hardened face and burning stare that with a second bullet that went whizzing passed the leader's ear, were enough to send the leader running in pain. Reinforcements? Cowardice? Slade didn't care.He chased the man.He ran him along the plains, through the spindly make-shift paths of the mountain, over the lake of the far-reach pools. Step by pounding step, closing the gap between them. His pistol lifted, the shot rang out.The leader collapsed, yelling and swearing as the boy approached him. He froze, staring at the silent gaze looming over him. Slade lifted his pistol once more.The shot rang true.Art was crafted of the bane of the Hyenas. A party was had. The colony continued to thrive.Through the on-going raids, the fighting grew harder and harder. No one recalls who, what, or exactly when it happened, but a lucky shot to the young criminal's arm rendered it useless, and for a time seemed to rein the young Slade. But the colony had not been resting on their laurels. They, like the mountain, did not abandon their kin. Their labours and budding connections with the nearby Tribes and towns, eventually brought a caravan to their midst.And from one such caravan, they purchased a Bionic arm, and rushed Slade to the operating theater.The seasons pass, the colony thrives. Word wanders the wastelands, telling of that place, nestled deep within the mountains. To some: peaceful and just, where the hardiest of raiders have grown into peaceful, helpful souls. To others: the mountain that harbors the Bane of the Wilderness, The one with his shining metal arm, who tore the fangs from the hyena, and the wings from the vulture.Taynid's Navel.

content:
Posted: October 9, 2016
Early Access Review
								You choose one of 3 ai storytellers at the beginning of the game. They throw everything they can at you to burn, freeze, slaughter, starve or otherwise wipe you're beloved flegling settlement off the map. Your settlers each have their own skills and foibles which flesh them out and distinguish them. This is fundamentally a game about optimally allocating time and scant resources to meet the unrelenting disasters the game throws at you, but the settler traits and events give the world a touch of life and narrative beyond the bare strategy mechanics. The game is still being developed, but is fun to to play and feels complete in it's current form.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								Alpha 16 review. Early Access is a dangerous place to buy a game. I've been burned, specifically Towns (which is sad, because I rather enjoyed it). Many devs have the issue of not balancing out features with objectives (in-game, or the content to be able to come up with your own). Rust gets dull quickly, with most time spent leveling up, and Townes had a breaking point that you could reach within a few hours. The developer of Rimworld, however, has done a very good job of balancing out features and things to do in a Early Access Game. Hell, I put in 50 hours of playtime last week. Almost no bugs, and nothing that is gamebreaking. Lots of animals, character traits, backstory, mystery, and events. The "ancient engine of hate" line about the psychic drone gave me tingles, and reminded me of S.T.A.L.K.E.R.All in all, one of the only Early Access games that is worth buying in Early Access. The developer could say that this is a completed game, and I would feel it was worth the $30 that I paid. The developer, last I heard, is still working hard at updates!Pretty big mod catalog and support too, but I can't be♥♥♥♥♥♥♥to actually deal with modding and keeping things up to date. As the game is still actively being updated, you don't have the mod stability you find with Skyrim or Rise of the Reds.All in all, worth the $30 I paid for it.

content:
Posted: July 30, 2016
Early Access Review
 Frozen Mountain: Day 15 We have managed to dig a base inside a mountain and are surviving by mixing crops with hunt. Couples are starting to form. We are currently researching electricity. 7 Villagers Remaining Cold snap, temperature goes down 40 degrees. All the crops are gone instantly.No problem: we have enough food for a season and we'll plant some crops inside the mountain just in case.The roof breaks in a bedroom, villager goes insane from cold, runs out of base and gets killed by wolves.Cold snap passes, resources are low, temperatures aren't rising much since we're in late fall.We start going on long hunting trips but everything is dead.Almost no more wood for heat, the tree have all been burned for heat/cooking.It's too cold indoors even for crops, they stop growing.Leader kills a man after he rejects her advances.Sister of deceased starts eating our remaining food in her room, she catches a cold and dies. 4 Villagers Remaining Some big furry white animals appear, kill 4 of them and butcher for food, hunter/beasttamer killed by wild boar.Villager leader has an infection and a flu -> dies without so much as an "atchoo". 2 Villagers Remaining WellRounded is keeping NoManualLabor villager alive. NoManualLabor goes berserk from having seen all his friends die and starts killing our remaining animals.WellRounded tries to stop NoManualLabor with his fists and gets killed in the process.NoManualLabor gets bitten by the last remaining husky and is left to die in the kitchen. Husky saves him from death 24 hours later by bringing him in bed.Travelling nomads come by to trade. NoManualLabor is incapacitated so no contact, the nomads get bored after a day so they steal our food give it to their bears.NoManualLabor dies from an untreated infection.10/10 Would go through frozen hell again.

content:
Posted: July 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								PROSThis game is absolutely brutal \m/Though it's in Early Access, I would almost consider it full-featured already (definitely still some major fixes/additions I'm waiting on)Astoundingly detailed character health/skills/personality/mood - love it. Like The Sims "needs" system with Dwarf Fortress injuries and equipment.Weather, seasons, temperatureMods up the butt!Random occurrances such as pirate raids, visitors, heatwaves, rabid animals, and toxic smog keep the game interestingIf you don't take care of them, colonists go berserk and start murdering their own -- just like in the USA!Pets <3 (it's really something special when your colonists run around naked and yell at trees because their cat died)Prisons and prisoner recruiting and organ harvestingMEHThe game world only exists in 2 dimensions. As a result, resources can be much scarcer than in Dwarf Fortress and similar games. Mining only gets you so far, then you need to sell crops, animals, art, or people to trade for things like steel and gold. This would be alright, except you've no idea how long you may need to wait before someone willing to trade comes along with the resources you want.CONSOne wrong click in combat and your dudes will straight murder eachother. A friendly fire toggle with some kind of simple combat AI would be nice. All I want is for the colonist with the shotgun to take a step to the side before splattering friendly melons everywhere!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 18, 2016
Early Access Review
								A great devastation wiped out the tribe. The five surviving members of the tribe set out led by Crow, who was raised in a cave as a child and went on to become his tribe's most brilliant hacker despite not having the technology level to build computers. Crow and his four companions found a nice spot in a world that was largely deserts. It was the sole tropical forest.Crow and his friends get to work! They build up some sleeping quarters, a research area (maybe one day Crow, gifted hacker, will be able to figure out how to make a computer, like the prophecy foretold), and then disaster struck. Raiders from the desert wastelands beyond the new tribe's village had attacked! After beating one of them unconscious and stabbing the other two to death with spears and taking their guns, Bear, the tribe's resident medic, stood by while the rest of the tribe very quickly built a prison. Bear brought the fallen man whose name was Gizzard, to the prison.The group decided to try to recruit Gizzard, and meanwhile Crow and two other tribals headed down to start excavating out some of the compacted steel in the hills nearby. However, Crow noticed a wall and it terrified him. It was made out of polished granite. Despite Crow's warnings, Soup, the tribe's primary researcher (who was also a cave child, and a pyromaniac) decided to take down one of the walls.Beyond the wall was a series of four pods. Strange things, they said CRYOSLEEP on them. The tribe went to bed that night, but Crow knew taking down that wall was a bad idea.The next day, the pods were empty and open. What happened? Well, no bother. The tribe needed to forage, and Bear and a one of the other tribeswomen (Lilac, an art-loving psychopath), went off to hunt.Then the sleeping occupants came back with heavy assault rifles and two arctic foxes.Sadly, the last of the tribe of Goreflicker was no more.10/10. Dwarf fortress in spaaaaaaace.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 17, 2016
Early Access Review
								In an age of $60 dollar games with huge over rated budgets RimWorld gently snuck under the radar. With it's simplistic graphics and concept, I expected a mindless tower defense game, but what I got would be anything but mindless. RimWorld's attention to detail and careful considerations made (and continues to make) me feel like an architect, social scientist, therapist, prison warden, match-maker, and warlord. Not since I was in the fourth grade thinking of the Legend of Zelda have I spent the quiet moments of my day thinking of creative solutions to heat waves, mental break downs, or a stampede of rhinos. But what makes this game memorable isn't the gameplay, but the stories that are made. Buy this game, learn it, and never look back.

content:
