								The town started as soon as our spaceship crashed. Three of us, Leeta, my wife, trevor, my uncle, and I were the only survivors. We began to build, I was the miner and builder, Leeta was the gardener and cook, and trevor was the doctor and inventor. Soon, our little home was blessed with a new survivor, I don't remember his name, but I always called him steve the failure. Steve was an assassin that could only shoot. and when he did, he fired all the bullets. Whatever. We made him our hunter, and he went about killing every animal he saw. And he was good. Then winter came. The Crops that were still in the ground died, and the animals turned mean. Then the raiders came, and stole trevor away. We never saw him again, I still have the necklace that belonged to my mother her gamve to me. I blamed steve for our loss, he didn't care, he could never care. He just seemed incapable of it. In the spring, I found out that Leeta was with child. I was the happiest i have ever been. Our love had culminated in a child. Then, one day, while she was in the fields, she was attacked by a pack of manhunting elephants. I held her in my arms as she died. Tears fell down my face as I buried my wife in a ditch that steve had the gall to call a grave. I took my anger our on steve. It was just us now, I couldn't hurt him, I couldn't hurt anyone, not the elephants that came to kill my wife and unborn child, not the raiders that took my uncle, and not the man that I despised. I lost control, my eyes went red, and I attacked steve, until he had beaten me unconscience. He totally destroyed my nose and ears, and I gave him a bruise on his right tibia. Serves him right. That night, as I lay in my bed, I hear the raiders come, their drums pound in the night, I hear the crack of the hunting rifle from steve, but since he fires so fast he just didn't aim. I hear his rifle fire abruptly stop, I hear new sounds of fire. I don't like fire, not since that accident when I was a kid. I'll just lay here for a little while longer. They are in the house, I see them, one punch and i'm on the ground, helpless, they put a sack over my head, hoist me over their raider's leader's shoulder, I just hope that they opened up that wall that I suspect was the house of an ancient danger...

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 18, 2016
Early Access Review
								Built a tribe of primitive people's after their homes were destroyed by massive machines of death. We built houses for ourselves and set upon mining great amounts of steel. We then constructed an enormous round hut and named our village Steelhut after it. We set upon building more buildings than we could use, incase any nearby tribes people decide to join. After 2 new recruits, and a couple small raids of 2-3 tribesmen, we decided we needed to enclose our farms and houses with steel walls and steel buildings. With this completed we fortified the only entrance to our village.The head shaman had been working on new magics in the great hall of the steelhut. After discovering advanced clothing like dusters and cowboy hats, as well as how to forge steel weapons and great bows. We set upon making these weapons and equipped our best hunters with great bows. But we were after a new magic: electricity. Our tribe had seen electricity before, in lightning storms and the machines, but out shaman believed we could harness it for ourselves. Though she predicted it would take many months to finalize.Several months went by quietly, and winter was nearly upon us. Food crops had been plentiful and our hunters had bountiful hunts. Pemmican was stocked up, but electricity was still being researched. With only about a month left of research we hear an outsider call our tribe. A machine collector named Braun was being chased by a violent gang of people. My people did not want this outsider among us, but the shaman believed that perhaps Braun's knowledge of machines would help our people uncover the secrets of electricity. So we offered Braun residence, and prepared our warriors to defend our homes.As Braun's arrived at the village the raiders after him had begun closing in. Braun went to grab a steel mace, as the pacifist shaman cleaned the great hall. As the Raiders closed in my people quickly realized they were outmatched as the Raiders carried rifles and guns. Our best warrior was shot dead almost instantly. A second warrior shared a similar fate right afterwards. Another warrior was downed so the shaman set upon rescuing her, but was shot by the raiders doing so requiring her to rest and heal after setting her friend down in the hospital bed. Next almost instantly two more of the warriors we're incapacitated, so the remaining warrior and Braun back up. The raiders advance killing Braun almost instantly before my warrior kills the raider attacking them. After seeing three of their own drop and so many of mine drop the raiders decided it was time to pick up their losses and grab our injured survivors and haul them off as prisoners.Down to three villagers all injured we had to make do with doctoring. The least injured was the shaman who was first to recover and then began tending to the others. However warrior who survived his last stand began to come down with an infection. He died shortly thereafter. Soon due to all the death and destruction that occured our pacifist shaman went outside and then berserk. She began attacking all the local wildlife without remorse until a lowly squirrel tore her throat out... The person the shaman rescued recovered after these events and woke to find everyone around her dead, blood splashed on the walls and floors. So she did the only logical thing...she kept researching electricity. Being an excellent researcher she managed to discover the secrets to electricity in only a few days time, and armed with that knowledge swept out across the land abandoning the decaying husk of the fort she once called home.10/10 would save someone to have my village overrun by mass gun wielding murderers again.

content:
Posted: November 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								You are not supposed to play this game to win it. You are not to expect that it will let you "beat" it. Hell, you aren't even supposed to have a chance at survival at all. This game hates you with every bit of its existence. Its unfairness will test you until you fall. Its goal is to break you until you are sure you cannot be broken, before it snaps you like a twig. Its purpose is not something to be taken as sport. You are not supposed to best this game. You do not play this game. You experience it. If what you are looking for is a game you can overcome with perseverance and ingenuity, then leave, as the only way to beat it is to cheat it, and that's not fun.  But if you want what can only be described as an experience worth having, in the form of overcoming hardships, drama of community, naive hope, twisted insanity, and crushing despair...Welcome to rimworld... prepare to die...

content:

Early Access Review
								Another typical day around the camp. I'm swinging a pick on the periphery of the main barracks again, hoping to open up enough room that we're not always under each other's feet. The noise from pick on stone isn't enough to drown out the screams from the lockup where Bodie is amputating the prisoner's gangrenous leg; I bet he doesn't even thank Bodie afterwards, assuming of course he lives. And I hope I don't have to haul the leg out. Arthur is tinkering at his improvised lab bench, trying to figure out how to rig up hydroponic gardens from the junk we have around, so that if the game stops running in the winter we'll have something to eat. Vas is out right this minute stalking an elk and so far she's fed us real well, but frankly the more time she spends away from camp the better if you ask me. There's something dead in those eyes.It's not much but it's home. We call it Hard Times.

content:

Early Access Review



YouTube™ Video: Rimworld Review [Steam | PC | Early Access] 

			Views: 5,352		

			Rimworld is one of the best games I've ever had the pleasure of playing. This review doesn't even scratch the surface of everything you're able to do.		

Rimworld is a colony simulation, and it's probably my favorite game of 2016 so far. Every colony has it's own specific narrative, even if it fails. The game doesn't necessarily hold your hand, and is a wonderful example of learning through failure to make it just another day, week, month, or year further than your last attempt. Watch my video review for a more in-depth look at Rimworld.

								When I first came here, this was all swamp. Everyone said I was daft to build a colony on a swamp, but I built in all the same, just to show them. It sank into the swamp. Early Access Review
								Started off as a good day. Everyone was content in their little house. Foods being made and people are happy. Alert! Beavers are attacking the forests. Must try and save the wood! Load up and go out to defeat a small group of beevers. Wrong. They took out almost the whole colony. RIP.I didn't give up so easy. I came up with a plan. It had to work, it must. I went to a recent save before the attack and tried again. I will get them 1 by 1, while they slept. Yes, they can kill me that way. I had my guys creep through the woods and sneak up on them and start taking them out 1 by 1. The plan was working! My guys are thriving with this well thoughout plan of evilness. Whats that? A fire? At my house? Crap. I retreat from the misson at hand and run back to the house to have my awesome fire fighters save my house. What the heck is wrong with them?! Theyre standing in the fire! Nooo, dont lay down in it! Ones dead, no 2. Retreat! Forget about the house, save yourselves! No not the pets. 2 more people dead. Another pet dies. The boomalpoe. BOOM. It blew up the other half of the house as it died. And the rest of the colonists scream in pain as I can do nothing but watch. What a sad end to a seemingly good day. :(10/10 would watch them burn again. You honestly never know what your going to get with this game. :D Beyond highly recommended!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 17, 2016
Early Access Review
								So I've never reviewed a game before, but I feel the need to let people know that this game is extremely fun, on it's own it offers a lot of customization, and then goes the extra mile with mods, Well worth the price of admission if you ask me. I just want to tell anyone who is on the fence about purchasing this game, about my little story of death the thrumbo. After I got the hang of playing I had decided to make a colony with the purpose of breeding thrumbos (a rare and valuable creature) and so I downloaded some mods that allow you to edit your starting crew and resources, in order to add 2 female and 2 male thrumbos to the start of my game. I ended up with a colorful cast of animals, being Death and Affinity, (the males) and GumDrop and Dolores, (the females). I had thought to myself "Death, That is a bad♥♥♥♥♥name" and checked his medical report, he had a few scars here and there, and had clearly been through some♥♥♥♥♥♥in his life, but I had yet to realize how bad♥♥♥♥♥this guy actually was. Eventually while building my base in the side of a mountain, The game announced a party of raiders was attacking my base, I thought I was ♥♥♥♥ed, becuase my only real defenders were off hauling resources, and the raiders spawned right next to my base. Thats where I was wrong. As the raiders neared my base, they ran across Death, who was sitting outside in a field, eating a tree. One of the ♥♥♥♥-wits decided it would be a good idea to take a shot at him. That was the last mistake he ever made, death immediately rushed them and began pummeling the goup of 3-4 raiders to the ground as my defenders made their way over. Death sustained massive injuries in the process including but not limited to: gunshot wounds to the Torso, liver, neck, Front two arms, Head, Brain, and the magnificent horn on his head, and even withstood the explosion of an incendiary Grenade from one of the raiders. He and managed to kill all but one of the raiders before my defenders even got to him, and becuase I had no idea how to get him medical attention, he stayed like that for 3 ingame days before I figured it out. He then later got into another spat with some android raider things, who were firing on one of the pregnant female thrumbos, murdered them single handedly. Death, throughout the entirety of this play through has sustained major permenant damage to his brain and both of his eyes, but some how he still finds a way to break into the colony's brewery and get so absolutely♥♥♥♥♥♥faced, that he can't stand up right and has to be carried back to his bed. At this point in time, I have downloaded mods that allow me to replace the organs of animals with bionic substitutes, in order to give Death his eyes back. In my opinion this game is ♥♥♥♥ing amazing, and I can't believe they still have things to come. If you are interested in games like this, I can't recommend it enough, I almost hope they never take it out of early access, because I don't want this project to come to an end.

content:
Posted: September 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								Ernie Stozka was a good man. He was the best crafter/blacksmith/tailor a colony could hope for. Raised as a mercenary, he was the best shot in the whole colony, and could be relied upon to produce weapons very quickly. He was also quite a cook.But in the back of my mind I knew, in his fragile mortal state, I would someday lose Ernie. Much like all our lives, it was inevitable. I imagined him going out in a blaze of glory defending the colony, or eventually dying of old age in his bed, surrounded by friends and family. However, being "accidentally" shot by the man who stole his wife was not what I envisioned. They were both drafted to attack a chicken eating wolf, which they were able to down in a few shots. Miles, the colonial surgeon and HOME WRECKING A** HAT, was to perform the coup-de-gras. Somehow, while aiming at a creature lying at his feet, ON THE GROUND, he managed to shoot Ernie through the eye (several feet above and to the left of his target), killing him instantly. Miles was quickly arrested under suspicion of Murder. Sienna, Ernie's ex-wife, was also detained under suspicion of conspiracy to commit murder. Their trial was brief and definitive.Ernie was laid to rest in a silver sarcophagus covered with intricate, soul-wrenching artwork created by the Lauren, best artist available. Miles and that cheating b***h Sienna were sealed in a small cave deep inside of a granite mountain. After a few days Miles ended up cracking and beating Sienna to death shortly before succumbing to starvation himself. 10/10, would deliver righteous frontier justice again

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 14
Early Access Review
								Here is a story. If this doesn't convince you to buy this game, I don't know what will.Day 1.My group of 3 survivors are name Mantis, the builder, Kimeko, the doctor, and Lynn, the hunter and cook. For the first few hours of their new lives, they create a small shelter and beds. Life is great for a while until their food rations start dwindling. Lynn decides to take matters into her own hands and begins hunting the nearby herd of elk. They feast on elk steak all night long.Day 3.The frosty jaws of winter enclose their small settlement, destroying Kimeko's fantasy of creating a small garden to grow vegetables and cotton. To avoid getting dangerously cold, the 3 of them huddle up in their shack to keep warm. After 2 days of imprisonment, cabin fever begins to grip their minds. They fight constantly, their social stances on each other crumbling quickly. Their seemingly endless supply of elk is quickly dimished to a pile of gristle and hide. Unable to take the pains coursing through her stomach, Lynn braves the biting cold, venturing out with the groups only functioning firearm to try and aquire a suitable meal for herself and her companions. As she stumbles through the tundra however, the cold overtakes her, and she is later found by a pack of wolves, who devour her stiff lifeless body.Day 9.Mantis and Kimeko barely cling to life as they sit in the darkness, eating the meager scraps of whatever rodent is unfortunate enough to scurry by. But a revelation occurs to Mantis. Rats arn't the only source of meat available. Within an hour, Mantis sits alone in the cabin, and while is belly is full for now, his mind slips further and further away.Day 14.As Mantis' food finally disappears down his throat for the last time, he can't help but think, "What next?". His body was too malnourished to hunt or gather, his friends were gone. Mantis comes to a decision. I will not succumb. He proceeds to reach into his pocket and pull out a small knife and flat chunk of flint. He carves off strips of wood off the wall next to him and gathers them in the corner. He then scrapes the knife quickly along the flint, causing sparks to fly, into the small pile of kindling. Mantis can feel his body shutting down as the fire builds, quickly engulfing the kindling and a part of the wall, despite the cold. Mantis lies back on the smooth wooden floor and closes his eyes, waiting for death.Day 15.A group of friendly tribesmen, well worn by the years of travelling, come across a destroyed cabin along their journey. While the small wooden structure is badly damaged, fire having obviously scorched it, leaving the remaining wreckage ashen and unmoving. Inside, they find a small amount of seared elk hide, and a corpse, blackened by the flames, with a shard of metal roofing lodged through his chest. They consider the body for a moment, wondering about its story, before carrying on looting it, before finally moving on.To this day, that is my shortest game of RimWorld ever.Buy this game. Its good.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 18, 2016
Early Access Review
								Everything was great, sun was shining, colonists were smiling. Then the Pirate Band attacked...RimWorld is a top-down God/Colony simulator. Artistically similar to games like Prison Architect, RimWorld expands on the "do as I have commanded" gameplay of similar top-down titles, and throws in a healthy dose of colonial revolt, complicated romances, creepy breathing and calamity, just to make things exciting.In this story, a colony of 5 that had crash-landed on a an arid, tree-less plain. It was cold, food was scarce and shelter was nowhere to be seen. A few seasons later, the colony was flourishing. Food and medicine a-plenty, other space-faring travellers found salvation when they joined the crew. They had healthy trade relations with other nearby colonies and tribes. A few disagreeances and minor arguments broke out between certain opinionated individuals, but for the most part everything was OK.Then a pet boomalope exploded right in the middle of the trade plaza due to malnourishment. It exploded on one of their trade partners. They didn't like that.Not. One. Bit.A battle broke out, they escaped. They thought they were safe, but it turns out this outlander colony was allied with certain powerful people. Several more seasons passed.Then the siege alarm sounded... the Space Pirates arrived...I can still hear the mortar shells exploding around me... the cries of my colonists in pain... the crackle of the fire burning my colony to the ground...11/10 would accidentally start RimWorld War 3 again.

content:
Posted: January 4
Early Access Review
								Listen -- This game is not "early access" in the disappointing sense we've become accustomed to.This game may not be complete in the developers eyes, but uh... to everyone else, it is FANTASTIC already and extremely fun to play. And replay. And replay. You wont regret buying this game, and it's still growing and gaining features at a really impressive rate. Tynan is quite a disciplined developer who doesn't lose sight of his goals.This is basebuilding at its best. The little legless people have surprising depth--they have relationships, they have various work ethics and manerisms. Some of them you'll value and protect--some of them you'll entrust to defend against raiders... others you wouldn't be sad to see eaten by a pack of man-eating rats. Which happens. The richness of this world and its evolving and unpredictable nature makes it never get old.

content:
Posted: September 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								Don’t mess with my stuff.Rimworld loves to mess with your stuff. A happy little sci-fi sim, this is not.I just spent two hours researching the technology that allowed me to set up the work station that enabled me to build the improvement that I needed and now here come a bunch of pirates-jerks to smash it all to bits. And kill everyone. And stomp on the flowers.I hate pirates.I hate the fact that I have just spent all this time building a better base for my poor, starving, neurotic, flawed castaways on this backwater, hellhole planet and these punks are now burning, looting and smashing everything that we have worked so hard to build.Sure the game is rock solid. It's great that they are working on updating it all the time.But, Elroy just got shot in the head.My automated defense turret got hit with a grenade and exploded.Tammy, my favorite yellow lab, whom I was delighted we finally taught to haul sacks of potatoes in from the fields, just got killed by a shotgun blast from a dastardly pirate (see comment above about how I feel about pirates). I mean, who shoots a dog?Eva is crying in her dark room. All of her precious research work did little to save her.Wilfred is puking all over the marble floor because the poor bloke got food poisoning from eating uncooked, two-day old turtle meat.Daisy wants a biotic arm. Hawk loves Mikelia, but she’s already married to Wilfred.Jon is cloud watching, oblivious to the death and carnage raging around him. He always was too gentile for this world.Oh, looks like we might get some more toxic fallout today. That'll be great.It’s all going to hell quickly, my whole colony is being destroyed in front of me.It’s just like the Afghanistan simulator.(sigh) Damn it. Time to restart. Maybe someday I'll manage to get someone off this rock.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 5
Early Access Review
								Current Colony Name: Test Community Please IgnoreFaction: Trial and ErrorAI: Cassandra Classic, Rough with Permadeath on Crashlanded  This is the ongoing saga of: Miu, a defector good with guns and medicine. Zebo, a builder and green thumb. Mac, a scientist who dabbles in the culinary arts.After crash landing, our survivors take their belongings to a valley close by. Two large hills provide some natural protection, but the south flank is left completely exposed. Our survivors have a lot of work ahead of them if they want to make this valley a safe settlement. Miu and Mac bring Zebo building materials and soon enough, Zebo has built a solid foundation for the colony. A roofed stockpile is kept just outside of individual rooms connected to a fair sized rec room built into the side of a hill. 3 Solar Panels charge 6 batteries connected to all the appliances in the rec room and a small freezer is built to house food supplies. During the day, Zebo tends to his crops and small construction projects. Miu hunts and hauls. Mac stays glued to the research bench Zebo built in his room, only coming out to cook and eat meals. Raids are few and pose little threat. As fall comes around, Jase, a barkeep, joins the colony. His skill in medicine outmatches Miu's and he's an even better cook than Mac. Our colonists welcome him and Jase quickly becomes a vital part of the community. Soon enough, both east and west flanks of the valley have been sealed by stone walls and doors while Zebo begins building defenses on the southern flank. Thanks to Mac's tireless efforts, the colony is able to build their first auto turret before winter and it easily fends off following raids. One summer day, Zebo proposes to Miu after only being together for 15 days or so, and she miraculously accepts. A marriage date is set in the near future. (So they can get to know each other better XD) Well before winter rolls around, the fridge has been expanded and is stocked with food. A geothermal generator powers a wall of turrets surrounded in sandbags to the south and a secondary wall of turrets powered by wind turbines lay to the north as a final line of defense. Daphne, our husky is pregnant with doggos and our colonists are confident and hopeful. But not for long.Raids quickly become more dangerous and the southern defenses require constant repair and rebuilding. Injuries are common, but luckily, no one sustains a fatal blow. As snow begins to fall, a massive volcanic eruption covers the planet in ash, killing all of Zebo's crops and lowering the temperature further. Luckily, our colonists are well prepared with warm clothing and food. Following an especially dangerous raid on the southern defenses, Zebo and Miu decide they cannot wait any longer and marry in the rec room amongst their fellow colonists. Everyone celebrates and as the marriage ceremony ends, thats when A HERD OF 8 MANHUNTER MUFFALO appear on the horizon and head straight for the eastern entrance to the valley. On the way, they mercilessly slaughter a visiting group of tribals armed with nothing but clubs. They burst through the Eastern door and charge toward the colonists who scramble back into the rec room..only to be followed by Daphne, who reveals their location to two of the herd. The Muffalo start to beat down the wooden door that hides the colonists, but luckily turn away at the last moment. Zebo springs into action and repairs the door by repurposing the wooden stools in the area. Mac goes to his hi-tech research bench to bury himself in books and Jase calms his nerves at the tailoring bench. The colonists are safe for the moment.After spending an inordinate amount of time arguing over where to stay (the zone mechanics are tricky to a newbie) the colonists agree to stay in the rec room and let Zebo deconstruct the walls that block off their individual rooms so that everyone can at least spend the night in their own beds. As Zebo finishes deconstructing the walls, Daphne beelines for a door in one of the rooms. Before the colonists can call her back, she's run outside and the nearest Muffalo sees Zebo. With a guttural roar, the Muffalo charges to the wooden door and beats on it ferociously as the colonists back away from the door. * SMASH*The Muffalo is in! Screaming, the colonists flee to the last bastion of safety: the freezer. They barely make it in as the Muffalo reaches the door, splintering the wood as it attempts to break through. Gun's at the ready, the colonists prepare for their end.. Yet somehow, the door holds! The Muffalo bores of banging its head and backs away to wander the rec room, leaving our colonists trapped in the freezer. Shivering in the cold, their only solace is the  the fact that they won't starve to death. Ironically, death by starvation seemed a far preferable choice over the stampeding Muffalo that now roamed the colony. Eventually, the colonists calm themselves down enough to sleep. The next day, Zebo carefully tears a hole in the wall separating the fridge from the nearest room, and the colonists are able to take shifts sleeping in the bed there. They spend the day talking amongst themselves and dine on a stash of fine meals to keep their spirits high. As day three in the freezer comes around, the muffalo's rage subsides and they fall asleep just outside the rec room. Zebo quickly reseals the broken-down door and begins to fortify the area, while the colonists happily leave the freezer.. when suddenly the comms console makes a garbling noise and a transmission begins to play:"MAYDAY MAYDAY! ANYONE OUT THERE PLEASE RESPOND!!! MY NAME IS CETI AND IM UNDER ATTACK BY MERCENARIES OF THE DEADLY SHANKERS!!" (the faction is actually called this) Upon hearing the voice, Jase sprints to the console and issues a response:"Mother?!! Is that really you!?!? It's me, Jase! Come to these coordinates and we'll provide you with shelter!" The other colonists echo their support, forgetting the rampaging Muffalo just outside their doors for a brief moment. "Thank you so much!! I'm heading to your coordinates now! *after a brief pause* It's good to hear from you son." Too excited at the prospect of seeing his mother again, Jase cuts the comm link before remembering to warn Ceti about the Muffalo herd! Sensing more humans in the distance, the herd awakens and heads straight for Ceti..She sees the clouds of dust from the stampeding Muffalo before she sees them. But by the time she realizes what's happening, there's no where for her to go and Ceti realizes she's trapped. That's when the mercenaries arrive behind her and true to their name, shiv her near to death. Leaving her to bleed out, the merc group from the Deadly Shankers proceeds to mow down the Muffalo herd and head for the southern defenses of the colony. The colonists are able to fend off the brunt of the Deadly Shankers force, capturing one and killing two including their captain before the others flee. Seeing that his mother has yet to return, Jase sets off to rescue his mother while the others stay behind to assess the damage. Jase reaches his mother, the last of her life trickling away..Ceti dies in Jase's arms..Ceti's funeral is short. Jase says nothing other than revealing her profession as a botanist. She's buried by the flowers in Zebo's crops. Following the Muffalo rampage and Ceti's death, there was much work to be done by the colonists. Jase could not keep up with the workload, and combined with the death of his mother, he succumbed to several mental breaks where he wandered the colony aimlessly, foregoing sleep and food. Each time, he was dragged to a hospital bed by Miu and tended to until he got better, but during one of his mental breaks, Jase caught malaria..Miu did everything she could, but for all her efforts, Jase had always been twice the doctor she was, and he quickly succumbed to the disease, dying in a coma and extreme pain.The colonists bury him next to his mother..

Early Access Review
								Rimworld taught me a few things.  Everyone is valuable. If you can do one job, it doesn't matter if you like to light stuff on fire, or like to strip and wander dazed in the snow. If you can do one job, you are worth it.  There is always something to eat. Never under estimate your creativity in food. Even if it just died, why not?  The AI will get you. Congratulations! You have a new recruit. After capturing them and providing them with medical care, food, housing, a table to eat their meals. Of course. Standard hospitality. Well, turns out your new recruit use to be a bad guy. In this case, a bad girl. It just turns out that the raiding party she came from killed Emily, our best tamer. She had bonded with a baby megatherium, who turned into a manhunter and you thought it would be contained by sandstone walls. Well, you're not wrong. Turns out a baby megatherium can bust through vents and then find your smither Red and shatter his jaw and tear off his left foot. Red survived after killing the rampaging baby, although he will never run again. Now Red gets to be ridiculed by the new recruit Emmie, the sex slave, because he is now "ugly". Ha. Emmie. Sounds like Emily, right?

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 18, 2016
Early Access Review
								Built a tribe of primitive people's after their homes were destroyed by massive machines of death. We built houses for ourselves and set upon mining great amounts of steel. We then constructed an enormous round hut and named our village Steelhut after it. We set upon building more buildings than we could use, incase any nearby tribes people decide to join. After 2 new recruits, and a couple small raids of 2-3 tribesmen, we decided we needed to enclose our farms and houses with steel walls and steel buildings. With this completed we fortified the only entrance to our village.The head shaman had been working on new magics in the great hall of the steelhut. After discovering advanced clothing like dusters and cowboy hats, as well as how to forge steel weapons and great bows. We set upon making these weapons and equipped our best hunters with great bows. But we were after a new magic: electricity. Our tribe had seen electricity before, in lightning storms and the machines, but out shaman believed we could harness it for ourselves. Though she predicted it would take many months to finalize.Several months went by quietly, and winter was nearly upon us. Food crops had been plentiful and our hunters had bountiful hunts. Pemmican was stocked up, but electricity was still being researched. With only about a month left of research we hear an outsider call our tribe. A machine collector named Braun was being chased by a violent gang of people. My people did not want this outsider among us, but the shaman believed that perhaps Braun's knowledge of machines would help our people uncover the secrets of electricity. So we offered Braun residence, and prepared our warriors to defend our homes.As Braun's arrived at the village the raiders after him had begun closing in. Braun went to grab a steel mace, as the pacifist shaman cleaned the great hall. As the Raiders closed in my people quickly realized they were outmatched as the Raiders carried rifles and guns. Our best warrior was shot dead almost instantly. A second warrior shared a similar fate right afterwards. Another warrior was downed so the shaman set upon rescuing her, but was shot by the raiders doing so requiring her to rest and heal after setting her friend down in the hospital bed. Next almost instantly two more of the warriors we're incapacitated, so the remaining warrior and Braun back up. The raiders advance killing Braun almost instantly before my warrior kills the raider attacking them. After seeing three of their own drop and so many of mine drop the raiders decided it was time to pick up their losses and grab our injured survivors and haul them off as prisoners.Down to three villagers all injured we had to make do with doctoring. The least injured was the shaman who was first to recover and then began tending to the others. However warrior who survived his last stand began to come down with an infection. He died shortly thereafter. Soon due to all the death and destruction that occured our pacifist shaman went outside and then berserk. She began attacking all the local wildlife without remorse until a lowly squirrel tore her throat out... The person the shaman rescued recovered after these events and woke to find everyone around her dead, blood splashed on the walls and floors. So she did the only logical thing...she kept researching electricity. Being an excellent researcher she managed to discover the secrets to electricity in only a few days time, and armed with that knowledge swept out across the land abandoning the decaying husk of the fort she once called home.10/10 would save someone to have my village overrun by mass gun wielding murderers again.

Early Access Review
								Colonist Patricia's log, 4th of spring, 5501, Lyon's Pride, Dominance settlementWe buried Diver last night, after discovering she'd been torn apart by a pack of Alphabeavers she was sent out to hunt. I shudder just thinking about those buck teeth and what they must do to bone. Sarai wouldn't talk about what condition the remains were in.Today was meant to be a great day, with Gerador and Acosta getting married. Disaster struck however, as midway through the ceremony we heard a fierce struggle between animals directly outside the front door.Gerador's pet husky, William, was lying prone on the floor with his stomach torn out. Poor Gerador, he'd never been the same since we sold his first pet, Grace the cat, while he was sleeping, and now this.Packmates are loyal creatures, so William's mate Sara ran in to help just in time to catch a spray from Acosta's shotgun, which also finished off William while only angering the bear.In the end, Sarai got the worst of it out, and I finished off the wretched beast with a plasteel knife to the back of the head. I think Sarai's arm is infected, but we're out of antibiotics and she's the only doctor.As for the married couple, it's going to be a rough night. It's not everyday you bury a friend, get married, then watch your new spouse kill your bonded dog and its mate with a misplaced shotgun blast in the middle of a desperate struggle for your life.Or at least, it's not everyday for places that aren't our quaint little settlement of Dominance.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2016
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								I began a normal 3-man survivor game using Phobe Chillax base builder mode. Along with my 3 survivors, there was Sugar-Plum the cat. I did not name this cat; it was randomly generated. This review revolves around Sugar-Plum the savior of SleepVille.From the start, Sugar-Plum the white cat had it rough. He was awoken from Cryo-sleep and tossed into an escape pod with a large man named Jose (who appreciated animals more than his human counterparts). Upon landing on this terrifying and strange new land, Sugar-Plum began exploring. Occasionally finding the random squirrel to scuffle with or being shooed out of the way for new construction projects, his life was pretty dull. He sometimes saw a distant bear or cougar but he always stayed close to home practicing his hunting skills on squirrels. He had begun to adjust nicely to his new home and animal bed. He wanted to keep it that way.Around countless squirrel (and one turtle) kills later, Sugar-Plum found himself bored and wandering around a new stockpile the humans had just made after trading with the locals. He did it more out of curiosity then anything and since this was his territory, he needed to check it out. He was on his way past the door when something caught his eye. maybe it was the round shape, or maybe there was an odd smell to it, but he had to continue investigating. He slowly sniffed around the package. Used his little hunter’s teeth to rip a small hole and proceeded to paw out some of the packages contents. He sniffed again and since he was feeling rather hungry at that moment and the freezer was so far away, he promptly devoured the small circles. He felt fine at first and suddenly had more energy than ever before. He felt invincible, like he could hunt every scumbag squirrel on this planet in minutes! But then before he knew it poor Sugar-Plum started throwing up everywhere and he passed out in his own puddle of kitty-fur bile until one of the humans found him laying helpless, shamed and barely breathing. This is where things turned bad for poor Sugar-Plum, for he had just eaten the very addictive stimulant "Wake-up". His personal story ends there, but it continues in my perspective. After I got the warning Sugar-Plum had passed out, I quickly read his health tab finding that he now had an addiction to Wake-up. I was furious that he had eaten some of my newly attained drugs and I proceeded to watch his EVERY move. I wanted to catch him in the act again and I even got to the point where I was goading him on in my head. Daring him to do it again while I watched this time so I could mark him for slaughter. I didn't care if he was a founding god damn member of the colony. THERE WOULD BE BLOOD!! Well Sugar-Plum must have read my damn mind because he never went back to the stockpile. Upon kicking his addiction, he developed 5/5 chemical brain damage. Great. Now I was down some precious drugs and stuck with a mentally handicapped cat. I was selling him to the trader ASAP.Called the trader in and was all smiles knowing I could at least cut my losses by selling Sugar-Plum to the trader for 300 silver. I was happy indeed. As the local traders approached, I heard a meow. It was Sugar-Plum. The poor little guy was still outside patrolling and killing squirrels in defense of my colony. My heart sank at the thought of selling my first animal and as I traded my goods, I quietly skipped over selling him.It was a season later that I cracked into the side of a mountain while mining and witnessed a horrific battle between looters and mechanoids. The sole survivor was this disgusting maggot looking mechanoid that fired extremely fast fire explosion rounds. I quickly vacated the area and back to the safety of my colony. I was not prepared for that fight yet. Night approached and all was well, I was safe for now. As my colonists slept I went over plans on how to approach the creature the next day, when out of the corner of my eye I see the horrific creature slowly slinking toward my base! @$%&!! Panic sets in and as I’m rallying my colonists out of bed, its already knocking some of my doors down trying to get revenge for bothering its home. In my panic I failed to realize that all my colonists are rushing out the one door the creatures about to knock down and potentially shoot its fiery death cannon; killing everyone inside. Then to my astonishment the creature suddenly turns back the way it came and fires its deadly blast toward a door it had already destroyed. While my colonists all make it safely past the creature and into defensive positions, I investigate the situation only to find out that poor ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Sugar-Plum had randomly wandered out a side door and distracted the hideous thing. So to wrap things up, my colony successfully incapacitated and killed the creature after brave(?) Sugar-Plum took one for the team. He actually didn’t die (I don’t know how) and good ole Sugar-Plum can still be found around the colony happily hunting squirrels to his heart’s content. But if I ever find him taking drugs again, I swear I’ll mark him for slaughter. 10/10 Would actually never think of selling or slaughtering Sugar-Plum again.

								Thank god my wife got the new Pokemon in the mail the same day I bought this... Otherwise there would have been problems.  Bought this on Last Saturday today is Thursday, I have already sunk 40 hours into the game as I write this.  This is as a grown♥♥♥♥♥man that has a career in one of those office things... speaking of which, this had me up until almost 3am on a Sunday night playing.  Wife forced me to bed... spent entire day at work on reddit reading old Rimworld post looking hung over and feeling like it was a decade ago and I just finished a night of hookers and blow. Only a few games have ever truly made hours pass by in minutes and made me act like a kid not wanting to go to bed(Civilization, Crusader KingsII etc) but... this has done that and done it on a whole new level.Ive been on Steam for over a decade and gaming since the 80s and this is a top 10 game for me of all time of any genre. AND ITS NOT EVEN FINISHED YET.  There are more improvements and additions on the horizon, and I am only excited for them to come so I can do again... an again... and pray Pokemon keeps the wife distracted for at least another few months... years... i dont know.  Reality is I have not even booted up Battlefield 1 since I bought this.  I have computers that run BF1 in ultra settings in 1440p... and I am stuck playing a game that was a 100mb download. someone help me.........................Anywho, support the game it can only get better and is already a amazing game.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								Addictive colony builder with high level of customizability and a space-western theme. I'm a very picky gamer and this one checks all sorts of good boxes.Customizable start conditions right down to what items you start with and what name your pet has if you want one. On high difficulty its about life on a alien world that hates you and wishes you to attempt to survive only so it can watch you suffer longer.On low diffculty its about a colonist or colonists setting up a new life on a new world and becoming comfortable and affluent.Somewhere in the middle I play and wrestle with the advesities the game throws at me while trying to achieve wealth and eventually get my people back into space.15 hours into a colony and after two consecutive raids and injuries sustained (but survived) from grenades my inventors mind just broke and is now wandering around my common area bleeding minorly and starving to death in a stupor. When i tried to arrest him to force him to eat and be treated he went berzerk and stabbed my ex-spy doctor to death nearly instantly. My pet warg ate the corpse of the fallen spy as the ex spys lover discovered the scene and immediately mentally broke killed the inventor in a berzerk fit before being subdued (beaten unconciouss) by the ex-spy's  lover's pet muffalo(buffalo creature).The whole time my chef was preparing meals and as the muffalo beat the lover feet away. He sat down to eat and "relax socially."The whole affair made me laugh uncontrollably at the rediculously unrealistic chef...until i remembered he had the psycopath trait and as rechecked his stats page and re-read that he had the trait "Is uncapable of: caring"Then it was a bit too real and i said tahts enough rimworld for today.

content:
Posted: September 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								Here's a story about the settlement of Escalalan:Gil (Giggles), John (Blitz) and Julio crash landed on a strange planet. Unsure of what to do, they quickly built a small shelter and went to sleep.That night, Blitz told Giggles of his love and they began a lovely romatic relationship.Julio, wakes up the next morning only to be ignored by Giggles as she has fallen madly in love with Blitz, who, proposes to her that very day.With the wedding planned, all was going well in the little settlement until...they came.The beavers came out of nowhere, it was not expected. Julio and Blitz went out to tackle the mennace before the trees were all eaten. Julio reached the beavers first. The first shot was fired and the beavers swarmed. They caused Julio to collapse before turning on Blitz who was trailing behind. The beavers took the oportunity to attack Blitz too. With both of them incapacitated, Giggles was the only one left. She waited until the next morning until the beavers had disperced and took the opportunity to rescue her fiancee and her friend.With both Julio and Blitz recovering in the shack, Giggles now needed to step up and do all of the work and harvest the crops that had been planted a few days ago.Infection set in for both Blitz and Julio and it looked like the end. Blitz managed to develop an immunity but Julio did not. He woke up and completely lost his mind and began to attack Blitz. Giggles, forced to protect her lover, attacked and killed Julio. Despite being a cannibal, Giggles allowed Julio to be burried.One year later and three new people had joined the settlement: Danil, Sienna, and Barrick (the local pirate leader). Giggles and Blitz had been happily married and were spending all of their time together. They managed to just get through the winter, thanks to some amazing hunting skills by Danil and Blitz. However, at the beginning of Spring, everything went downhill. A volcanic winter combined with toxic fallout decimated the settlement with everyone but Barrick coming down with toxic poisoning and with Giggles and Danil developing dimentia. With four out the five settlers unable to move due to severe starvation and Barrick unable to harvest crops, the settlement met an untimely end and thus ends the love story of Blitz and Giggles.10/10 - Would destroy settlement with man eating beavers again

content:
Posted: September 11, 2016
Early Access Review



YouTube™ Video: Rimworld Review [Steam | PC | Early Access] 

			Views: 5,352		

			Rimworld is one of the best games I've ever had the pleasure of playing. This review doesn't even scratch the surface of everything you're able to do.		

Rimworld is a colony simulation, and it's probably my favorite game of 2016 so far. Every colony has it's own specific narrative, even if it fails. The game doesn't necessarily hold your hand, and is a wonderful example of learning through failure to make it just another day, week, month, or year further than your last attempt. Watch my video review for a more in-depth look at Rimworld.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2016
Early Access Review
								Everything was great, sun was shining, colonists were smiling. Then the Pirate Band attacked...RimWorld is a top-down God/Colony simulator. Artistically similar to games like Prison Architect, RimWorld expands on the "do as I have commanded" gameplay of similar top-down titles, and throws in a healthy dose of colonial revolt, complicated romances, creepy breathing and calamity, just to make things exciting.In this story, a colony of 5 that had crash-landed on a an arid, tree-less plain. It was cold, food was scarce and shelter was nowhere to be seen. A few seasons later, the colony was flourishing. Food and medicine a-plenty, other space-faring travellers found salvation when they joined the crew. They had healthy trade relations with other nearby colonies and tribes. A few disagreeances and minor arguments broke out between certain opinionated individuals, but for the most part everything was OK.Then a pet boomalope exploded right in the middle of the trade plaza due to malnourishment. It exploded on one of their trade partners. They didn't like that.Not. One. Bit.A battle broke out, they escaped. They thought they were safe, but it turns out this outlander colony was allied with certain powerful people. Several more seasons passed.Then the siege alarm sounded... the Space Pirates arrived...I can still hear the mortar shells exploding around me... the cries of my colonists in pain... the crackle of the fire burning my colony to the ground...11/10 would accidentally start RimWorld War 3 again.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 14
Early Access Review
								Here is a story. If this doesn't convince you to buy this game, I don't know what will.Day 1.My group of 3 survivors are name Mantis, the builder, Kimeko, the doctor, and Lynn, the hunter and cook. For the first few hours of their new lives, they create a small shelter and beds. Life is great for a while until their food rations start dwindling. Lynn decides to take matters into her own hands and begins hunting the nearby herd of elk. They feast on elk steak all night long.Day 3.The frosty jaws of winter enclose their small settlement, destroying Kimeko's fantasy of creating a small garden to grow vegetables and cotton. To avoid getting dangerously cold, the 3 of them huddle up in their shack to keep warm. After 2 days of imprisonment, cabin fever begins to grip their minds. They fight constantly, their social stances on each other crumbling quickly. Their seemingly endless supply of elk is quickly dimished to a pile of gristle and hide. Unable to take the pains coursing through her stomach, Lynn braves the biting cold, venturing out with the groups only functioning firearm to try and aquire a suitable meal for herself and her companions. As she stumbles through the tundra however, the cold overtakes her, and she is later found by a pack of wolves, who devour her stiff lifeless body.Day 9.Mantis and Kimeko barely cling to life as they sit in the darkness, eating the meager scraps of whatever rodent is unfortunate enough to scurry by. But a revelation occurs to Mantis. Rats arn't the only source of meat available. Within an hour, Mantis sits alone in the cabin, and while is belly is full for now, his mind slips further and further away.Day 14.As Mantis' food finally disappears down his throat for the last time, he can't help but think, "What next?". His body was too malnourished to hunt or gather, his friends were gone. Mantis comes to a decision. I will not succumb. He proceeds to reach into his pocket and pull out a small knife and flat chunk of flint. He carves off strips of wood off the wall next to him and gathers them in the corner. He then scrapes the knife quickly along the flint, causing sparks to fly, into the small pile of kindling. Mantis can feel his body shutting down as the fire builds, quickly engulfing the kindling and a part of the wall, despite the cold. Mantis lies back on the smooth wooden floor and closes his eyes, waiting for death.Day 15.A group of friendly tribesmen, well worn by the years of travelling, come across a destroyed cabin along their journey. While the small wooden structure is badly damaged, fire having obviously scorched it, leaving the remaining wreckage ashen and unmoving. Inside, they find a small amount of seared elk hide, and a corpse, blackened by the flames, with a shard of metal roofing lodged through his chest. They consider the body for a moment, wondering about its story, before carrying on looting it, before finally moving on.To this day, that is my shortest game of RimWorld ever.Buy this game. Its good.

content:
Posted: September 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								Don’t mess with my stuff.Rimworld loves to mess with your stuff. A happy little sci-fi sim, this is not.I just spent two hours researching the technology that allowed me to set up the work station that enabled me to build the improvement that I needed and now here come a bunch of pirates-jerks to smash it all to bits. And kill everyone. And stomp on the flowers.I hate pirates.I hate the fact that I have just spent all this time building a better base for my poor, starving, neurotic, flawed castaways on this backwater, hellhole planet and these punks are now burning, looting and smashing everything that we have worked so hard to build.Sure the game is rock solid. It's great that they are working on updating it all the time.But, Elroy just got shot in the head.My automated defense turret got hit with a grenade and exploded.Tammy, my favorite yellow lab, whom I was delighted we finally taught to haul sacks of potatoes in from the fields, just got killed by a shotgun blast from a dastardly pirate (see comment above about how I feel about pirates). I mean, who shoots a dog?Eva is crying in her dark room. All of her precious research work did little to save her.Wilfred is puking all over the marble floor because the poor bloke got food poisoning from eating uncooked, two-day old turtle meat.Daisy wants a biotic arm. Hawk loves Mikelia, but she’s already married to Wilfred.Jon is cloud watching, oblivious to the death and carnage raging around him. He always was too gentile for this world.Oh, looks like we might get some more toxic fallout today. Maybe someday I'll manage to get someone off this rock.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 5
Early Access Review
								Current Colony Name: Test Community Please IgnoreFaction: Trial and ErrorAI: Cassandra Classic, Rough with Permadeath on Crashlanded  This is the ongoing saga of: Miu, a defector good with guns and medicine. Zebo, a builder and green thumb. Mac, a scientist who dabbles in the culinary arts.After crash landing, our survivors take their belongings to a valley close by. Two large hills provide some natural protection, but the south flank is left completely exposed. Our survivors have a lot of work ahead of them if they want to make this valley a safe settlement. Miu and Mac bring Zebo building materials and soon enough, Zebo has built a solid foundation for the colony. A roofed stockpile is kept just outside of individual rooms connected to a fair sized rec room built into the side of a hill. 3 Solar Panels charge 6 batteries connected to all the appliances in the rec room and a small freezer is built to house food supplies. During the day, Zebo tends to his crops and small construction projects. Miu hunts and hauls. Mac stays glued to the research bench Zebo built in his room, only coming out to cook and eat meals. Raids are few and pose little threat. As fall comes around, Jase, a barkeep, joins the colony. His skill in medicine outmatches Miu's and he's an even better cook than Mac. Our colonists welcome him and Jase quickly becomes a vital part of the community. Soon enough, both east and west flanks of the valley have been sealed by stone walls and doors while Zebo begins building defenses on the southern flank. Thanks to Mac's tireless efforts, the colony is able to build their first auto turret before winter and it easily fends off following raids. One summer day, Zebo proposes to Miu after only being together for 15 days or so, and she miraculously accepts. A marriage date is set in the near future. (So they can get to know each other better XD) Well before winter rolls around, the fridge has been expanded and is stocked with food. A geothermal generator powers a wall of turrets surrounded in sandbags to the south and a secondary wall of turrets powered by wind turbines lay to the north as a final line of defense. Daphne, our husky is pregnant with doggos and our colonists are confident and hopeful. But not for long.Raids quickly become more dangerous and the southern defenses require constant repair and rebuilding. Injuries are common, but luckily, no one sustains a fatal blow. As snow begins to fall, a massive volcanic eruption covers the planet in ash, killing all of Zebo's crops and lowering the temperature further. Luckily, our colonists are well prepared with warm clothing and food. Following an especially dangerous raid on the southern defenses, Zebo and Miu decide they cannot wait any longer and marry in the rec room amongst their fellow colonists. Everyone celebrates and as the marriage ceremony ends, thats when A HERD OF 8 MANHUNTER MUFFALO appear on the horizon and head straight for the eastern entrance to the valley. On the way, they mercilessly slaughter a visiting group of tribals armed with nothing but clubs. They burst through the Eastern door and charge toward the colonists who scramble back into the rec room..only to be followed by Daphne, who reveals their location to two of the herd. The Muffalo start to beat down the wooden door that hides the colonists, but luckily turn away at the last moment. Zebo springs into action and repairs the door by repurposing the wooden stools in the area. Mac goes to his hi-tech research bench to bury himself in books and Jase calms his nerves at the tailoring bench. The colonists are safe for the moment.After spending an inordinate amount of time arguing over where to stay (the zone mechanics are tricky to a newbie) the colonists agree to stay in the rec room and let Zebo deconstruct the walls that block off their individual rooms so that everyone can at least spend the night in their own beds. As Zebo finishes deconstructing the walls, Daphne beelines for a door in one of the rooms. Before the colonists can call her back, she's run outside and the nearest Muffalo sees Zebo. With a guttural roar, the Muffalo charges to the wooden door and beats on it ferociously as the colonists back away from the door. * SMASH*The Muffalo is in! Screaming, the colonists flee to the last bastion of safety: the freezer. They barely make it in as the Muffalo reaches the door, splintering the wood as it attempts to break through. Gun's at the ready, the colonists prepare for their end.. Yet somehow, the door holds! The Muffalo bores of banging its head and backs away to wander the rec room, leaving our colonists trapped in the freezer. Shivering in the cold, their only solace is the  the fact that they won't starve to death. Ironically, death by starvation seemed a far preferable choice over the stampeding Muffalo that now roamed the colony. Eventually, the colonists calm themselves down enough to sleep. The next day, Zebo carefully tears a hole in the wall separating the fridge from the nearest room, and the colonists are able to take shifts sleeping in the bed there. They spend the day talking amongst themselves and dine on a stash of fine meals to keep their spirits high. As day three in the freezer comes around, the muffalo's rage subsides and they fall asleep just outside the rec room. Zebo quickly reseals the broken-down door and begins to fortify the area, while the colonists happily leave the freezer.. when suddenly the comms console makes a garbling noise and a transmission begins to play:"MAYDAY MAYDAY! ANYONE OUT THERE PLEASE RESPOND!!! MY NAME IS CETI AND IM UNDER ATTACK BY MERCENARIES OF THE DEADLY SHANKERS!!" (the faction is actually called this) Upon hearing the voice, Jase sprints to the console and issues a response:"Mother?!! Is that really you!?!? It's me, Jase! Come to these coordinates and we'll provide you with shelter!" The other colonists echo their support, forgetting the rampaging Muffalo just outside their doors for a brief moment. "Thank you so much!! I'm heading to your coordinates now! *after a brief pause* It's good to hear from you son." Too excited at the prospect of seeing his mother again, Jase cuts the comm link before remembering to warn Ceti about the Muffalo herd! Sensing more humans in the distance, the herd awakens and heads straight for Ceti..She sees the clouds of dust from the stampeding Muffalo before she sees them. But by the time she realizes what's happening, there's no where for her to go and Ceti realizes she's trapped. That's when the mercenaries arrive behind her and true to their name, shiv her near to death. Leaving her to bleed out, the merc group from the Deadly Shankers proceeds to mow down the Muffalo herd and head for the southern defenses of the colony. The colonists are able to fend off the brunt of the Deadly Shankers force, capturing one and killing two including their captain before the others flee. Seeing that his mother has yet to return, Jase sets off to rescue his mother while the others stay behind to assess the damage. Jase reaches his mother, the last of her life trickling away..Ceti dies in Jase's arms..Ceti's funeral is short. Jase says nothing other than revealing her profession as a botanist. She's buried by the flowers in Zebo's crops. Following the Muffalo rampage and Ceti's death, there was much work to be done by the colonists. Jase could not keep up with the workload, and combined with the death of his mother, he succumbed to several mental breaks where he wandered the colony aimlessly, foregoing sleep and food. Each time, he was dragged to a hospital bed by Miu and tended to until he got better, but during one of his mental breaks, Jase caught malaria..Miu did everything she could, but for all her efforts, Jase had always been twice the doctor she was, and he quickly succumbed to the disease, dying in a coma and extreme pain.The colonists bury him next to his mother..

								I wanna start off by saying that I generally hate single player games. I absolutely love online player interaction. I love this game and you won't find me playing any single player games besides this one. If there is ever a mutliplayer mode, I ALWAYS play that. This game manages to have enough creativity and story though in just the every day to day survival of your colony in the world of RimWorld.10/10, would say this is one of the best games ever created if it would support online functionality. This game has a lot of potential and is always growing :)!

content:
Posted: December 30, 2016
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								I began a normal 3-man survivor game using Phobe Chillax base builder mode. Along with my 3 survivors, there was Sugar-Plum the cat. I did not name this cat; it was randomly generated. This review revolves around Sugar-Plum the savior of SleepVille.From the start, Sugar-Plum the white cat had it rough. He was awoken from Cryo-sleep and tossed into an escape pod with a large man named Jose (who appreciated animals more than his human counterparts). Upon landing on this terrifying and strange new land, Sugar-Plum began exploring. Occasionally finding the random squirrel to scuffle with or being shooed out of the way for new construction projects, his life was pretty dull. He sometimes saw a distant bear or cougar but he always stayed close to home practicing his hunting skills on squirrels. He had begun to adjust nicely to his new home and animal bed. He wanted to keep it that way.Around countless squirrel (and one turtle) kills later, Sugar-Plum found himself bored and wandering around a new stockpile the humans had just made after trading with the locals. He did it more out of curiosity then anything and since this was his territory, he needed to check it out. He was on his way past the door when something caught his eye. maybe it was the round shape, or maybe there was an odd smell to it, but he had to continue investigating. He slowly sniffed around the package. Used his little hunter’s teeth to rip a small hole and proceeded to paw out some of the packages contents. He sniffed again and since he was feeling rather hungry at that moment and the freezer was so far away, he promptly devoured the small circles. He felt fine at first and suddenly had more energy than ever before. He felt invincible, like he could hunt every scumbag squirrel on this planet in minutes! But then before he knew it poor Sugar-Plum started throwing up everywhere and he passed out in his own puddle of kitty-fur bile until one of the humans found him laying helpless, shamed and barely breathing. This is where things turned bad for poor Sugar-Plum, for he had just eaten the very addictive stimulant "Wake-up". His personal story ends there, but it continues in my perspective. After I got the warning Sugar-Plum had passed out, I quickly read his health tab finding that he now had an addiction to Wake-up. I was furious that he had eaten some of my newly attained drugs and I proceeded to watch his EVERY move. I wanted to catch him in the act again and I even got to the point where I was goading him on in my head. Daring him to do it again while I watched this time so I could mark him for slaughter. I didn't care if he was a founding god damn member of the colony. THERE WOULD BE BLOOD!! Well Sugar-Plum must have read my damn mind because he never went back to the stockpile. Upon kicking his addiction, he developed 5/5 chemical brain damage. Great. Now I was down some precious drugs and stuck with a mentally handicapped cat. I was selling him to the trader ASAP.Called the trader in and was all smiles knowing I could at least cut my losses by selling Sugar-Plum to the trader for 300 silver. I was happy indeed. As the local traders approached, I heard a meow. It was Sugar-Plum. The poor little guy was still outside patrolling and killing squirrels in defense of my colony. My heart sank at the thought of selling my first animal and as I traded my goods, I quietly skipped over selling him.It was a season later that I cracked into the side of a mountain while mining and witnessed a horrific battle between looters and mechanoids. The sole survivor was this disgusting maggot looking mechanoid that fired extremely fast fire explosion rounds. I quickly vacated the area and back to the safety of my colony. I was not prepared for that fight yet. Night approached and all was well, I was safe for now. As my colonists slept I went over plans on how to approach the creature the next day, when out of the corner of my eye I see the horrific creature slowly slinking toward my base! @$%&!! Panic sets in and as I’m rallying my colonists out of bed, its already knocking some of my doors down trying to get revenge for bothering its home. In my panic I failed to realize that all my colonists are rushing out the one door the creatures about to knock down and potentially shoot its fiery death cannon; killing everyone inside. Then to my astonishment the creature suddenly turns back the way it came and fires its deadly blast toward a door it had already destroyed. While my colonists all make it safely past the creature and into defensive positions, I investigate the situation only to find out that poor ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Sugar-Plum had randomly wandered out a side door and distracted the hideous thing. So to wrap things up, my colony successfully incapacitated and killed the creature after brave(?) Sugar-Plum took one for the team. He actually didn’t die (I don’t know how) and good ole Sugar-Plum can still be found around the colony happily hunting squirrels to his heart’s content. But if I ever find him taking drugs again, I swear I’ll mark him for slaughter. 10/10 Would actually never think of selling or slaughtering Sugar-Plum again.

content:
Posted: December 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								To think I very nearly refunded this game! I started playing it, followed the tutorial and it just felt very boring. There was no point in anything, my guys just wondered around or sat doing nothing. I tried clicking to make them do chores etc but it just felt laborious and uninteresting. I'd try to tame an animal and the tamer wench would just stand there chilling. So I logged out and didn’t give it much thought. Then before refunding I decided I’d try it again and actually googling some of the issues i was having. So much of it is customisable, even right down to random people wondering into your camp and being like "HEY IM IN YOUR TEAM NOW, SURE I BURN EVERYTHING IN SIGHT AND I'LL KNIFE YOU IF YOU LOOK AT ME THE WRONG WAY BUT HIGH FIVE!" (It's in customise scenario: D) Everything in this game is a little bit complicated, but even something as stupid as working out how the cabling from solar panels to batteries feels good.I ended up doing the rich explorer scenario a lot mostly because it was easier to just focus on one guy. Just me and my dog chilling, arresting any beach that comes within gun range of my property. I'd put them in prison (to arrest somebody you need to already have built a bed, click it and click the prisoner icon :D), tend to their wounds, chat with them, make them comfortable and then either release them or execute them on the spot and harvest their organs (Traders will buyy that shiz!) I've actually just came off the game...giant lightning storm started a fire near my battery building :( It then spread to my solar panels which then spread to every single building I had. My poor guy tried spending 2 minutes patting one square of fire, meanwhile 600 others had caught. He was so badly burnt he eventually felt to the ground, dropped his weapon and lay there helplessly. My poor dog who I had actually trained to guard me and bond with me, sat by whelping miserably. Sadly there was no rescue party (maybe because i shoot at everyone) and my poor guy succumbed to his infected wounds. RIPWould shoot/arrest everyone again.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 7
Early Access Review
								Most of this is up to you. Who you’re with, what you have, where you start – your choice. What happens to you, however, is a different story. After crash landing on a distant, alien planet, survival is the only goal. Build your base and maintain your colonist’s mental health while balancing intellectual pursuits and territorial control. The AI narrator is ruthless and unforgiving, forcing your space society to deal with everything from natural disasters to bloodthirsty troops of Yorkshire terriers. Who knew sustaining life could be so hard? Witness, firsthand, the flawed dynamics of your very own Adam and Eve or lead ragtag group of tribesman towards civilization. As it turns out, colonizing an alien planet is also a grieving process. Let me walk you through the stages.1. Denial“This’ll be easy”, you think to yourself as the game starts without knowing how absolutely wrong you are. It’ll be dark soon and you don’t even have a bed to sleep in yet. 2. AngerChopping down trees for a bed frame and four walls seems like a menial task. How borin...oops! The tree came down and crushed your leg. That’s going to slow things down.3. BargainingThankfully a band of traders is passing by your camp. They take pity and offer you a discounted peg leg. Score! Might as well get a few other supplies while you’re at it.4. DepressionYou shouldn’t have traded so much of your food for those supplies. Now you're hungry. And everyone you meet thinks you're weird because of your peg leg. Did those guys rip you off? 5. AcceptanceAt least you had the extra materials to finish building a spare room. You also fought off a deranged marauder and took him, and his two fresh legs, prisoner. Things are looking up. Almost anything is possible (thanks to a loyal modding community) and you’re given the opportunity to micromanage every aspect of the action or just sit back and watch it like a fish tank filled with interesting space creatures. Rarely is a game everything you ever wanted it to be. RimWorld is impossibly deep and equally entertaining. You won’t be disappointed.

Early Access Review
								TL:DR - Strongest contender for best city/colony management game 2016 Good core game design and active mod community lead to fantastic game.  Every playthrough is randomized enough to not be "Samey" but not so much that tactics you learn are incompatible. It builds on all the other city building games we've seen in the last few years (Gnomoria, Towns, Dwaf Fortress, etc) and improves on what made those games interesting. Temperature management, surgery for organ damage, monster rancher, forest fire fighting, and so much more with the mods.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 3
Early Access Review
								RimWorld is one of those games you could play every day for the rest of your life and have a completely different outcome each and every time. If you put into perspective the amount of random generation and events, then look further at the amount of details like relations between colonists, capturing enemies or even having your own colonists captured right down to their types of injuries.. you can tell a story.It's a library of books, each game a brand new cover. Will you build a ship and escape or succumb to the dangers and mishaps around you? Will the favorite character who has fantastic shooting and a friendly face get mauled by a megasloth? Nobody knows. There is no script, only a story to be written after.Aside from all of that, completely independent of it, this game supports mods. As we see from games like Garry's mod, mods can make a game immortal. Already, even before the game is done, there is a fantastic modding community adding things that we can only hope will be added by the developers.TL;DR - Imagine prison architect 3000 years in the future except it's not a prison, it's the entire world. Oh and it has about twice the features and complexity. Plus mods.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								I put off buying this, ignoring recommendations from pretty much all of my friends .. I have a LOT of games, so with Early Access I tend to wait and see how they turn out before adding more to the list... That was dumb of me, after much convincing I went and bought it .. And for the past couple of days, it's the only game I've played. The developer is extremely active, and it's clear that they are passionate about making this perfect. They're often adding improvements, technology changes, and goals. Not only that, they allow you to roll back when there's a major update that may affect your save games. The difficulty of it can be somewhat brutal, I think I lasted about 45 minutes in my last game, maybe less. But that's one of the things I like most about it. Too many games these days hold your hand, and it's all over in a few hours. This game however, is dynamically generated, has multiple ways to play, and multiple difficulty levels; from hard, right through to pants on head crazy.Another excellent thing is the amount of community mods, there are bucketloads of them to be used, some completely changing the game, and that just increases every day.I can't recommend this enough, even at full price (which I paid), it's worth every penny.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								Rimworld is a colony sim game run by a one-developer shop. The game consists of picking a starting location, some colonists that will do the surviving, and a storyteller that creates the challenges you'll face.Through the game you'll build your colony, manage assets like raw resources, food, colonist mental health, colonist physical health (damn bullets), defenses and a host of other things! Rimworld keeps you on your toes as you expand and build necessities to survive challenges like Raiders, crop blights, electrical fires, man-hunting animals, disease and a host of other horrible, horrible things.The UI is simplistic but easy to navigate, allowing you to make adjustments to allow efficiency in playing the game.The fun thing is that every time you play, you learn a little more about what works and what doesn't work. The most fun is at the beginning, when you're struggling to survive in a harsh environment with an AI storyteller that wants you to SQUIRM. I definitely recommend enabling permadeath to remove save scumming, and it's hilarious to watch your colony get destroyed in the most unanticipated of ways.Rimworld also boasts a combat engine that has an extra tactical layer than what these games usually have. Distance/cover/weapon type/hit location all come into play. Sometimes your colonists are fine, other times they're down a finger/hand/leg/eye/kidney (especially kidneys!).Overall, I play this game obsessively every time a new release is out (one dev shop, takes some time but damn is it worth the wait). Definitely worth the money!
